text: Our hotel room was rather disgusting.  The carpet is full of stains and the wallpaper is pealing off of the wall in the bathroom.  As you will see in one of my pictures they have a holder in the bathtub for decent size bottles of shampoo, conditioner and soap.  The holder locks which I assume is so that nobody can steal their products.  However, the soap wasn't in the locked container.  I guess that is so that their guests can carry that soap back and forth between the shower and the sink because that was the only soap in the room.  Also, the large bottle for conditioner was completely empty.  It seemed more like a $59.99 room instead of a $159 room.  Very disappointing.  Also, it is quite a long walk outside to get to the casino.  Luckily it was decent weather while we were there.
title: Hollywood Casino & Hotel Joliet

text: Ok, the casino is sharp and they give high marks to the restaurant there as it was featured on some tv show but I can't vouch for that. text:
I was excited to stay at this haunted hotel until I checked into the hotel. The lady at the check-in deck, didn't get her name, was upset and rude when I asked if I could stay in one of the haunted rooms. This is how our convo went:

Her response: "we don't have any. Because we aren't haunted."

My response: "oh that's not what I read online."

Her response: "Idk where you read that because this hotel isn't haunted."

Keep in mind she is saying this as a total Karen.

My response (joking tone): "weird. Better not tell you the website then (laugh.)"

Her response: "no you better go ahead and tell me the website so we can get it taken down. Tell me now. What is it?"

Me: "idk the website"

Her as I walk outside to get my bags from the car: grabs phone to probably look up website.

Overall, I loved the history of the hotel. Its a shame that they added a casino to the old Ball Room. Vintage is what's popular right now. The hotel is owned by the Silverado across the street, maybe keep the slot machines in the Silverado and restore the old Ball Room? People my age would dance and have a good time in the Ball Room to any music. Square Dancing, hip-hop, ect.
title: Silverado Franklin Historic Hotel & Gaming Complex, Legends Steakhouse & Silverado Grand Buffet

text:
Hotel rooms are not great. They have not been updated since the early 1900s. The room my family and I stayed in had 2 bedrooms and a kitchen room that had the sink drains covered with a sign saying " Do not use sink ". The bedrooms didn't have doors. The only bathroom was very small and was in the room with the two beds. The king bedroom used to have a bathroom but the door was locked with a table pushed up against it. In the entry room there was a big closet room where the king bathroom used to be,  which obviously was not useable. The entry door wouldn't lock. I had to stick a folded up card behind the door lock to make it latch properly. I was worried about a fire in the old building. I made sure I knew where the fire escapes were. One was out of a window in the main hallway that led to the fire escape stairway. Room left a lot of room for improvement.
The gambling hall was old but had some new remodeled bathrooms with gold bars and new tile.
The dining room downstairs was very nice. Newer design features with newer bathrooms too. Could get down to restaurant from the elevator.
title: Silverado Franklin Historic Hotel & Gaming Complex, Legends Steakhouse & Silverado Grand Buffet

text: The Legends steakhouse is by far my absolute favourite place to eat in the entire state. Their service is always on point and I have ordered from every corner of that menu and am yet to be disappointed. Love it!

It loses a star because some of the food had been sitting in the buffet for a while and started to dry out, but this is understandable as it wasn't very crowded on a weekday. I would recommend this if someone is looking for a prime rib buffet in the deadwood area.

text: Always a great time at Nickelodeon. So many different rides to choose from. I suggest so on a weekday cause weekends are always jam packed. They have Toddler Tuesdays and special deals with that. It's better to get points on your tickets instead of wristbands if you don't plan on being there all day and plan on coming another time.
title: Nickelodeon Universe¬Æ

text: Nickelodeon Universe is awsome and amazing. Its more of a thriller ride place but there are some little kid rides. I 100% recommended the Fairly Odd Parents as its fun not to scary and is worth going twice! The photo mentioned is a restaurant we went that was off Nickelodeon called First Round. Its a sports restaurant and is totally recommended. Its great for sports you get food fast and it tastes good!
title: Nickelodeon Universe¬Æ

text: We love Nickelodeon Universe!!!! They've got rides for toddlers, big kids and adults; face painting, caricatures, airbrush shirts. I've taken my kids multiple times and we all love it. Perfect anyday, especially if the weather outside is rainy/snowy/cold. Family friendly. Relatively clean environment. Nice selection of thrill and not so intimidating rides. I haven't experienced it, but they have a quiet/low stimulation room for those with autism as well. We went around Xmas and I was expecting crazy crowds. But it wasnt bad at all. There may be long lines for some rides but they move pretty fast. Most popular rides may have 30-40 minute wait times. There are places to sit and restrooms sprinkled throughout Nick Universe so you dont have to roam through the mall to find relief. Less crowded in the evenings after dinnertime. Wristbands allow all day access and wristband packages let you experience Nick Universal and other attractions like Sea World, Crayola Experience, mini golf, escape rooms, Fly Over America, etc. You can leave and come back to see the universe all lit up. It's a family favorite for us!!
title: Nickelodeon Universe¬Æ

text: Definitely fun for everyone. We went on a Monday and got there basically as they opened. For about an hour lines were very short but around 11:30 the crowds started picking up. Even though some lines were longer we got through them pretty quickly. Surprisingly the restrooms were still pretty clean throughout the day considering how busy it was. Definitely recommend if you have the time for it.
title: Nickelodeon Universe¬Æ

text:
We were entertained. It's definitely worth arriving early as it got busy fast. We were all surprised that they didn't have any in person kiosks open to sell points. The automated kiosks' lines were super long. It would have been nice to have at least double the number of automated kiosks given the demand.

The lines were reasonable, but it did get busy fast. You almost need a few more maps around as there are a number of dead ends. We enjoyed ourselves but left before it got too busy. We will be back again.
title: Nickelodeon Universe¬Æ

text: Visited all the way from Texas. Inside the Mall of America ( largest mall in the US) I loved it was free parking. Price for park was affordable. $40 a ticket for an all day pass.  Visited on a Tuesday ( had Toddler prices for my 3 yr old) only downside was not all rides were open. Park is a Lil small but the kids enjoyed it . It really does have great rides for the small area. I enjoyed the rides too.

The other negative part was the pool, my daughter was only able to swim once due to the extremely over chlorinated water. It was hard to sit in there it was so bad. text:
Thanks for the great stay Hyatt Eden!!  A group of us drove from Winnipeg to Minneapolis to catch a Vikings game. We were concerned this hotel was too far away but it didn‚Äôt turn out to be an issue. It‚Äôs easy enough to drive around the city. Maybe took us half hour to get downtown. The Harley store, Target and Menards are close to the hotel so that was nice.

The rooms are big!! King Bed comfy, shower pressure great and lots of hot water!!!  Pull out sofa.
Could have easily had 4 adts share the king room.

Front staff check in was pleasant. They didn‚Äôt realize we were all traveling together so they ended up placing us on different floors. But that was our fault for not speaking up.
We also didn‚Äôt speak up about having a room away from the elevators. It was annoying to be woken up super early from guests checking out and kids running up and down the hallway etc. By the elevator. Things yah just don‚Äôt think about sometimes.

We would all stay here again!!
title: Hyatt Place Minneapolis/Eden Prairie

text:
I stayed here for a few nights after a work trip so I could visit with family before the holidays. The room was nice, but needed some tlc. There were a few spots on the ceiling where the plaster was noticeably cracked and bubbled, as well as a large spot where it was missing. The curtain was also a tad stained.

Other than those small issues, everything else the room was in great condition. The room was well-cleaned and both the sofa and bed were comfortable. I generally prefer to stay at this location as it's quieter then staying near the airport. The staff here is also very friendly and accommodating, which is a huge plus for me.
title: Hyatt Place Minneapolis/Eden Prairie

text: The bed was very comfortable.  Not to far from MOA. Another Mall is 1/2 mile away with a theater and target attached. Pool was clean and fully stocked with towels. Staff was friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

text: Awesome place. Killer 80's arcade classics and decor  . The food is excellent and priced right. Good fun for the whole family.
title: CityCade Classic Arcade and Pinball Game Bar, Gastonia NC

text:
I finally got a chance to check this place out. Most of the barcades are in Charlotte so it's nice to have one close to home. I went on a Thursday night which is "guys night" and was welcomed as soon as I walked in, both the owners and the guests were very friendly. For Thursdays, about all games were free (at least for dudes) except for pinball, which were .50 a game. Normally it's $5 a person for unlimited play and pinball is $1.00 a game (ouch to $1.00 pinball!). There were maybe 6 to 12 people rotating in and out while I was there, so not crowded at all. Parking was abundant. It's about a 5 minute walk from Freeman's. Bar can turn cash to quarters or can give you quarters from your bar tab for a 10% surcharge. Bar had food and drinks at fair prices. There are 2 gender neutral restrooms. There are a few TV's playing sports and comic book movies and YouTube videos. Place was open until midnight on a weeknight which was cool. There was one tv hooked up to a Nintendo 64 with a pretty large assortment of games. There were a couple party/board games sitting near a table. There was a fairly large area for outdoor seating as well. I think what made this visit special was how friendly the owners and guests were, felt like you were just visiting old friends instead of strangers.

EDIT: Citycade did a reconfiguration and brought in a racing game, a shooting game, a beer pong game and a couple of pay to win games disguised as games of skill. I believe at this point they've gotten rid of the $5 cover entirely and just made the machines take quarters, which I think was a good move. Pinball is still a buck which is a bummer since there are better options out there for $.50 a game, but it's close to home at least and the price point isn't uncommon. Pinball seems maintained and Citycade has occasionally swapped out for different pins, which is nice. Bathrooms are always clean which is a plus. Only complaint is that sometimes it can get a bit hot in the building.
title: CityCade Classic Arcade and Pinball Game Bar, Gastonia NC

text: Just went here for the first time and loved it. Good 80‚Äôs music playing the background and really cool arcade machines including classic games and newer pinball tables like Stranger Things and The Mandalorian, not to mention the big 2 player shoot ‚Äòem up Terminator game. Places like this are hard to find anymore and I really appreciated it. Thanks guys!
title: CityCade Classic Arcade and Pinball Game Bar, Gastonia NC

text:
Challenging course. Gorgeous sweeping views. 1) If you buy the Costco vouchers, call ahead. We were fortunate enough to talk with the Pro to validate ours, but he was very forward that we would not be able to play on a Saturday/holiday again.
2) Good people.
3) Interesting carts (you MUST ride the course). DO NOT get close to the green or the cart will shut down. Not fun. There needs to be a better verbal warning.
4) USE the electronic ordering system as you turn the 15th or 16th hole. The kitchen is slow and even more so if you are hungry.

text:
We have lived in NC for 8 years and I wish we had discovered this place sooner!! This museum is fantastic for all ages.

From the life-size dinosaurs to the tiny creepy crawlers, my kids were engaged and eager to learn at every turn.

We came during a free Duke Energy Tuesday....they offer free admission twice a month and it wasn't crowded at all! I don't think many people know about the discount.

Everyone we saw was properly masked and social distancing wasn't an issue.

I can't wait to come back to check out The Farm and the planetarium!!
title: The Schiele Museum of Natural History & Planetarium

text:
The museum had some really nice exhibits an dinosaurs, and 'Creepy Nature' as well as a good permanent exhibit area.  The 'farm' area was a little disappointing, but that was probably due to it being November.   There were no staff around to answer questions or monitor the area that we could see.
The planetarium was small, but did a neat little show on the night sky.  Some of the non-sky images were blurry, and the show was definitely geared toward a younger audience than my just turned teenager, but we still enjoyed it.  Overall, I think it was well worth the $ and the time to make the stop while we traveled through the area!
title: The Schiele Museum of Natural History & Planetarium

text: We went to see the baby farm animals and then went inside the museum. My 2 year old loved it! It truly is fun for the entire family!
title: The Schiele Museum of Natural History & Planetarium

text: The planetarium show was fun and informative, the presentation was animated and had great energy. All in all it was a nice experience.
title: The Schiele Museum of Natural History & Planetarium

text: We absolutely had a ball, my kids loved the exhibits and they have added a lot of extra things to do.
title: The Schiele Museum of Natural History & Planetarium

text: I stopped to visit the museum while I was in the area. It has many exhibits that are typical of a natural history museum such as dinosaurs, minerals/rocks, eco system displays, birds, bugs, and other animals. It had an American Indian section and a specific North Carolina area which I thought were neat. There were also live animals in some places and I wasnt expecting that. The creepy house and exhibition was very interesting to me because it was based on a real person's experience finding out what was true or false in nature. Overall I would recommend it, some of the areas just seemed small to me or a little older.
title: The Schiele Museum of Natural History & Planetarium

text: Best museum around Charlotte. Covers all educative for kids.  Very well maintained and most helpful staffs. I only wish it had some eat out place inside to spend more time.

text: Live animal exhibits were WAY too small for said animals and the care was very dissapointing. As someone who does reptile rehabilitation it was really sad seeing resident animals live in such conditions.  most of the taxidermy pieces in this museum also need to be revived. Most were dry and cracking and alot of the pieces made me laugh because of how unrealistic they looked. Mineral exhibit was pretty cool and the planetarium show was nice.
title: The Schiele Museum of Natural History & Planetarium

text: This is a great museum!  It's very family and kid friendly.  This is our 2nd visit and last time the room upon entering was a science room with blocks and such.  This time it was a dinosaur exhibit for kids (kid's dinosaur books, some real fossils, discovery stations, etc)  The animal farm is now open but most of the animals were not available (probably due to the cold weather).  The staff there is very friendly and helpful.  We caught a movie at the planetarium and it was very good.   The screen is not the best quality but it was adequate.  When the weather is nice, the nature walk is lovely!  The pond, trails, and streams are beautiful.  Some of the pics I posted are from last year when it was warmer out.  The outdoor play area is great for the kids (again, weather permitting!)  Admission is reasonable but the planetarium shows are extra but still reasonably priced.
title: The Schiele Museum of Natural History & Planetarium

text: On this beautiful Saturday we decided to visit the outdoor areas. We had previously been inside and viewed the exhibits. There is a planetarium with a variety of shows that change from week to week. The outdoor areas include a ‚Äúfarm‚Äù with goats , chickens, and alpacas. There is a garden with a wide variety vegetables and fruit growing. The trails lead along a stream and showcase a time from history where technology did not make everything as easy as we have it today. Great outdoor space for the family.
title: The Schiele Museum of Natural History & Planetarium

text: Great museum with friendly staff and lots to enjoy with the family. Free Fridays are a plus. Only 4 stars because the animal exhibits inside are set up with plastic plants (specifically turtles, owl, fish, gators and birds). Please update these habitats for their health and well-being. They look sad.
title: The Schiele Museum of Natural History & Planetarium

text:
Upon visiting Charlotte, I found myself a bit disappointed with the apparent slim variety in museums. That's why I was so happy to find this quaint little place out in Gastonia.

I'm easy to please. I see a well put together museum of natural history with informative infographics and I'm happy.
title: The Schiele Museum of Natural History & Planetarium

text:
The kids absolutely loved this place. Best money I've ever spent for an outing with the kiddos. The planetarium started the tour and the kids were amazed! Very interactive with even the youngest. There's tons of exhibits, the place just keeps on going and going. It honestly took the better part of 4 hours. Then the outdoor educational section with live animals. Pigs, goats, chickens, roosters, etc, etc. Even dinosaur fossils to check out. Many many live creatures in tanks as well. Owls, snakes, softshell turtles
And a native American section that's very large in itself. We will definitely not hesitate to come back every time we pass through this area. Finally been satisfied with what we get for the cause when it comes to entertaining four kids ages 2,4,6, and 8. Absolutely had a great time as an adult too.
title: The Schiele Museum of Natural History & Planetarium

text: Fairly busy on a Saturday around 11. This is our second visit here as a family. Cost was around $14. It was too cold for us to walk and check out the farm animals outside (additional charge).We had more fun on our first visit, second visit the kids weren't that interested. Small discount if you are a Gastonia resident. We haven't done the planetarium yet (additional charge)
