text: Absolutely lovely! My friend and I often pass this little nook of a Thai place. It was really our luck to stop in. The duck was absolutely amazing and crispy. Their curries steal the entire show. Lovely little well lit place. Delicious food and I'm so excited to spend more money there!!
title: Thai Tamarind

text: Such a lovely, warm setting.   Excellent customer service.  They went above and beyond for the child in our party.  We really enjoyed the food.  Parking out front, comfy seating.  Reasonable prices and good portions.   New favorite restaurant.
title: Thai Tamarind

text: Went to lunch here Saturday with my son. Limited parking in front of the restaurant but plenty of street parking nearby. Staff and service were excellent and cordial. Our Spicy Prig khing and Pad Thai were fresh, well-prepared, and visually appealing. I love the spices and asked for a five on their scale of five. It was delicious but not nearly as hot as I expected. Overall a great meal and I'd definitely recommend.
title: Thai Tamarind

text: Very good Thai, love eating there and always get great service.
title: Thai Tamarind

text:
SUPERB AUTHENTIC THAI in the Pittsburgh area, a short 15 min drive from downtown.  Cozy restaurant with no-touch menu, short and sweet. It looks a popular spot to locals of many persuasions. Takeout or sit in (I have done both), it‚Äôs simply excellent food. A FOODIE‚ÄôS GEM.

Start with Fresh Rolls and Fried Eggplant, contrasting but complementary textures and sweet tangy sauces that wake up the palate (very much unlike the cliche peanut sauce in the run of mill Thai-style places.

Any of the curry entrees are very good, smooth well-balanced sauces; none of that pungent sugar-loaded curry so common in so-called Thai restaurants in this town.

My recommendation: Duck Curry, very crispy well seasoned perfectly cooked duck atop the smooth Red curry with bell peppers and cherry tomatoes, carefully balanced with two halves of lychee just enough to brighten the palate: Simply Wow!

Pair the curry with any of the Thai stir fry veggies.  I‚Äôm partial to the Hot Basil fry, extra veggies (natural sweetness of the fresh vegetables complemented with their brown sauce).

By the way, enjoy Thai food with a spoon rather than fork/knife. Spoon the curry or veggies on rice, mix, then enjoy. Spoon allows one to taste every drop of the sauce.

Great service!
title: Thai Tamarind

text:
Well, it wasn't anywhere NEAR as good as a few years back but the presentation was decent. Of course the prices went up, lol. An almost 3 star. Almost. Sadly I can NOT recommend  Thai Tamarind any longer since the flavors were incredibly weak and/or bland; so much tasted like it came from a jar and the top of the line "thai spicy" was a powder they sprinkled on top of every dish when presenting your level of spicy. Some of the powder hadn't fully dissolved during your meal so you would gets little clumps of it in your mouth. The "so-called" Thai Iced Tea I had tasted as if it were a syrup from a bottle. Yech!

Pictured you have the Tom Yum soup, Volcano Chicken and the Thai Style Chicken Noodle. All bland and weak. Not pictured but as an appetizer we had the chicken satay, another huge let down since when eaten with a homemade peanut sauce or cucumber sauce, it is DELICIOUS! The peanut sauce seems to have some type of dairy added to it. Gross.

Seated WAY in the back corner in the last pic you'll see your "typical American Ken", who did nothing but complain from he moment he sat down. Entitled as "F".
DONT EAT HERE IF YOU DISAPPROVE of the restaurant or its style a**hole!
title: Thai Tamarind

text: Great food , friendly staff and beautiful setting.
title: Thai Tamarind

text:
Wonderful environment and delicious food. Zeta, our server, was ON IT. So sweet and attentive. First time here even though my home is so close, and I‚Äôm so happy to know I can get such authentic food nearby. They‚Äôve definitely earned a loyal customer!
PS. Try the spring rolls, I got a surprise one with my salad and I liked it so much I ordered a whole side.
title: Thai Tamarind

text: One of my favorite places. The food is excellent and the homey coffee shop atmosphere is just warm and inviting! I always get the dumplings to start. They are little pillows of happiness lol. For the entree I usually get noodles Hawaiian style w/Shrimp. (no egg, no tails)  Depending on the night, if you get takeout, you may find a little something extra in the bag!
title: Thai Tamarind

text: The place is adorable.  Small staff that was really nice and attentive.  She manages the dining room and take out but balanced it well.  The food was really delish and fresh.  I had shrimp and scallop and fried egg roll.  It is BYOB with no stem charge.  Will definitely go back
title: Thai Tamarind

text: Thai Tamarind is a find and a jewel in Bellevue. Decided to pay a visit when hanging out with a friend for lunch and was the perfect choice. Good atmosphere, great staff and tasty food. I ordered a fried rice with cashew nuts and pineapple and even ten minutes the dish came to our table, it continued to be warm and fresh.
title: Thai Tamarind

text:
I live directly up the street from this place on Washington Ave and I have got to say that I am absolutely disappointed with their quality of food.  Today, I just recently ordered their Pad Kee Mao and it looked like someone chewed up the meal and spit it right back out into the carry out tray.  The noodles were overly soggy and mushed up like mashed potatoes.  The salad that comes with the Lunch looks as if someone cut out a large chunk from a piece of lettuce, threw it into the tray, and then decided to splash a little sauce on top of it.

I don't normally complain about food and most times I simply ignore the mistakes but I've been living in Bellevue for 3 years now and this incident has happened more than once.  A customer can only be patient so many times and then there comes a point where a enough is enough.  This restaurant will never receive my services ever again.  I don't know if it's the cook or the management but the quality of food is poor.  Years ago the food was much better. I'm not sure what happened between then and now.

If you want a quality restaurant for Thai food, go to Niky's Thai Kitchen.  I promise you, Niky's Thai Kitchen is the better choice.  Their food quality is suburb compared to Thai Tamarind, especially for the price you'll pay for it.

Please observe the images attached for evidence.
title: Thai Tamarind

text: Delicious curry and great service! Very cute atmosphere.
title: Thai Tamarind

text: Hard working people delivering excellent service. I consider this place one of Pittsburgh's hidden treasures.
title: Thai Tamarind

text: Bed sheet had a stain. Shower had hair that was not mine.
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa

text:
Great place for the money. Staff are nice and accommodating as they were prompt in responding to my special requests. The rooms are redone now and have a more contemporary look. Rooms are big enough and feel good... i didn't like the floors or why they clean them. The floors are laminate and with extra cleaning product it felt slippery and I almost slipped.
Otherwise I like this place and will continue to stay here.
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa

text: One of my favorite spots on the Connecticut Shore; close to Mystic Seaport and Watch Hill Rhode Island. We try to get down there at least three times a year during the spring and summer seasons. Just a great place to go for a romantic weekend.
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa

text: This hotel is AMAZING!! For the price and what you get it is WELL worth it!! My fiance and I stayed here to go to see Brantly Gilbert and Dylan Scott which was very convenient being 15 min away. The rooms were very modern and upscale. Very clean, staff was very friendly and offering assistance throughout our stay. They have a buffet breakfast that was better than any hotel I've ever stayed in. It was real fresh food not that processed stale taste. A chef makes omletes with your fillings right in front of you. They have a upscale restaurant called the OCTAGON it is pricey but well worth it. We had ours delivered via room service!! Their filet mignon is to die for. I highly recommend this hotel and I will be staying with them again
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa

text: Would leave a higher rating if it wasn't a 4 star hotel. My room looked out to the rooftop and a tall white wall around its perimeter. Couldn't see anything but the wall and a little sky, and the windows were quite dirty. Not a big deal for a business stay, but if we're paying weekend prices at a 4 Star hotel, it seems sub-par. ($876 incl. taxes for two nights) Needed to go down to the desk at one point on Saturday evening and couldn't find someone to acknowledge me for five minutes. That said, the rooms were kept clean and breakfast service was nice.
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa

text: Great stay at the Mystic Marriott, hotel and spa. I was a little reluctant before staying there, having read a few negative reviews, but my stay was extremely pleasant. The staff was very helpful and introduced all the hotel amenities to us. The rooms were modern, clean and well equipped. The indoor pool is also good for some winter time fun. the breakfast buffet at the octagon restaurant is very diverse and filling.
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa

text:
This place was fantastic! The staff were amazing! The rooms were very nice, but the interior design sucked. Marriott corporate, hire a decorator that has actually stayed in a hotel room!

You have to walk a long way to your rooms. It would be nice if there was another elevator.

The concierge was amazing and went above and beyond, but the lounge was small and there weren't enough food options.

The food at the restaurant in the hotel was really good. The lobby is a great place to meet and they have free flavored water. Plenty of free parking.

For the hospitality alone, I will certainly come back the next time I'm in the area.
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa

text: CLEAN place to stay but is under renovation.  A few mis steps with the renovation- shower has no trays, glass work area top looks good but an optical mouse doesn‚Äôt work, nice air handler but it made a banging noise every time it started, small sink area barely enough room for a guys toiletries let alone 2 peoples stuff, LOTS of towels was good.  They put me in a handicap room so I don‚Äôt know yet what a standard room is like but this one was probably roomier than standard.  Buffet breakfast was OK but not great - all employees were very nice!
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa

text: Potential to be a great hotel, however my stay in room 537 left a lot to be desired. Room wasn't ready when's we arrived after 4 P.M..  Had to get ready for a wedding, so we changed into our finest in a locker room.  Came back after midnight and we were given a room without A/C, just a noisy fan from the front desk to keep cool by. Room was sparsely appointed with no chair for the desk or chair for that matter to relax in.  To tired to request a different room, so we just crashed on the heavenly beds until morning.  Bathroom appeared to be recently refurbished, but otherwise great.  Breakfast was great, but had to wait a half hour to be seated.  Staff was always warm and helpful.
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa

text:
I've stayed at a lot of Marriotts because of business trips in the past 10 years. They usually don't fall below a certain standard, but it seems in this case they did.

The rooms were pricey and we had booked a room with 2 queen beds and they gave us a room with a king and a sofa bed. Now you might think of this as an upgrade if you had a couple booking the room, but this was for 3 people and getting a sofa bed when you have paid for a queen. When i mentioned this in the app, they said they would fix it the next day and they did, and they have us the room right next to ours which made for a very easy transfer through the connecting door, which is what raised my review from 1 star to 2.

I suspect they changed our booking because they were having a convention and needed the room but this isn't an acceptable reason.

Other things that bothered me were the cleanliness of the rooms. I attached a couple of photos showing what our floor was like in the first room and the dirt inside the coffee maker. In both rooms, the coffee makers were terrible with one even having hair in it.

Finally it saddens me to see a sad attempt to look progressive with 3 places to charge an electric car. 2 Tesla spots of which 1 was it of order and 1 for non Tesla electric cars.

If you want to add electric car charging to your hotel add 10 spots not have a token amount and not even functional

I think they rely on the event housing so much they don't really care about their amenities is status of their rooms so much. Because every night we were there they had all least 2 events going on.

For the price and the quality, might as well just stay in mystic close to everything. I don't think I will be going back to this specific Marriott.
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa

text: Very nice place with great food. The breakfast buffet was top notch. The swimming pool was a little cold but was still nice. We are going back soon.
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa

text: Nice modern hotel with a big pool. Rooms are spacious & clean. Gym had plenty of machines & exercise equipment. Starbucks is also on premises. BEWARE of the bar restaurant for takeout food. Was sitting at bar having a beer, decided to take food to go, was charged a 15% service charge for food to go. I confirmed it the next day a the front desk. The Marriott has no control over this charge it‚Äôs the restaurants policy. See the pic of the receipt.
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa

text: Newly renovated lobby and rooms.  Love the new layout and renovations.  The rooms are modern and clean.  The floors are laminate so very different from the carpeted floors they had before. I personally liked them but some people prefer carpet.  I wish they had given me slippers to wear in the room as that would have made it more comfortable.
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa

text:
It's a high quality hotel featuring a spa, restaurant, and contemporary rooms.  Reception was friendly and attentive and offered me bottled water and fresh fruit.  The rooms were modern with sliding door showers, a chaise lounge, and a desk.

I'm not particularly fond of hard ceramic hotel room floors as they can be noisy when someone drops something on them (in the middle of the night).  Additionally, I found the bed and pillows to be uncomfortably soft.  I sank down into the bed and could never quite get comfortable.  Maybe I could have slept better on the floor.
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa

text: The wings at the resturant are great! Nice quiet, clean and proffesional atmospere. There is also a Starbucks in the hotel. It was never too busy to walk right up, very quick delivery of my coffee. Thank you for a great experience.
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa

text: I had high expectations for this property based on its category and price range. It did not deliver in accordance to its value and how it was advertised. The room I was initially given was not properly cleaned. There were clear signs that the fitted sheet was not laundered. I had to switch rooms, which unfortunately was a downgrade, and there were cleanliness issues in that room as well. The room amenities were lacking, which again is surprising based on category and price. The spa was closed, as well as the hot tub. Those items played a big role in my decision, so I was quite disappointed to find out they were closed. Why didn't the price and category reflect these changes. They are being very misleading, and that's enough to turn me away from Marriott properties. My main concern is they are still advertising as if they have everything together during these times and are charging inflated prices. I am highly upset I did not receive what was expected and now feel like my money put into this property is a major loss. The only thing that was nice is the customer service of the front office staff. The lady taking our breakfast room service order was a little off putting. There was a mistake made with my order. I called to let her know but she seemed upset at me for letting her know their mistake. It was corrected, but her tone was unsettling. The toast was overcooked and stale. Everything else, the omelet, pancakes, chicken sausage, bacon, and potatoes, was made fine. Unfortunately, I will not be returning to this property and do not recommend it.
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa

text: I visited the location for a conference. Very spacious meeting areas. Use of conference reception for attendees and customer service oriented staff were greatly appreciated. The images are if the conference spaces and exterior of the hotel and events.
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa

text: Room is clean. Great service. Location is great if you drive a car. Not much stores within walking distance.
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa

text: The staff was awesome.  We enjoyed our stay.   I believe it was Tina whip was our dining room attendant.  Most helpful and over the top enthusiasm!
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa

text: It was a very enjoyable stay, it was recently updated with the most modern conveniences there's a new Starbucks restaurant in the facility The breakfast buffet was outstanding. There's a new bar in the establishment but I did not attend or use it but it looks very inviting.
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa

text: Lots of meetings and weddings happening in this large hotel. Rooms were nice, staff was very helpful, and the breakfast was good. My only negative comment was that the 3 EV chargers on site were in TERRIBLE condition. We could only sometimes get 1 to work. It is a very nice perk when available.
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa

text: Modern inside look, great breakfast being 5 stars.  The beds were way too soft and warn.  There was no moisturizer in the room, but mostly clean room.  The bathroom was tight including a smaller than normal toilet. The overnight volume from wedding parties all night long was leaving many guest with little sleep.
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa

text: Great service, nice ambiance in various areas, nice fitness center and clean room. Will stay again when I'm in the area
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa

text: Great place, clean, friendly staff, lots of convenience with the onsite restaurant, room service and indoor pool. Would highly recommend, one of the better hotels in the area.
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa

text: The staff was quite curtios. I found hair that was not mine in the bed which I found disturbing. Every time that I went swimming I always found long hair on me. Other than that the room was clean for the most part.
title: Mystic Marriott Hotel & Spa

text: Very nice local museum with interesting things for all ages.
title: Gaston County Museum

text: Super docent! The textile exhibit brought back many memories of my working in a cotton mill.
title: Gaston County Museum

text: Great info,,,informative staff,,,,enjoyed the exhibits ,,,5 stars for great free museum
title: Gaston County Museum

text: The current theme is a very well put together display of a significant time is the history of Gaston County & NC. that is not tales about too often. The museum housed in an historical hotel and it has some examples of how it  looked back then;  it is pretty neat to see how elegant it was.
title: Gaston County Museum

text: I was there for a speakeasy themed fundraiser. The court yard is beautiful. Large but private. Love the historic elements from when it was a hotel. The fundraiser was very well thought out and was a lot of fun. Highly recommend!
title: Gaston County Museum

text: Bigger than it looks. 1st floor is textile exhibits and women in journalism, 2nd floor was photography exhibit, 3rd floor was rooms in the old hotel, carriage house was separate. Enjoyed!
title: Gaston County Museum

text: The museum staff is knowledgeable and very courteous. After a few moments inside, you feel as though you have stepped back in time. The Jim Biggers exhibit in December was inspirational. It was a must see event. The gift shop sells quite a few unique items.
title: Gaston County Museum

text: a free round of mini golf that someone built in their side yard. awesome!
title: Twin Pines Country Club

text: Always delicious! So much goodness all on one plate.
title: Peppermill Cafe Standale

text: Awesome place and great people  with greater food it's are new breakfast  spot
title: Peppermill Cafe Standale

text: Food was great. A bit busy but it was a sat morning. Seemed like the waitress forgot about us for quite some time after we first sat down.
title: Peppermill Cafe Standale

text: We had a coupon for this restaurant so we decided to check it out. The outside of the building was a little deceiving. It is a little more run down and looks smaller but don‚Äôt let this deter you. The employees were very friendly and the food was very good. The omelettes are stuffed full of ingredients and they are very large. Everything came out exactly as ordered and tasted very good! The price is average for most any breakfast restaurant..
title: Peppermill Cafe Standale

text: Nice little 'Mom and Pop' breakfast and lunch restaurant in Standale. (Plenty of seating but they were a little short staffed to get the tables cleaned fast enough to seat people.) Waitress was polite and attentive and remembered all orders with no problem. Food was delicious. Price was excellent.
title: Peppermill Cafe Standale

text:
The Peppermill Caf√© (formerly known as Peppermill Grill) is a dainty hidden gem located on Lake Michigan Ave. ‚ù§Ô∏èüåø

Their food is SO INCREDIBLY affordable and absolutely delicious! Make sure to check out their features on the weekend because they always sound so yummy and you won‚Äôt want to miss out on them!

Pictured is their french toast with blueberries and when draped with warm syrup, it is to die for!

This homey American diner is like a second home to the crowd of regulars and is a prime spot to enjoy a super affordable breakfast or lunch! ü§©
title: Peppermill Cafe Standale

text: The absolute best breakfast around. Huge portions for very reasonable prices. They have breakfast and lunch options. The waitresses are all very friendly and work to help each other out. The pancakes are larger than the plate! Give the sugar bread a try. Yummy hazelnut coffee or hot chocolate covered in whip cream. A must visit. Don't let the wait scare you off on Sunday. It's well worth it.
title: Peppermill Cafe Standale

text: Great little place went out of our way to try it but definitely with the trip. Very friendly staff and good portions.
title: Peppermill Cafe Standale

text: Great food, giant portions, and nice menu selection.   The only complaint I had was the long wait time, but I went for Sunday brunch so I knew I would be waiting a bit.  I guess everyone loves this place.
title: Peppermill Cafe Standale

text: Friendly old school diner. Great prices
title: Peppermill Cafe Standale

text: Great food and great prices!
title: Peppermill Cafe Standale

text: Good food at a great price. We had the hash and the American specials.  The corned beef hash tasted homemade.  We had the rye toast and the raisin toast.  Both were toasted to perfection.  My husband said the Coffee was excellent.  I'll take his word on that.  I guess I never grew up enough to like coffee.  I'll stick to diet coke or pepsi.
title: Peppermill Cafe Standale

text: Ordered coffee and Monte Cristo for breakfast delicious.
title: Peppermill Cafe Standale

text: Less costly mom and pop type of situation. Offers plenty of choices for food with well proportioned plates. Coffee is typical diner drip brew. Fairly extensive wait on food to come out. Pictured, Monte Cristo with raspberry and the California omelette side of flapjack bigger than your face! 4 stars because I prefer fruit pur√©e over syrup and the service was a bit slow, although friendly enough. Perfect spot for feeding many and leaving full on a budget.
title: Peppermill Cafe Standale

text: Delicious food! Good prices, and ample serving sizes. Surprisingly I have lived in the Grand Rapids area my whole life and just recently tried this place out for the first time a few weeks ago. I have been back twice since. And I definitely plan on going back! New favorite breakfast joint!
title: Peppermill Cafe Standale

text: Great food at good prices. Service was good even with a packed house. Ambiance isn't the greatest but whatever it's just a local joint offering good food.
title: Peppermill Cafe Standale

text:
Wow this was our first time here! We came in to try the breakfast and we were not disappointed! The food was good and reasonably priced! The waitress Michelle was the best waitress! I just loved her personality!
We will be back!
title: Peppermill Cafe Standale

text: I love the Peppermill. They have great food with surprising variety at low prices. I had the inside out grilled cheese. It has baby Swiss, cheddar, tomato, red onion, and avocado on parmesan crusted bread. It was amazing. The onion was flavorful and the creamy avocado made the two melted cheeses even better. The parmesan added another layer of crispness to each bite. I upgraded to tater tots instead of chips, and I was surprised at the large portion. My daughter had a pancake and tots. The pancake was huge, so she only managed half, but she did polish off her tots and some of mine. This was my second time there recently. I can't wait to go back!
title: Peppermill Cafe Standale

text: It's great every time. Fast and friendly service. Decent menu. Large portions. Great pancakes. Busy on Sunday mornings.
title: Peppermill Cafe Standale

text: Excellent food and service. We will definitely be back!!
title: Peppermill Cafe Standale

text:
Place has more to offer than those regular ones like airborne.
Blow up obstacles, go kart, team games, tramp virtual games.

Super clean and nice
title: The Hive Trampoline & Adventure Park

text: The place is big and clean. All equipment is new but nobody monitors the activities. My son was jumping on the valo jump (picture attached) and other kids (I think ages 3-6y) joined them. I asked them to wait for their turns but they kept jumping. No parents around to educate their kids + no hive staff.
title: The Hive Trampoline & Adventure Park

text: Best trampoline park we‚Äôve ever visited. So many options, endless fun for the kids and parents, super comfy couches to sit while the kids jump. Great management. I‚Äôm so impressed!
title: The Hive Trampoline & Adventure Park

text: Probably the best trampoline park in the state, at least from what I‚Äôve been too. Very clean, which is the most important. Huge bounce house setup too, even for adults, which is fun. Zip line and video-game type jumps too. Decent pricing. Even Go-Carts for a little bit extra!
title: The Hive Trampoline & Adventure Park

text: Really nice everything brand new really big but long-term price won‚Äôt work. We definitely will be going to the other trampoline places then to come here because of the prices. Arcade is over priced for what you can win. Which is like that almost everywhere. I do love that they have so many couches and lots of areas for the parents to sit and watch kids. Oh and you have to have non-grip socks and they don‚Äôt tell you that when you come in and they do not have prices for the Sox listed on their board either. They are three dollars a pair of socks and they don‚Äôt have any deals on them like if you buy multiple or a pack or anything to save money which is kind of crazy because if I knew beforehand I could‚Äôve bought some online for way cheaper from somewhere else. I like that you have to wear a electronic wristband that has a green and red light to tell you when your time is up. Everything is very Clean because it is a brand new building and equipment. I just hope it stays that way.
title: The Hive Trampoline & Adventure Park

text: Great place to bring your kids. (especially if you want to wear them out) tons to do...jumping, sliding, climbing, running, etc.
title: The Hive Trampoline & Adventure Park

text: Best of the best! We go to Family Entertainment businesses around the country and I haven‚Äôt seen a place this quality anywhere else. I‚Äôve seen a few reviews complaining about the price but it‚Äôs well worth it and pricing is more than fair for this premium experience. You really have to go nothing in this review will give this place justice. My kids went for 2 hours and didn‚Äôt want to leave and afterwards they couldn‚Äôt stop talking about it! We can‚Äôt wait to go back !!
title: The Hive Trampoline & Adventure Park

text: It's a great idea. Would be awesome spread across the county and in areas like city center of eagle mountain where there isn't much else for kids to do.
title: The Hive Trampoline & Adventure Park

text: Love that we have this in Spanish Fork! Am awesome place to have fun. Not a big fan of the pricing. I can only imagine families with many kids, it can get pricey. Overall, a great place!
title: The Hive Trampoline & Adventure Park

text: Very clean, staff very friendly and helpful. My grandson loved it there. Well staffed and lots of supervision.  Safe place.
title: The Hive Trampoline & Adventure Park

text: This place is so fun! From the arcade, to the trampolines and the go karts! We had a blast! The staff was busy, but they were friendly the entire time! We will be back!
title: The Hive Trampoline & Adventure Park

text:
Spent several hours reading my book while my 11 and 14-year-old boys got plenty of exercise. (Adults don‚Äôt have to pay if they don‚Äôt plan on jumping) Many clean and comfortable couches to choose from for parents who want to relax and lots of fun activities for kids of all ages. I saw many small children and big children playing on many different things and it‚Äôs big enough that nobody was getting in each others way. Prices were not as high as expected for how huge and nice the facility is. Of course trampoline parks are pricey regardless but I thought it was worth the money. Will be back.
Side note: I‚Äôve been to several other trampoline parks and they play the best music at Hive by far.
title: The Hive Trampoline & Adventure Park

text: Really fun place to go. Only things are it is pricy (but everything is now) and they need self cleaning supplies (oh and a changing table‚Ä¶). My kids would live here if they could! Go Karts are fun but not as much when no one else is riding.
title: The Hive Trampoline & Adventure Park

text:
Great place, definitely glad to have it near us. Yes it costs more than Hang Time, but it has more to offer. Plus a bunch of couches and several massage chairs for adults.
At Hang Time I'm always worried about where my smaller kids are because you can't keep a good eye everywhere. Feels like it's for older kids and young adults with more trampolines for tricks.

What I like about The Hive it's good for kids of all ages. There's a tetherball with jumping around it. Two interactive video game screens that actually show their picture on screen as they jump, so fun!
Zip line, jumping basketball, targets, go carts (costs extra), the biggest bounce house/obstacle course I've ever seen. Regular trampolines too, rock wall, ninja warrior obstacles, slack line.

There are drinking fountains, but they're by the go carts (kind of annoying they're so far).
They also have bands to wear that have lights that change color when your time is up. They do have lockers as well.
Overall, we'll go again, but less frequently because of the cost. Still, i thought it was worth it, especially for families with kids.
title: The Hive Trampoline & Adventure Park

text: This place is huge, clean, and impressive! We went in the morning, and it was really fun. My kids got a lot of fun and exercise in, in just an hour! Their favorite activity was the go-karts. They're silent, speedy, & so much nicer than outdoor gas ones. If you're short on time, you could even go here for a quick stop-in and do just the go-karts. We were helped by Chase, who was nice and knowledgeable, and Holland, who was helpful and fun. We were also able to talk with the owners on our way out, who were also very friendly, attentive, and excited about The Hive. Good vibes here! Go check it out!
title: The Hive Trampoline & Adventure Park

text:
The best Mexican food I have ever had. Seriously, the food is amazing, the staff is extremely attentive, and the prices are right.

My suggestion- order the Nachos Mexicanos. Beef, chicken, and shrimp on top of tortilla chips drowned in delicious white cheese.
title: Los Rancheros Mexican Restaurant

text: I've been coming here since I was 12. That's literally over half of my life, and it will always be my absolute favorite Mexican restaurant!
title: Los Rancheros Mexican Restaurant

text:
the food here is awesome and you get plenty. we walked in at 20 min to closing, i know bad on us. the wait staff didnt seem to mind as they were super friendly. i would say this has been one of the better mexican eatery's we have found in our travels. my dish was great, the meat so tender and juicy. my wife really liked her chicken tacos.
well done Los Rancheros
title: Los Rancheros Mexican Restaurant

text: Wonderful food and great service. Prices were good too.
title: Los Rancheros Mexican Restaurant

text: Didn't get all of our food on a carryout order! We were supposed to get a #20 and the combo special. 8 items all together. Only recieved 6 items.
title: Los Rancheros Mexican Restaurant

text: The food was good and the staff very friendly definitely going again
title: Los Rancheros Mexican Restaurant

text: $2.50 margaritas ALL DAY every Tuesday & Thursday üò≤üòÆüò≤
title: Los Rancheros Mexican Restaurant

text: The salsa was full of üçÖ chunks!  Chips were stale... The food was bland which is odd for a mexican place. Cheap margaritas!
title: Los Rancheros Mexican Restaurant

text: Very authentic and delicious food
title: Los Rancheros Mexican Restaurant

text: Great place for lunch!
title: Los Rancheros Mexican Restaurant

text: Restrooms were acceptable, but not especially clean. Lots of fun shopping, which was nice, since the food took sooooooooo long. We were really on a time crunch to get to our next destination, due to car trouble, and it took 38 minutes to get 2 meals of 3 chicken strips each. I do not recommend using this as a meal stop...
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text:
Absolutely love the 'vintage' decor! Like stepping back in time! Room is clean. Really great room for the rate.
Would be 5 stars if there were a microwave in the room. It's a very long walk to the truck stop to use a microwave. Also,
We were told there is a tub. No tub in this room. Bummer. As a trucker, a tub is a luxury.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Food and fuels stop. Nice place with ice cream cones for $.50 or something like that. The food is good too. We kept seeing penguins on the souvenirs, which didn't make sense a first but ask the lady at the checkout!
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text:
I was road tripping from Denver, CO to Salt Lake, UT and saw a bunch of signs for this place. We had decided  to stop on a whim. Turns out to be a little truck/road trip stop spot.

The place is a little campy and lovely. Clean bathrooms. Plenty of parking. Overall its a great spot to stop and chill for a bit.

Also, 75 cent ice cream cones!!!!
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Becareful when you but something. An item I choose said $16.99 but rang up $19.99. They reimbursed me but it was a hassle. Also I took a picture of history, a large picture of this dinner in 1956. Not a single ethnic person is being served at the counter. Good thing we as a country has come a long way.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: 50¬¢ ice cream cones, clean bathrooms, hot food, gas and play area! We travel from East coast to West coast and back several times and this remains a great place to stop, either with the kids or without. Open 24-7, it's a great pit stop. The kids love it and don't mind shopping for that odd something you don't find elsewhere in the gift shop. It's strategically placed in the middle of nowhere, but has just what's needed. The lawns are green and it's surrounded by trees. A true desert Oasis.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Ate at the lounge/bar, didn‚Äôt know it was even there. :) It was very good, considering the food/deli in the fuel desk side is pretty much hit or miss. The portions were large, the food was very good and the service was great! It got pretty busy in there when we were leaving and the server although very busy and by himself still provided excellent service and even refilled our drinks. I definitely would recommend this place.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Nicest roach motel I've stayed at.  It looks cute and quaint from a distance, but don't be fooled into booking a room there.  AC was not adequate.  Had to leave the sliding patio door open for air, which was really hard to move because it was off its rollers.  It was also not secure because the patio is shared with every room on that side of the building.  The room was not clean.  There was trash left from the previous occupant: receipt in the dresser, pizza crust under the bed, comb on the bathroom sink, and water in the ice bucket.  There was a brown crusty substance on the edge of the bathroom garbage can.  The bed sheets were too short and because I'm tall my feet were rubbing on the rough protective pad underneath.  Both beds were like that but I was the only one tall enough to notice.  The map of the grounds they gave us was a bad copy and it was hard to read the amenities.  I thought there might be a nicer version in the amenities book in the room but the book had nothing in it at all.  This means we knew nothing about the hotel other than what was on the bad map.  We didn't have any phone numbers to call for service or if it was possible to order food from the restaurant.  We went in the pool, which had several places where it had cracked and was missing chunks of concrete and tiles.  The deep end separation floaters were all destroyed and were held up by the rope.  We avoided several bad sections of the pool due to it's horrible condition.  When we checked out in the morning it was so early (6:15 AM) that we had to check out at the gift shop and the staff there were not pleasant.  This was also where you payed for gas, and it had the restaurant in it.  The restaurant menu was horrible.  I couldn't order anything due to the limited menu.  The payment system was down and they didn't seem to have a manual backup system so we had to wait, delaying our departure.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: We were getting tired and decided to stop here for the night.  We have been visiting this place off and on for many years but had not ever spent the night.  We were surprised at how reasonable the prices were and the rooms were clean and actually stylish.  Made it feel like a small apartment.  Seem to be fairly well sound insulated as I did not hear much nose which made for a good night's sleep.  The little store has beer which rocked after a long day of driving!!  The staff was friendly and helpful.  I will be making a point to stay here in the future.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text:
Had to stay here because of my truck broke down. 01/30/22 -01/31/22
Edited:
I haven‚Äôt complained about it right away because I checked in around 2:30am. I was just exhausted. But, I left a long notice on your check out card.

Bedding were covered in some paint and someone‚Äôs hair. Also, the cleaning lady starts knocking doors around at 8:50am despite the check out at 11am and eventually wakes you up!WHY????
Hopefully, won‚Äôt have to stay here again.
And of course nobody will reply. Because there‚Äôs nothing to say, right guys?!
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: We're trucker park here for the night. Every time we stopped here we always go to the bar. Nice ambiance, very clean bathroom. Great customer service. Crispiest fried chicken we've ever had, it was delicious. Love there steak fries. Salad was good too. Couple of beer and we're good.. Keep this place clean. Free dump and water for RV and large car.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text:
The suite we were in was beautiful. Like walking into grandmas house. Our sitting room furniture was very comfortable. The whole room was clean and my wife loved having a place to do her makeup.  Beautiful grounds And the hallway wasn‚Äôt dirty. Something I‚Äôve never seen is the refrigerator and microwave Are in the bathroom but they blend with the decor so it‚Äôs kinda cool.  Some negatives. 1. Where you check in is not the hotel you have to drive to your room or as for me (truck driver) squeeze your truck in their parking lot or walk half a mile to get to the suite. 2. Small bathtub. 3. Short shower. If your tall your going to have to bend to get your head under the shower. 4. Pillows got rock hard after laying on them for a few minutes 5. Very few phone charger stations.

They do serve buffalo burgers in the convenient store and the do have a small restaurant in the hotel lobby. They also charge a 20$ incidental fee when you check in.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: 5 stars for the quality 75cent ice cream cones. Hands down best stop going through Wyoming.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: This was an awesome place to stop for a break on our cross US roadtrip! I can't wait for the trip back to do some more explaining!. We didn't stay at the hotel, we were just passing through to eat, fill up the tank, stretch our legs and play on the playground!.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Clean from one end of the complex to the other. Great staff. Comfortable rooms. Lacks a real restaurant, but the short order grill serves up food that is pretty good at a reasonable price.  Very friendly towards pro drivers - CDL rates for rooms,  plenty of truck parking (you can park a bob tail right by the hotel), separate truck stop at diesel island.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Hotel is extremely outdated and staff needs to brush up on their customer service skills. The property probably hasn't had any sort of renovation since the 90's and it is long overdue. I was offered a package when I checked in which included a discount if I spent $30 in the gift shop/restaurant/gas station. I was told to bring back my receipts and they would apply the discount. The next morning I went into the front desk with my receipts only to be told I needed to turn them in the night before. I told the front desk attendant that I was not informed that it had to be turned in the same day I checked in, only to bring my receipts back and the front desk lady would take off the discount.  The front desk attendant rudely said,  "yeah her and she's not here". I then asked for a manager who quickly resolved the problem. If you're going to have a strict policy on how long customers have to turn in receipts for credits on a package I didn't even ask for then you need to inform the customers of that policy. Additionally, having a bad attitude with a customer who was obviously not informed correctly by your staff will not earn you business. I will NEVER stay here again!  Gross, outdated and rude staff!
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text:
Very nice little place in the middle of nothing. I mean there is literally nothing around for miles. That being said this is a nice little place that is reasonably priced. We got the deluxe room. They are old fashioned style but well maintained and is basicall like a suite. In a big city you would pay top dollar for a room like this but our rate was close to $100... not bad at all. Definitely recommend if you are traveling and going to pass through here this would be a great place to stop and get some rest...

They hotel grill closes at 10pm which no one told us but if you are really hungry you can head over to the truck travel center, that grill is open 24 hours...
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: The guys marketing this place do an incredible job making you feel like you haven‚Äôt been to I-80 Wyoming if you haven‚Äôt stopped and had an ice cream cone at Little America. And for 75 cents, it‚Äôs not a bad stop at all. My son counted over 40 Little America billboard signs coming in from the eastbound road.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: My girls loved it and deemed our large double queen room with pink tiled bathroom - a princess room. The beds were comfortable and we had one of our best nights sleep there during our travels. The bathroom fixtures are a bit strange but it just takes a bit of testing to get it right. Overall the hotel was very quiet for us despite the property doubling as a 24 hour truck stop. We were in a very quiet unit (no pets). I've heard others say the other units can be noisier (pets allowed) as they are closer to the trucking amenities. Lastly, there is a playground and fun statues for the kids to get on - the Sinclair dinosaur and a giant buffalo. There is a once live penguin in the check in area. Really cool place with gorgeous Wyoming scenery. Planning a big family trip there again with more relatives! What a find.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: The bathrooms had a cleanliness rating of: fair. I didn't check the actual crapper stalls though. Place was bustling and had a long line if you wanted to get any of the foods they offer. Kids run rampant in this place, you've been advised.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Make this a must stop on your 80 drive. This was one of the nicest gas stations I've been to; they even had lounge chairs in the bathroom! A great selection of drinks, snacks, and fresh food. Plus it's a Sinclair so the cute dinosaur is out front.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Stayed in my truck. The truck side bathrooms leave a lot to be desired. The car side was awesome! Food wasn't anything to write home about. Had the cheeseburger and fries the night before and it was totally flavorless. Had the jam eggs hashbrowms and toast for breakfast and it was worse, if that's possible. Got my eggs scrambled with cheese and the cheese ended up on my toast.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: We stopped to fill up with gas and purchase some snacks at the extremely well stocked retail store! This store has everything! You want popcorn? They got üçø!!
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: I didn't stay at the hotel but I've stopped here several times for a food break and fuel stop. Bathrooms are clean. The tables could be better cleaned/maintained as customers leave. The food is good. I had the chicken bacon wrap on this visit. Fuel station is large and has I think 12 stalls for autos. Good place to stop.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text:
Nice clean truck stop with some pretty good made to order food at the fuel island, 4 wheeler gas station, or at the restaurant.   Have always found truck parking here even at 1 am.

Love the little lounge just to the left of the motel check-in/receptionist area.  Pretty close to a full bar and they sell packaged liquor/beer to go.
title: Little America Hotel - Wyoming

text: Wonderfully classic French restaurant. Price fixe 4 course menu provides plenty of options. View is gorgeous also.
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: Delicious food and great customer service! Definitely recommend!
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: This fantastical gem of a bistro is a must have for any Milwaukee foodie. With a creative Parisian inspired menu, a well balanced ambiance, and a talented service staff, this place exudes elegance at every corner. If that's not enough, their executive chef Adam was nominated and awarded a James Beard award!
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text:
Myself and 5 friends went tonight to celebrate our good friend's engagement and wedding coming up next month with something a little different! We had an amazing time, the food was totally different than what we normally would find but so good, we had a ton of fun picking out our meals, trying all the different things, and just enjoying the experience. The wait staff was phenomenal, I honestly think Allison was a highlight of our evening. She was very personable, made us feel entirely comfortable, and had great tips and information on the menu.

We were gifted with extras at dessert, champagne for those of us that partook in cocktails and N/A sparkling juice for those that didn't and it was SO good! Super refreshing! We also (seriously, they were so amazing) were gifted a bite of something delicious - I apologize for not remembering what it was by the pastry chef this evening - but it had almonds, was a dessert bar of some sort and it was really good - not super sweet, honestly would have gone great with coffee if any of us had room for it - which we most certainly did not.

The atmosphere was wonderful, even being in proximity to other tables it still felt intimate enough that we couldn't hear other parties' conversations, nor could they hear ours, and I feel like we were a little rambunctious at times. Also, my friends that had cocktails said nothing but high praise for them - my coke with lime was also top notch * in case anyone cared ;)

Food. That's why you're reading this, yeah?
It was good. Like, really great. It also felt like a performance at times. Lots of fun pouring, super attentive taking items away, never once had to ask for anything, be it water, napkin, silverware, etc etc. Maybe we're cheap dates but I'm fairly certain everyone went above and beyond, exceeding our expectations. Thanks for a great experience!

In case my photo captions don't save:
1. Scallops
2. Surprise Carrot & Cardamom Soup option (big fan of this, you don't know unless you KNOW)
3. Beef Medallion Filet - my favorite of the 3 savory dishes
4. The best dang dessert option there is - even though the mousse looked and sounded amazing - I will DIE on this chocolatey-citrus hill any day. Any. Day. This chocolate cake (better than the chocolate cake in your head, bet) and orange sorbet - beyond. Be.yond.
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: This place is AMAZING!! I Had the brunch special which is 3 courses. Had the cream of asparagus soup which was to die for. Then eggs Benedict with spinach and crab. Mmmm. Will finish with custard. I'll be back. Plus I didn't have to wait for anything!!
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: Fantastic food, atmosphere and service!
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: Amazing experience, the waiter Chris and his partner rocked and we cant wait to go back! The lamb, filet mignon and you cant go french without a creme brulee which was was delicious as well!
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: The atmosphere is beautiful, the service is wonderful, and the food is amazing. I had the veal and one of their salads. Their fresh warm bread and butter is served to you as needed by the servers. They really take care of you here and the view overlooking Lake Michigan doesn't hurt either!
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: Had the pleasure of dining here during my trip to Milwaukee. I definitely enjoyed my experience. Everything was cooked to perfection. I started with the Moules Marini√®re. The mussels were cooked to perfection and sauce was very light and fragrant. Then I tried the Fondue de Gruy√®re Aux Asperges which was very flavorful. For my main plate, I had the Fricass√© de Homard and the lobster was cooked so delicately that it nearly melted in my mouth. And lastly for dessert I had the delicious Mousse au Chocolat "Yves Camdeborde." Wish I hadn't came so late so I could check out the view everyone spoke about but I still loved every minute of my meal.
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: Made my birthday experience perfect! I felt so taken care of from the bar, to the Lake room. Amazing staff and the food was incredible. Shoutout Hakim, he was an excellent waiter.
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: Amazing service and outstanding food. The room was slightly upscale, but welcoming. A must for any special occasion!
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: Best dinner out in years. Nothing snobbish about it.
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: Super beautiful setting. Nice and kind wait staff. Gave us special treatment on our anniversary.  Will be back!
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: This is a fancy place for big occasions. Try this out for birthdays or anniversaries and you will like it. Lakefront view is good when there is sunlight. In the evenings in winter the sparkles of the icicles reflect through the windows. Food is varied and with guidances from the helpful staff you can find the right mix. Vegetarian options are available. Cheese plates are great too. The restaurant is spacious and very well decorated.
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: Amazing value for an incredible meal. We dine with 4 guest total, all ordered something different. Each dish was delicious, there was nothing we didn‚Äôt like dish to the bread and salted butter. Service was on point and the view was great. 10/10 would recommend
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text:
Really enjoyed our visit here. We came here for the annual fall mushroom dinner and got to taste a great spread of delicacies and unique mushrooms. We enjoyed about 18 different mushrooms blended into our 6 course meals paired with wine! Everything was delicious.

This was our first time here and glad we decided to be here to enjoy the special evening. We got seated right away and the staff were so polite. We also had some food restrictions and our server attended to us right away addressing that. He just made us feel very comfortable and ensured us that the request has been taken care off.

We visited here for dinner but I would love to visit here again during the day because based on the location, it overlooks the beautiful Lake Michigan and I can only imagine how gorgeous the view would be from the hill top! It's an upscale restaurant and is great for special occasions! They offer a lot of speciality themed dinners (just like the mushroom one) so I would really recommend joining in for one of those if you get a chance! It's awesome :)
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text:
Our wedding at Lake Park Bistro was absolutely perfect. We had a tented reception with cocktail hour on the gorgeous East Balcony with stunning views of Lake Michigan. The restaurant's white pillars were a perfect location for photos and the surrounding park offered more beautiful options all with in a walking distance. The staff was fantastic and our guests were thrilled with their prompt and friendly service. We also received many, many compliments on the food from our family and friends; even those ‚Äòhard to impress‚Äô said their meal at Lake Park Bistro was the best they‚Äôd ever had at a wedding. However, the best thing about Lake Park Bistro was working with Dan. He made us feel comfortable and welcome every step of the way and provided us with excellent advice to make our day fun and stress-free. Dan was clear in all of our communications and went above and beyond to host a meeting for myself and my other vendors. His honest feedback and recommendations helped make our day personal, special, and truly, the best day of our lives. We truly can not say enough about our wonderful experience at Lake Park Bistro, thank you Dan and team!!

(Photos from Dawn Silva Photography)
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: Gourmet food, great service, nice views of Lake Michigan, and classic restaurant ambiance. Menu is diverse enough to have something for everyone. Prices are high, but fair considering the quality of cuisine. Ample parking.
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: Always has been an eating experience. Love the new 4 course menu there are so many delicious options. I highly recommend it.
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: The food is really good and there is a nice view of lake Michigan. We were there when they had the air show so while we ate you were able to see Jets and planes fly but with a beautiful view of the lake
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: Absolutely amazing! Great food and staff along with an amazing desert, highly recommend!
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: This is amazing. Only problem was possibly the amount of oil or grease that was in the food. Our server Greg I believe was super nice.
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: LPB has been our favorite for a long time and we we're thrilled to learn they re-opened. The service was stellar and VERY safe however we were not quite thrilled with our  food. It was almost as if the kitchen has an entirely new staff.. perhaps new suppliers/wholesalers??  My Oeuf Mollet avec Champignons des Bois was prepared differently, the mussels were definitely different. And my favorite fois gras dish has a new bland fruit or vegetable to accompany it vs the old one which was a sweet fruit that was such a great compliment to such a savory protein. Lastly,  I had a lobster entree that was prepared in a "beef stock" like base... Almost like it should have accompanied beef vs. fresh lobster. I hate to sound harsh but I am just being honest.  And FYI the menu is now a set 3 or 4 course menu. We will certainly come back however having eaten here so many times for so many special occasions.. we were a bit disappointed compared to any previous visit.  One last note.. just a thought... Why is it I cannot find a desert chef in Milwaukee who makes Panna Cotta? The last time we found it was at Chistopher's (now closed/new owner perhaps) in Sister Bay. That was approximately 10 years ago..I will finish by staring the lemon desert we had was excellent!!
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: So impressed! Wonderful food, service, atmosphere. Loved it!
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text: Beautiful location, quaint and romantic atmosphere with outstanding staff that goes the extra mile for you to have a positive experience. Our waitress Sharon was superb, she made sure our experience was one of a kind. High quality food that was made to perfection. Thank you for the amazing dinner!
title: Bartolotta's Lake Park Bistro

text:
We had a mini suite, the room was decently clean but the shower was horrible, it was like an ultra pressure super blast shower and you couldn't change the spray angle, also it would fill with water quickly because the drain didn't work.
By far the worst part of the room was the lack of curtains or any type of shade (see pics), we had to use couch cushions in the main room to block the glaring morning son, the management and staff were no help at all.
Would not stay again.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text:
It's been a few years since we have stayed here and unfortunately will probably be the last time. I received an email inviting me to stay there which stated they had newly remodeled rooms, which made us want to go ahead and book here instead of our usual other option. Well, our visit was less than satisfying. We drove up Sunday afternoon to check in and were told there was no valet service - park across the street, and walk back to check in (was not allowed to keep my car in their driveway while checking in). Not a good start. Check in line had about 10 parties waiting to check in and only two front desk folks (after about 10 minutes one more front desk agent showed up). Once in the room, I was confused how they could state the rooms were remodeled(?). Bathroom was great (only one hook to hang towels), the room was painted, but the furniture was still old and scratched up, the chair was creaking with every move and the thermostat was very dirty (not huge, but very noticeable). The casino had no live tables, so we had to go somewhere else to play - I prefer to just stay in my hotel to gamble. As far as the 'Resort Fee', it lists 2 water bottles (helpful on a 100 degree day), but never got that - I called down to see if they could be brought over and never got them. There were a couple of coffee pods with a sign stating they will be refreshed every morning, they are not. I called the 2nd morning to get a couple, but ended up running to Starbucks instead (Why are they charging a resort fee???). If this covers the parking, maybe think about charging the people parking in your lot and not staying at your hotel.
In any case, with all the alternative hotels in Reno I will not be booking another room at Circus Circus. I'll keep the old memories of what they used to be years ago.
One plus, we enjoyed the view from our room.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text:
A Fun Hotel in The Reno Row‚Ä¶
5 Stars!!!
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: We stayed the night on a Saturday night when there was an event in Reno. $260 for a room!!! No microwave in the room. The room was clean and comfortable but definitely not worth $260!!!
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: I come here mainly for the midway arcade. Annually play the ring toss for a win. The prizes are hit or miss, and the claw game prizes tend to pretty good. The workers are quick to answer questions and offer plastic bags for winnings. The casino is tiny and never crowded.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: We decided to come here to have breakfast and then hang out in the Arcade. First impression coming in the elevator we‚Äôre old and dirty. Once you get inside the Casino/Hotel it looks way better. We had pancakes and eggs which were delicious but the sausage looked like it had freezer burns on it so we didn‚Äôt eat that. The staff at the restaurant were great and not too long of a wait time. The arcade was fun. A little over priced but the convenience of having it within the hotel could be a plus. We were able to make enough points to cash out for some goodies at their Arcade store. We were able to catch 2 shows while we were there so that was fun as well.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Stopped by for a few hours on our way to Cali. I have memories of being here as a child and seeing animals and circus acts. I took my kids in and found the arcade with the stage. There was a short balancing act while we were there. There are lots of shops. The kids blew $95 at the arcade in about 20 minutes and came away with a few cheap stuffed animals. I think they had fun, but it didn't live up to my memories.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: We stayed at 27th floor nd the view was good. Casino was also good.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Stayed here for my bday. Got a great deal. Room was clean. Had a mini fridge, keurig coffee maker with starbucks coffee pods üëçüèºüëçüèº We didnt spend much time in the room. It did have a blow dryer and iron. Its a nice hotel for families with kids. Plenty of free parking available.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: The casino was great. I went with my kids to the arcade and they absolutely loved it. The mattresses were so comfy, I slept quite fast. The bathrooms were so clean! I recommend! Super satisfied!!!
title: Circus Circus Reno

text:
I've stayed here twice within the last year, the first time my room in the casino tower was a lot more run down and old than I am used to and I low key had an eerie feeling from the room I stayed in the first time. Maybe something happened there before I don't know, but I felt this odd coldness/a feeling that made me uneasy. I was hesitant to stay here but I decided to book again since I was only here for a couple days.

My 2nd visit this past week was decent. The hotel itself is older of course, but it gives the basic necessities. I was in the sky tower this time and it felt more updated than the casino tower?

Heating/cooling system worked perfectly. I had a corner room which had a nice view of the city.

I would give this rating a lot lower for the incident that happened, but I will assume it was a rare occurrence where someone walks in your room without knocking. The woman Apologized, but I felt really uncomfortable because I could've been naked or in the shower. It was totally inappropriate, I messaged the concierge Ivy person thing and they apologized but never offered to do anything...

Water quality from the faucets were questionable, I ran the hot and cold and both looked heavy, see photo. But cleared up after I ran it for some time.

Shower ran well too. Water temp was well controlled. So everything else was fine with the room. Nothing extravagant, I just got a normal king size room.

Anyways, I like the convenience of the hotels location and how it's connected to the other, Silver Legacy, el Dorado, etc. We enjoy the arcade and circus shows too. Staff are friendly for the most part. They have a better food court now than they did 12 years ago, so there are improvements here and there.

I love that they still have a lot of old mixed with new. I love the history of the buildings and seeing that throughout the halls and rooms of the buildings. Please maintain the history  I think that's what really entices visitors too!

Overall I would stay again for the location for sure.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: The valley guys are the best, but I did find the front desk extremely rude. I was hung up on for asking for room service.. then I tried to order inn and they refused. I brought my pooch I ü§î think he enjoyed it more than me. At the end of the day, great view ü™ü 21rst floor.

text: Just dont expect the same level of entertainment thats found at the Vegas location.  There was only one show per day. There was only 2 roaming drink servers...which we rarely saw. Plenty of games for ppl with kids. I was surprised that indoor smoking was permitted. I was approached and asked if I wanted to buy perfume. My friend was approached and asked if she wanted to buy gold jewelry. Two ATMs were out of money. The room staff was exceptionally friendly. The concierge desk was not manned the majority of the time. We called airlines and departed a day early.
title: Circus Circus Reno

text: Circus Circus was very clean and well staffed the first night. When we went again 3 days later, half of the bottom kids area was blocked off. text:
Came on a Tuesday night. Masks only suggested for non-vaccinated guests but a surprising number of guests and staff wore one.

Check in was quick. Had a suite room. Clean, spacious, with dual temp control. Large bathroom with shower/tub. Keurig available with coffee pods. Hidden mini fridge. Extra pillows in closet.

Housekeeping came by only to ask if anything was needed, not to clean. I believe they only clean on request and upon check out, but ask the front desk if that's accurate. Asked for extra bath and hand towels; was given two of each.

Check out was 12pm w/Express Check Out option. Dropped off keys in Express Check Out box by elevators.

text: A FUN Night
title: Room Escapers - Boston Escape Rooms

text:
Our experience here was awesome! My boyfriend and I did 'The Lost Ship' room. It was a Wednesday 7pm booking, so just the two of us took on the challenge without anyone else booking in. And we escaped with 90 seconds to spare!! Our guide, Captain Charles, did a fantastic job introducing the room to us with this whole back story to set us up. If you pay close attention, there are clues in everything he's saying as well.

The room itself was the best part. It was actually several rooms all joined together and from the lobby you had to figure out how to even enter the main room in the first place‚Äîsuper cool! I had never seen anything like that before. The puzzles were also really well thought out and interesting, using logic and problem solving (not at all abstract or random). Of all the escape rooms I have done, I would say that this has been the best experience I have had because of the attention to detail in the room, the quality of the puzzles, and the experience of being able to solve it with just the two of us.

The room is actually designed for at least 6 people, because it would have been helpful for others to take on and simultaneously solve riddles in the room. I'm pretty amazed we were able to do it with just 2 (but it was mostly because we had a few timely hints... big ones, lol). Awesome experience, highly recommend!!!

P.S. - This location has only this room (Pirate's Booty 2 - The Lost Ship), and the other rooms are in their downtown location. So don't be confused ^_^
title: Room Escapers - Boston Escape Rooms

text: Cabins are adorable, comfortable and well equipped! Amazing escape!
