text: Such an awesome place. I've been hearing from friends that not many people know about this zoo. If you have young kids, bring them here and have a great time. All the animals are rescue animals and are fun to look at. The zoo staff are friendly. There is also toy train ride we can enjoy.
title: Austin Zoo

text: Went 30mins after opening it was not that busy or packed so it was nice to walk around. We had a wagon but decided to leave it at the entrance and walk. First time going here and for my toddler to go to a zoo and see animals. They have free roaming peacocks which was really neat you seen them all over the place. It is a sanctuary so not super big or have a lot of different animals (hippos, rhino, flamingo, ect.) Still for kids who never seen animals or aren't keen on walking around for hours like bigger zoos this is perfect still enjoyable.
title: Austin Zoo

text: Great little zoo!  We really enjoyed it and loved the rescue based mission. We did get a membership for our family of 4 as we intend to come back at least once and it made financial sense to do so.  It was still pretty hot here in Texas so most of the animals were sleeping in the shade but we still enjoyed the hill country landscape and reading their stories. Looking forward to coming back!
title: Austin Zoo

text: I had a lot of fun here. There were lots of unique animals. A lot of them were tired from the summer heat but so were we. It's a fun place to walk around. We turned our backs to the white tiger and she jumped at us. It was startling but pretty cool at the same time. It may not be as paved and built up as zoos like the San Antonio and Houston Zoo but it's has it's own charm that I really enjoyed. It was amazing to be able to see a rescue zoo! We got to see many of the animals eating and relaxing, it was a really great experience. I would recommend to anyone who lives in the area.
title: Austin Zoo

text:
A rescue zoo so I will no give less than 5 stars for what they do for these neglected animals. üíñ thank you for your service.
That being said, great for kids but pretty sad as most of them were "pets" who were abandoned and major stress and mental suffering was clearly present. Left me feeling down a bit. Amazing galopagose tortoise and other animals too.
title: Austin Zoo

text: Had some free time on a Sunday morning and thought we'd check out the zoo in our new city. Now we're from San Diego (home to the World Famous San Diego Zoo) so we know great zoos. As my teenager daughter said, it's like a petting zoo. This is not your typical zoo. They rescue animals (there was a three-legged fox there). The walkways are dirt. The variety of animals is limited. I'd say this is a great place for families with young kids. It's a couple hour adventure for young ones. We walked through in under an hour.
title: Austin Zoo

text: Small zoo, animals kept in very tight closures. It was okay and the train ride was fun but the zoo itself was not that great.
title: Austin Zoo

text:
Lions, tigers and kids oh my! Austin zoo is prides themselves in giving rescued animals a chance for a new life. They take them in, feed and care for them.

They have an area where you can feed goats & llamas. Peacocks strut their colorful, eye-catching feathers around the park.

It‚Äôs a perfect venue for your child‚Äôs birthday party! You can reserve a private room and even learn about animals & pet one!

Don‚Äôt forget to take a ride on the train with your little ones! It‚Äôs always a big hit!
title: Austin Zoo

text: It's great for little kids, my granddaughter loves the train ride! Bring a picnic. Will definitely return when it cools down some!
title: Austin Zoo

text: Our visit to the Austin zoo was enjoyable and there are plenty of animals to see. Lots of shade helps with the sun and the pathways are easy to navigate. The staff are friendly and the animals appear well cared for. There's a train and plenty of kids' activities. The zoo does show some wear and is in need of upkeep here and there  but overall it's a nice place for a stroll on a beautiful day.
title: Austin Zoo

text:
10/10 experience!!!! Well worth the money. We spent about 2 hours here and definitely could‚Äôve stayed longer.

Since there‚Äôs so many trees, it was shaded basically the entire zoo, which is a must in the Texas sun.

Love that this is a rescue zoo and their conservation mission. We loved reading about where each animal came from.

Also, since the animals are rescued, they weren‚Äôt hiding like they do in normal zoos. We went as soon as they open, and everyone was out and about in their exhibits.

Our favorite part was definitely feeding the goats and alpacas but it was also amazing seeing lions and cougars that close up!

We will definitely be back and will be bringing friends!!
title: Austin Zoo

text:
This little zoo is great! We went here on a weekday, so it wasn't very crowded. The zoo is a rescue zoo, so all the animals are surrendered or given to them by other zoos or state facilities.
Every enclosure has a sign with some information about the animal species and also the backstory of this animal specific which I love. I think this provides a lot of education to people.
I love the lions, they were so beautiful, I wish they had a more engaging enclosure same with the bears ( which they are renovating).
There's also a train to see some additional animals which can't be seen by foot.
This zoo is great for all ages, to see the animals and learn about their species and backstories.
title: Austin Zoo

text:
This was a great experience.. when we first got there it must have been nap time because not one animal was awake that we could see so we just walked around and took in the scenery and by the time we   got to a point where we had to turn around everybody was awake . And we figured out that it was now feeding time... Very cool to watch the animals come out of their slumber to let the humans know it's time to eat! All the enclosures were large and clean with plenty of stimulation for the animals so that was great to see...
They also have plaques or signs on most of the enclosures with a backstory as to how the animal ended up there, if there was a story to be told. All in all a very good experience and super affordable.
title: Austin Zoo

text: This zoo is actually not bad, it's a very zen like zoo. I went on a day where it wasn't crowded at all but all the good animals were inside. I went around twice to check on the lions, bears and tigers. So the 2nd time around the lions and bears were out but that white tiger was in chill mood in the hut. Nice place to take the kids and learn about animals.
title: Austin Zoo

text: Visited in January on a cloudy day and most of the park is shut down.  Train not running,  animals in due to cold. Areas closed off for unknown reasons.  Wouldn't recommend for elderly or handicapped visitors, the walkways are uneven and muddy in places. Loved the lions,  and the Bengal tiger who made a showing for us (gorgeous). More of a refuge than a zoo.
title: Austin Zoo

text: Had my daughters birthday here and it was worth every bit of the money! We rented the peacock pavilion, pre purchased feed bags for the kids to feed the livestock and opted to add on the "animal experience" where a staff member came over with a box turtle, a tarantula and a ball python to teach the kids about them. I recommend coming early when the feedings are going on as the animals are way more active and the temperature is nice. We love it!
title: Austin Zoo

text: It was a small zoo, but my kids enjoyed every bit of it! You can visit the entire place within 30 mins..we went on a week day evening, it was less people! And people who work there were extremely nice and can tell that they love their job! We enjoyed seeing, beautiful peacocks, monkeys, goats, lamas, lion & tiger!
title: Austin Zoo

text:
This is not a flashy zoo, and it is really off the beaten path. You won't see extremely exotic critters. They have lemurs, monkeys, tortoises, snakes, parrots, bears, lions, tigers and a petting zoo section.

Why would you come here, then? Because you'll feel good patronizing a place with its mission. They rescue animals and give them a better life.

I like a zoo that not only cares for their animals, but also tries to make sure people know how hard it is to care for parrots. I like a zoo whose staff connect with the patrons. And folks, I loved the alpacas and prairie dogs as well as the other critters I listed. Recommended.
title: Austin Zoo

text:
Came here based on reviews and don‚Äôt understand what the hype was all about. It‚Äôs a pricey ticket for what it is. The zoo is not well kept by any means(fallen trees, wood from cages broken, signs worn out). The spaces for the animals to be in were very small. I came with a double stroller and can say this zoo is not made for strollers tos a very rocky path and uphill. There wasn‚Äôt many exciting animals and the zoo was very small.

The only cool thing was the snake a zookeeper had in the reptile section and let us touch.
title: Austin Zoo

text: What an amazing little zoo. I highly recommend going when they open because the animals are more active. We got to see the lions, tigers and bears up super close. To see those majestic animals that close was epic.
title: Austin Zoo

text: My husband and I decided to stop in at the zoo while we were in Austin and had a little extra time to spare. I love that this is more of a rescue facility than a traditional zoo. It's so sad that most of these animals needed rescuing because of some stupid human that thought they would make a pet of a wild animal but it is wonderful that this facility exists to take them in! I loved being able to visit the Galapagos tortoises!
title: Austin Zoo

text: I wasn't expecting AZA zoo level fare, and I was neither disappointed nor thrilled with my visit. Animal enclosures seem to be a decent enough size in general, but many are concrete substrate and seem a little bare-bones as far as enrichment. I did enjoy getting to see the Galapagos tortoises so closely, but as a whole it was simply a nice visit but not one I'd be champing at the bit to return to.
title: Austin Zoo

text: Definitely worth the drive! While not as big and sprawling as the San Diego or Denver Zoo, the Austin Zoo has a cool selection of animals that the kids loved and we're able to actually see the animals a lot closer then they would of been anywhere else. I've never been able to see multiple peacocks up close and personal before! The park was very clean with lots of trees for shade. The staff really made this place shine as EVERYONE said hello or good morning, honestly it was surreal how friendly everyone was!
title: Austin Zoo

text: There were not as many animals as we'd hoped to see. There were areas closed off to protect the most vulnerable animals during the pandemic which I support, however it was hard to see several exhibits because of this. The exotic animals were beautiful and that made the trip worth it. I am giving 4 stars because they are a rescue zoo, and take great care of their animals.
title: Austin Zoo

text: Great little zoo. Perfect for taking small kids. Lots of shade trees for hot days.
title: Austin Zoo

text: Great food and service the place is in the basement will be returning for sure to try what i didn't this time !!!!

text: Really nice restaurant with attentive staff.  The food is delicious and the grounds are beautiful.
title: Edelweiss Restaurant

text: Wonderful charm, kind staff, amazing food!! Will be back for more!
title: Edelweiss Restaurant

text: Amazing german food and wine, excellent service, and inlove all the German pictures, videos, maps, artifacts and decorations. This is our favorite restaurant for family celebrations.
title: Edelweiss Restaurant

text: Always Good food, all the staff are so kind & always with a Happy Face, like they missed You!ü•∞üåπüòéLove going on Wednesday so you can try different things üòãYummy
title: Edelweiss Restaurant

text: 1st 2 items I ordered,  they came back and told me they were out of them. The weiner schnitzel however,  was very good and the waitress was nice.
title: Edelweiss Restaurant

text:
This place is amazing.  Talk about taking yourself back in time for a minute you feel like you are in Germany.  They open at 5pm for dinner only.  You drive down this  dark road, and you would never know there was a parking lot and a restaurant from the top of the road.
You go inside from the parking lot on a top level,  down a flight of  stairs is the restaurant.  They do have an elevator for handicap.
Once below it's amazing.  It's small probably about 30 tables, wooden walls, and all decorated with Germany memorabilia.
I was so excited to try this place the last time I had German food was in Germany 20 plus years ago.  I still remember what that tasted like.
There was 2 waitress serving and taking orders. Lisa was our waitress.  She is such a nice lady,  and definitely knows her menu,  and has worked their for a long time.  I ordered the German beer on tap it was very light, clear, and refreshing. My other half Bayrischer Schweinebraten it was a tender slow roasted pork shoulder.  I tasted the dish and it was amazing.  Very tender and with lots of flavor.  It was not sliced it was more like chunk pork. His side was the sliced apples.  I have never tried apples sliced fresh, in a cinnamon sauce.  I wish you could order this by the pint or quart to take home.  Amazing!
I ordered J√§gerschnitzel which was delicious with the cream white wine sauce, and mushroom.  The sauce was so good I asked for a little more sauce. The pork meat was tender, and a nice slice. My sides was potato pancakes oh my goodness hold the fork these were not greasy at all.  I put the sour cream and applesauce on the potato cakes. My other side I was wanting to try was the German potato salad.  It was good, completely traditional,  but not my favorite for my taste buds. Before dinner you have a choice of soup or salad.  I definitely tried the soup which was really good the traditional red cabbage soup.
I can't wait to come back to try more dishes.
For dessert if you have room definitely order the bread pudding with the warm whiskey sauce.  You will want to make room for this dessert.
We were getting ready to leave, they were closing, and they were so nice they make everything fresh daily, and had extra apple and cherry turnovers. I had taken home 1 of each. The next day with a cup of coffee, warmed up,  very good.
I can't wait to come back!
Thank you ladies for such a great experience.
title: Edelweiss Restaurant

text: Amazing service and amazing food. Our family randomly decided to give this place a try to satisfy our want for authentic German food. Everyone loved their food, great recommendations were given by staff. COVID regulations were followed and didn‚Äôt take away from the experience. Excited about the buffet that is held on Wednesday. Family will be going back, amazing first impressions!
title: Edelweiss Restaurant

text: The most beautiful dinner spot in Indianapolis
title: Edelweiss Restaurant

text: The atmosphere took me right back home. The food was delicious. The prices were average. The Pilsner beer was amazing. Every Wednesday is Buffet night with different food choices on the bar each week. Follow them on Facebook for their Menu. Homesickness was cured.....until next week üòâüá∫üá∏üá©üá™
title: Edelweiss Restaurant

text:
This is truly a hidden gem!

They have a dance group anyone can join; it's been very fun! Wednesdays at 7PM, except for the 2nd Wednesday each month.  I have literally no dance background, but this is folk dancing, so that's fine üòÅ

Edelweiss is located in German Park at the end of the drive.  The park itself isn't anything major, but the scenery is very nice.
Once at the parking lot, you can go in the main entrance and down the stairs to the restaurant or follow the sidewalk north of the building where it slopes down and around the building to their outdoor seating. You can see a gnome garden along the way!
I've seen comments saying this place isn't handicap accessible, but this sidewalk is the entrance to take if you have a wheelchair or stroller.  Understandably, this will be inconvenient if it is raining.
The outdoor seating is the beer garden area and the doors lead into the restaurant.

On Wednesdays there is a buffet.  I'm writing this review after a stop at their buffet and I'm impressed.
On Fridays they have live music; simply amazing fun!

They have several events through the year and I definitely recommend checking them out! Fr√ºhlingsfest, J√§gerfest, Octoberfest and more!

Through the year, they have several German events, including an Octoberfest.  From what I hear, it's a blast!

Additionally, a local Duolingo group has started holding language events here and, separately, there is a lady who gives basic German lessons in the fall.
*Note* September 2022 - I'm not certain if these have started up again yet.
title: Edelweiss Restaurant

text:
Delicious!
Do yourself a favor and order a big bowl of the haus soup!
The cabbage is fantastic. The pork chops were huge and perfectly done.
Portions are enormous
Wish I had room for dessert!
title: Edelweiss Restaurant

text: Awesome food and fantastic service, try the Curry Wurst. Also had the Ruben and pretzel.
title: Edelweiss Restaurant

text: Great selection of German biers (see how I did that?) Not a huge fan of German food, so not a fair judge of that.
title: Edelweiss Restaurant

text: The food here was absolutely terrific! Some places offer homestyle dishes like your mom used to make. This place offers homestyle dishes like someone else's mom made, and they're all delicious. My favorite was the shepherds pie, but everything they served was great. Wednesday nights are "buffeteria" style. They serve you like a cafeteria but you keep going back until you're finished. Non-members price was $16.95 which I felt was fair for the quality of food and service provided. If you want to try something a little out of the ordinary I highly recommend a Edelweiss! I'll certainly be back when I cost the area again. Call ahead reservations are recommended.
title: Edelweiss Restaurant

text: Chicken dance
title: Edelweiss Restaurant

text: Tasty meals in small quantities! Good ambiance too!
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: This experience exceeded my expectations. Highlights included the gnocchi which was prefectly light and flavorful and the Ube cheesecake which with sorbet on top was a novel and delicious take on a classic. I highly recommend the Elm.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: I'm sure this is something many reviews will say, but it's such a cool atmosphere, especially for Bloomington. We had the ribeye and the chicken sandwich, both were great, especially the ribeye. We also had a wonderful spicy jalape√±o/Cherry margarita and a quality Manhattan. We had made reservations online beforehand, and were seated right away. The service was perfecto and I'm sure we'll be back again in a month or two since there's seasonal menu items. If you need a place for a nice date night, or celebrating a special occasion, tis a perfect spot.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: It is a hit or a miss when I go to the Elm, but the drinks and the desserts are always good!
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: I want to begin by saying I really love the atmosphere. The tables are spaced out enough that there is not much noise and it‚Äôs easy to talk to your table. The interior decoration is also very beautiful. There is not much parking but I live close so I walked. The food was delicious but there were just enough weird things that made me give 4 instead of 5 stars. The bread and butter (which is its own appetizer) is OK but definitely not anything to write home about, the butter pat was cold so not easily spreadable. I ordered the cauliflower main dish with sauce and golden raisins knowing it would be lighter than a meat main. However, with the price of the dish, I was expecting a bit more than 1/4 of a cauliflower head for my main meal. I know inflation and prices are high but cauliflower? Seems they could‚Äôve spared a bit more. Additionally the olive oil cake with rhubarb and strawberry ice cream was good but the ice cream stole the show! The cake itself was just ok and the rhubarb had not been sweetened enough to make it palatable, I ended up taking it off. The service was good but not great, we had a new server and she made a few missteps that ultimately would have cost our party money if we hadn‚Äôt spoken up (as opposed to slow service, etc). Overall, I definitely want to go back to the elm, i will just choose my dishes more carefully.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Outstanding local restaurant.  Unusual menu that changes regularly.  Great open atmosphere.  Make a reservation as they are usually full. The only drawback is that parking can be difficult in the neighborhood.  They have a small parking lot in front and alongside the building. You can park in any space that says "customer parking only".
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: You can easily spend $50-100 or more per person here. You might leave hungry without an appetizer or desert. We were very pleased with our drinks and entrees. Beautiful space, modern and refined. Lovely patio. Romantic.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Elm was lovely! All the staff was so warm, friendly and helpful. The atmosphere was so unique for Bloomington. I felt transported to a metropolitan area‚Ä¶in all the best ways! It‚Äôs upscale, but yet cozy and modern. The mezzanine had a different vibe than the downstairs, but both were lovely! They also have a separate room upstairs for a small event or work meeting/lunch. There is a bar both upstairs and downstairs which is neat! Beyond the atmosphere, the food was good and the presentation was great. I had the beet salad which was small but very tasty! The homemade gnocchi with pesto sauce and toasted pine nuts was also delicious! I can‚Äôt wait for my next visit!
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Absolutely smashing food and amazing drinks. Bailey, our bartender, was the absolute best. Do check this place out! This place is definitely one of Bloomington's best!
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Absolutely stunning! Incredible interior, great staff, and most importantly: the food is delicious! Apparently a lot of it is locally sourced and made in house. Very reasonable prices for all of this.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: I couldn't have asked for a nicer birthday dinner. The staff were lovely (thanks, Tam), the interior has a beautiful modern, earthy vibe, and the food was great. I especially liked the matcha creme brulee, baby beet salad, harissa cauliflower, and salted pistachio latte. We're so excited something is finally in this space again.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text:
The Elm is beautiful, gorgeous even, and the staff were friendly, attentive and good at their jobs. The menu is big enough that there are enough choices but it's not overwhelming. The cocktail menu is inventive.
I mention all of this because the bar, from the moment you walk in the door, is set very very high. And the food is great. It's just not quite as beautiful as the decor or as perfect as the menu describes.
The tostones are plentiful and the brussel sprouts are crispy. But the sauces leave something to be desired.
The steak and lamb were excellently cooked but greens and asparagus needed a little more flavor.
But hot damn the olive oil cake was good. The seasonal rhubarb, strawberry and pistachio pairing was divine. Textures and flavors, yum!
I'll be back for espresso and dessert ASAP!
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: It's hard to believe a place like this exists in Bloomington. It's like walking into a trendy bar / restaurant in a major city. The cocktails are original and interesting. I ordered the Choconut Negroni and it was unlike anything and I have drunk before. And interesting blend of Jen, cocoa nib infused sweet remove, and coconut fat washed campari, It is entirely original and fun to drink. Next I tried the espresso martini. I've had plenty of those in my lifetime and this one was a new twist. Two different kinds of Espresso and tiramisu liqueur woke me up and provided just the right amount of decadence. I didn't try the menu but it looks excellent. This would be a great place to come with friends or on a date night.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Excellent service and drinks! The decor is beautiful and the food is wonderful. Photos of the pork belly and duck entrees.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text:
My wife and I originally booked a reservation for 8pm on a Friday night but decided to come an hour early to see if we could sit at the bar for a couple of drinks first.

We ended up staying at the lower bar and eating a wonderful dinner. Mostly because of our bartender‚Äôs kindness, professionalism and the great ambiance.

Mushroom kushiyaki and charred avocado for a starter. Then, egg yolk raviolo and chicken roulade for our main course. Delicious on all counts.

It‚Äôs set up as a cafe, as well. We didn‚Äôt experience this side of it. But, highly recommend if you‚Äôre looking for a nice dinner in Bloomington.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Finally had an overpriced and meh dinner at the restaurant. Halibut was overcooked and mushy. Nope. Flavors were good, but its trying too hard at this point. They cant make a good Manhattan and do not care. Its fine for the midwest... meh.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text:
Went for an early Saturday dinner. The place was nicely spaced, the staff was all very professional and friendly, the food was tasty, the pricing was reasonable, and it was upscale (for Bloomington) without being snooty/uncomfortable.

Let's hope it sticks around, cuz I'm planning on becoming a regular.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Very pricey with small portions. The vegan charcuterie had some new flavors to me. The beet salad and duck were good. My partner‚Äôs pasta was bland.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text:
Fantastic interior layout, private dining area from the bar. My brother and I came here for dinner he was in town and I haven't been here yet so we decided to try it. Food was interesting to say the least, we got the CALABRIAN CHILI CUCUMBERS for an app and it was more tangy like pickled cucumbers. Still very refreshing. I got the SWEET CORN AGNOLOTTI  , charred corn very sweet with shredded crab mix, pretty good however needed a little salt added.
My brother got BRAISED PORK BELLY, cooked an amazin crispy skin , however, this one was overly salted. Not bad but our palette was interesting.
Then we ended with dessert CHOCOLATE MOUSSE CAKE and Seasonal Truffles (3)
By far my favorite I've tried, subtle , flavor isn't overpowering (I don't have that much of a sweet tooth) would definitely get the dessert again! The truffles was alright, dark chocolate and white chocolate. Tasted really nice.
Great experience, menu is seasonal so it's nice to see different options.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Excellent menu choices, service is great, and the dessert is delicious. Reservations recommended.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Superb food, great presentation, good service, great location, and a nice ambiance.  One of the top two in Bloomington.  The vegan charcuterie was really good and inventive.  The duck breast was just right and a colorful presentation.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Fantastic experience. We felt comfortable  the moment we got there. Our cocktails were very good and the food was delicious. For just getting started they are already at or above most places in town. The team in the kitchen is made up of local celebrity chefs. It‚Äôs great to see so much talent under one roof. Can‚Äôt wait to see what they put out once they truly hit their stride.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Finally there is a fine dining restaurant in B-town. Seasonal menu with creative ideas, healthy & tasty food, and cool vibe, love it.
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Great service, and the chicken sandwich and freshly baked bread was delicious.  We also enjoyed the drink selection.  Glad that there is excellent bike parking at the restaurant, which we appreciated
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: Wow! Excellent,  fresh and lovely prepared seasonal food. We are so happy to have this little gem in our neighborhood. If you haven't stopped in yet put it on your to do list!!
title: The Elm Restaurant

text: My 10 year old son and I had an absolute blast!! We had so much fun the staff was so friendly and helpful we got to play 3 different fields and there is even a target range to try out your accuracy we culd not be happier with our time hear and will definitely be back meany more times
title: Paintball Paradise - Indoor & Outdoor Paintball Park & Store

text: Great exhibition
title: Paintball Paradise - Indoor & Outdoor Paintball Park & Store

text: good for party
title: Paintball Paradise - Indoor & Outdoor Paintball Park & Store

text: Kids had a blast for their bday party. Staff are super knowledgable and awesome with the kids, it wasn't our "cheapest" party but definitely worth it. We spent about $450 or so but that was for 9 kids and myself, 4 pizzas, drinks, coverall rentals, guns ( they deal with the CO2) masks and we bought 100 extra paintballs.  Birthday boy gets a free gun upgrade. You can get almost 3 hours if you ration paintballs properly.  Its been a couple weeks and the kids are still talking about it.
title: Paintball Paradise - Indoor & Outdoor Paintball Park & Store

text: Had a great time!
title: Paintball Paradise - Indoor & Outdoor Paintball Park & Store

text:
This IS the best value in Elko! The room was $60 and some change and I cant say enough about them!
Room was clean and modern. There was a tub, which is ALWAYS a plus. Hotel was quiet and well stocked. (See photos)
But the number one thing about Quality Inn and Suites was the above and beyond Customer Service. The young lady was polite, thoughtful enough to put my Pooch close to the dog park out back amongst other things.
title: Quality Inn & Suites Elko

text: The FULL, hot breakfast is great here! Its a rarity to find a breakfast like this these days. There were many many options. Something for every family member and saved our family of four at least $30 had we gotten it as a restaurant. So if you take that into account with the price of the hotel staying was very affordable! Clean hotel. As a Mom, I couldn't give a hotel without a pool for the kids more than four stars. Also, the bathroom in our room needs a new toilet seat and a new shower head. Over all very happy we stayed here. ***If you liked my review or found it to be helpful give it a thumbs up. üëç thanks!
title: Quality Inn & Suites Elko

text: We were just passing through and come across this gem of a hotel. Great price, Nice clean rooms, great hot breakfast. The hospitality was amazing. Pet friendly and understanding of our 2 dogs that don't really care for other people or animals and bark when they see them. An amazing big off leash dog run behind the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling with pets and anyone else looking for a quite clean place to stay.
title: Quality Inn & Suites Elko

text: I have a Room on the bottom floor and I like it because I can see my car out the window. Also when I got into the Room it was really clean and smelled great. Everything in the Room is lovely there is a refrigerator freezer and microwave. They also have a coffee maker and a nice flat screen TV. Plenty of light in here and also plenty of plug INS I can't tell you how important light and plug INS are to me. I will definitely stay here again! Also they are pet friendly!
title: Quality Inn & Suites Elko

text: The hotel is nice and offers comfortable accommodation with the exception of a mini fridge.  I've attached a copy of the not so welcoming note that was posted on the "Refreshment Center" where most hotels would have a mini fridge. They really do need to rethink this policy.

text: Better than average casino.  Has a horse racetrack, sports betting area, and casino with slot machines and table games.  In late July 2021 they had self yourself sodas and coffee.

The casino was fun and the dealers great.

text: This is a nice place, but I'm not sure if I would call it a four star hotel like their site says. I have differently stayed in some much nicer four star hotel. The carpet in my room was differently old and needed replaced. But the casino is very nice and big for a East coast casino, and the complimentary breakfast at the hotel was awesome.

text: I had to switch rooms 3 times due to issues.  The water went out twice and when they turned it back on it was nasty.  I wasn‚Äôt able to shower before my flight.  The rooms are dated and not modern.  I guess you pay for what you get.  Definitely should not be considered a 4 star hotel.  It maybe could be considered a 3 star.

text: Had a great time at the hotel and casino. Wonderful room with nice bedding. Breakfast was spectacular, with the option to get custom made omelets and anything the guy can cook up.
title: Mardi Gras Casino & Resort

text: Very nice Casino. I've been donating to this Casino ever since I've been in West Virginia for work. The atmosphere is very welcoming and I feel like I'm going to win big, every time I go! :)  One of the best things there is their Huge Swiss Burger from the Cafe', its so good!  Highly recommend Mardi Gras Casino to anyone that enjoys a good time, alone or with friends!
title: Mardi Gras Casino & Resort

text: Hotel is dusty, outdated dirty carpet in room the shower had mold , no microwave in the room . I stayed one night at $177 I felt dirty just touching anything in the room would not recommend staying there even if it is convenient to the casino.

text: The slots are way too tight. We spent $$$ and never won more than $23.
title: Mardi Gras Casino & Resort

text:
Nice. 3 restaurants. Live music and dance floor and a friendly staff. The food in the restaurant overlooking the dog track was very good. I had the fish and chips and a garden salad. The garden salad is welll, you might share it. Lol....Good.üôÇüëç
Returned to the Casino in November to dine at the restaurant overlooking the dog track. You can dine and watch the races from your comfortable seat and table.
I ordered the prime rib and a Cobb salad with mashed potatoes and green beans.
CAUTION: The Cobb salad is enough for 2 people or one very hungry person! Delicious! The prime rib was very good too. The potatoes and beans were good but too much food. Lol. Never thought I'd say that.

text: Enjoyed our visit to the casino.  They are handling the social distancing very well.  Had a lot of fun getting bonus games on the slots.  Can't wait to visit again.

text: I didn't go to gamble, I went for the food, in that area of West Virginia they definitely had the best food around at an amazing price. The seating wasn't great, but it was geared for gambling on the racetrack, so cant fault them for that. But the food was really really good.
title: Mardi Gras Casino & Resort

text: I always lose when I go but I enjoy myself anyway! We had a great time!
title: Mardi Gras Casino & Resort

text: Nice casino, went mid week, so not too busy. Had fun at the slots, very friendly staff.  Rv parking available
title: Mardi Gras Casino & Resort

text: French Quarter restaurant had delicious food. Little on the pricey side, but very healthy portions!  Hotel was very nice for the price!
title: Mardi Gras Casino & Resort

text: Quick visit. Huge gaming floor. Lots of excitement. Could be better if they offered on-floor servers for those gambling who don't want to lose their machine.
title: Mardi Gras Casino & Resort

text: Love this place.  It's big plenty of room. Very kind employees.  Will come back for sure
title: Mardi Gras Casino & Resort

text: What a great place to get away and enjoy yourself for a little while. As a parent of four kids, a little getaway adult time is exactly what I needed!
