text: Just love the views this course gives you.
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text:
Wonderful course year round!
Awesome par 3s brilliant long par 5s
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text: Wildwood is a great course. Lots of fun, fair prices. They have a friendly helpful staff, and keep the course in great shape.
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text:
Four of us from Honolulu, Hawaii played this course on September 26, 2016 and we absolutely enjoyed the round.  Great staff, course and surroundings. Had previously called Bob to inquire about the course due to the mixed reviews.  Wildwood GC provides exceptional value and we put this course on our play again course whenever we're up here in the Portland area. Our foursome consisted of three Waialae Country Club and one Mid-Pacific Country Club members.  Mahalo Bob for taking great care of us.

Returned to play with some other buddies on May 6, 2017 before heading back to Honolulu the next day after a  five day golfing tour in the greater Portland area.  They were impressed Wildwood is on their "will play again" list.  Thanks Tom and the rest of the staff for taking care of us and welcoming us back.  Will be back up there in early-October with the original 2016 Honolulu guys!

PS: Wildwood has great drainage so this is one of three courses we now know that is playable after heavy rains.
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text: Beautiful course just outside of Portland near Sauvie Island. Very hilly and challenging. The course is well cared for with very nice greens and fairways. Views are amazing! Driving range is small, no drivers allowed.
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text: Pretty course,  nice staff, divot slices all over the course and divots on the greens constantly.  Tee shrapnel about.  Still the nicest course around.
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text:
very cool course.
nice staff.
over 70 yamaha golf carts stoked and ready to rip!
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text: Great little Golf Course seldom that busy always a challenge prices are usually reasonable they did a great job of remodeling their dining area and deck
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text: Very fun! Short. Quirky. A lot of elevation change. Greens are in really good shape.
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text: Amazing course
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text: Wonderful views. Well maintained course. Great cost for value.
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text:
Had a terrific first round. Friendly staff, fun and varied layout. Got to use nearly every club in the bag. Pretty as any course in the area. I‚Äôm coming back in two days with some old pals.

What I liked most about it was that my wife felt comfortable there. Can‚Äôt tell you how many clubs develop a culture where women are made to feel like trespassers. But Wildwood had a varied and diverse group today and it made me excited to return.
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text:
Just played here on Sunday 10/6, about three weeks post-punching. The greens are fantastic. They're rolling very smooth and true..and at a great speed. They're firm, yet they're holding shots the way they should. Also, the traps were all hand raked, and fairways were very playable.

Look for a new expanded green complex and new lower tee on the par three # 6, and new tee locations on # 7. One thing that always impresses me about Wildwood, is the attention to detail, and the constant reinvestment in the course and clubhouse.

Also, the service is always friendly and accommodating. If you've never played Wildwood, be sure to give it a try. It's a real hidden gem of a golf course, with plenty of interesting holes, lots of character and challenges, and spectacular views.

And finally, Wildwood is in such a peaceful, serene setting, that it has an amazing overall calming impact on my game, as you can see in the photo below, taken at the 15th tee.
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text: Really enjoy Wildwood. The course is always in good condition and the prices always seem fair. I play courses that charge more or just as much as Wildwood, but are over crowded and not as pretty. The layout provides variety for the holes. It has a parkland feel that is cut into a hill side. There is only one house that lines the fairway. About half of the holes have an elevated gain at the green or tee box.  It might be a ride for some. If the walk from the first tee box or the walk to the 9th green look steep to you. You have a similar walk about 9 or 10 times. Even though it is right off HWY 30, it is really peaceful on the course.
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text: Very nice course. Prices are good, staff is friendly, greens are well maintained.  Back 9 more challenging than the front. Get a gas cart, some of the electric ones can barely climb the hills. Oh and if you are not in shape take a cart as the hills are a plenty.
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text:
Challenging holes are carved out of the hillside along the river at this course to provide something for everyone. First and foremost there is more vertical change at this course than many I have played in the past. Some pin locations are a hundred feet above the tee box while others are the same downhill. This makes it almost a must to rent a cart if you are playing 18, unless you are in peak physical condition.

The clubhouse is big and clean with friendly staff members to help out with your needs. The range is quite short and narrow, only 200 yards max by about 20 yards wide which makes it hard to warm up for the long shots you will need to be successfull right off the first tee. The carts are older and gas powered which made it tricky to get up some if the steep hills and there is some slow play if you are behind the wrong group.

Insider tip: make sure to study the course before you go if you haven't played here. There are hidden creeks and obstacles that ruin great shots down the middle. Better yet, play a practice round so you'll be ready before taking it on!
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text: Great time. Great place
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text:
Wildwood has it all in the name! It's wild and in the woods. Expect to use a cart or be sore the next day from walking- but those are both great options!

Nestled in the foothills of Forest Park (one of the nation's largest urban pakrs) the gorgeous setting allows unparalleled views. If you find yourself frustrated about your golf game, you can take a moment to see beautiful glimpses Mt. Hood, Mt. St. Helens, and countless other bounties of nature.

Oh yes of course- golf! The course itself is well-maintained, and has its own unique blend of challenges and opportunities. Navigating through a "normal" course is challenged in its own rite, but couple that with nestling into the side of a mountain and you have Wildwood!

You owe it to yourself to make the trip out there to enjoy it. You can thank me later!
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text: Beautiful course and fantastic staff. Definitely worth a visit.
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text: Glorious setting, great staff, and we love the weekend music.  Thank you!
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text: Great course, atmosphere, experience and service!
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text:
Usually always walk 18. It‚Äôs a great workout and beautiful scenery. Always a pleasure, no matter how bad the play.
Speedy greens, well maintained. Good drainage in the rainy season.
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text: Course was immaculate with beautiful views throughout. Staff in club house was helpful and the other golfers were courteous. Has to be the best value in Portland. Honestly could not recommend higher.
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text: Best course for the money you'll ever find. Elevated tees make it a blast!
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text: Loved this place was my first time and I am going back alot more very challenge course
title: Wildwood Golf Course

text:
We thoroughly enjoyed our quick, overnight stay here. The staff was friendly, our room was clean and the breakfast was hot and fresh.
While there, we also discovered that we were the first to ever bring a pet to their hotel, ever! My dog, Grimley, greatly appreciated his welcome goodie bag and how close our room was to the exit ‚ò∫Ô∏è
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: We got upgraded to the suite, which allowed for a little more room. There was a couch instead of another bed. The shower had a tub, and a great shower head. The room was clean, the staff was friendly, and the breakfast was good. Would stay again.
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: One of the larger Hamptons in which we've stayed. Easy check in and out. Ample luggage cart space. Clean, comfortable, quiet room - made for good sleep. Wish there were tables (even a small shelf) on both sides of bed. Clear desk and bedside table with plug-ins made setting up computer, phones, and other equipment easy. Companion enjoyed the pool (could be cooler) and hot tub (could be warmer). Good equipment options in workout room. Breakfast options included blueberry or malt mini-waffles, cheese omelets, bacon, biscuits, gravy, fruit, cereal, breads and pastries, yogurt. REALLY appreciated separate seating with one television instead of having to hear others' choices; our table was in a quiet, large, open area. Omelets ran out so staff member brought them to our table when more were ready. Good location near highway.
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: Awesome place! Very friendly staff!
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: Friendly- clean - accommodating
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: The rooms are spacious and the beds are comfortable. We enjoyed the pool and the hot tub. There was an exercise room too. I absolutely loved their breakfast. The lack of a mini fridge and a coffee maker in the room was very disappointing.
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: We splurged on the King Suite.  It had a bedroom and living room. There were two TVs although the living room TV was small.  Would be nice if you could connect streaming devices easier.  Good lighting and outlets.  Comfortable bed.  Pool adequate for laps.  Hot tub nice although timer/jets not really working.  No guest laundry.  Incredibly helpful staff.  Several chain restaurants within walking distance.
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: Easy to find, access, and exit Hampton. Conveniently located at the highway exit and next door to three resturaunts  and a Sinclair gas station with mini-mart. Clean facility with very good service and a complimentary breakfast. Trucks with up to 30 ft trailers can manage this lot others can easily park curbside. It has all the usual ammenities.
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: Facility was clean and they let us check in early as we were driving all night. Kids loved the pool. The o ly suggestion I would make would be to improve the pool area. It looks like the hot tub is plagued with black mold, and there is rusty metal in the pool.
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: Very clean rooms and very helpful staff. The breakfast was also very tasty and provided lots of options as far as the buffet goes. 10/10 would stay again!
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text:
Location, staff, beds were great. Breakfast was good, except the choice of Turkey sausage for a protein. Can we just get pork sausage? Otherwise, buffet was a hit.

More significant, we chose the King "executive suite" room for the larger room and the separate bedroom. Well, except for the strange choice of clear windows for the doors between rooms. Why?! No privacy in the bedroom.
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: Love it! I'm staying for almost a week. Everyone here has been wonderful! They even called me when my lost luggage came in and took it to my room. Very clean rooms, cleanest pool and spa I've seen at a hotel, the biggest free breakfast (including omelettes, meats, potatoes, waffles, etc.) Great hotel!
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: When I travel for business I like to stay the Hampton Inn for the service.  Always have good experiences. Although,  I'm a  bit disappointed with this location  because the decors and furnitures are a bit outdated.  My bed wasnt made.
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: Superb dog-friendly hotel. Upon check-in, we were given a helpful information sheet, dog treats and a spare doggie bag. Room was very clean and quiet. Two restaurants within walking distance with a 10 % discount if you show your card key. Very friendly staff. We went to a dog park referenced on our information sheet and it was a great park! Waggin Tails!
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: We were driving across the country. Made reservation on my app. We arrived late at 11:30pm and the Receptionist was very friendly and helpful. We got to our room quickly and to bed even faster. Had a wonderful nights rest. Got up for a morning run and there us a beautiful trail along the Platte River. Housekeeping were all very welcoming and friendly. Breakfast was perfect. We would recommend this Hotel.
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: Very nice employees, great rooms and a good breakfast
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: Old, run down. Saw ants & a spider by the pool. Rooms are dated from the 80's. WI FI is shoddy @ best. Given the wrong room. No refrigerator! 2nd floor ice machine takes at least 5 minutes to produce ice, not alot of ice btw
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: The place was exceptionally clean. The staff bent over backwards to make sure everything was taken care of. The place has SOFT WATER!
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text:
Reserved our deluxe king room with jetted tub for Sept 19th back in mid June 2021 & requested a quiet location (if possible). They put us in room 314, which was located on 3rd of 4 floors, right outside of the elevators & across from the ice machine room (very noisy).

The bath towels were thin, rough, and worn (one had two rips on edges... see pics). Jetted tub was the best part of the room, but took forever to fill up. But, for some stupid reason there was NO vent fan in the bathroom! Horrible!

The furnishings were a bit dated & I wouldn't call the size of the king room a "deluxe". Reserved that room purely because I knew after a 12 hr drive I'd want to soak in a nice big bath tub. Mattress was comfy, but only 3 squishy pillows (not 4) on the king sized bed (no neck support at all).

I wouldn't pay $172 (after taxes) for another stay in a king sized room there (booked thru Expedia.com). A bit disappointing.
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: First time here, did the reservation online on the way.  Brandon called just as i was getting off the freeway to check on us, so thoughtful.  Great price,  friendly service. The room is nice and clean.
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: Had a great stay here! Would definitely stop in again if I‚Äôm passing by!
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: Well the room, people and services are great as expected.  The hot tub is ridiculously small.  The pool area is huge but has a hot tub made for children.  They have plenty of room for a 8 to 10 person tub but have one that is cozy for 2 adults.  We also had some equipment stolen off out trailer.  The lack of security is very surprising.
title: Hampton Inn North Platte

text: I am appalled at the quality of service and food at this place. While a family of Mexicans sitting next to us got served like royalty we were put on the back burner the waitress came over a total of three times while we were there. She also loved to flirt with her boss the whole time while ignoring us! We ran out of chips and salsa asked for more and didn't get any until after we got our food. When I got my plate. The portion was so small ! I had maybe 10 tiny pieces of meat and 4 pieces of shrimp on my dish which was the muscle maker . The lettuce was all brown and nasty. The avocado looked rotten. And not just a normal oxidation brown but it looked like it had been sitting and got rotten and they didn't care. Also only got like three slices of avocado. The dish looked nothing like the picture on the menu. I would have sent it back immediately but the waitress ran off and never even came back until it was to bring  the check. I didn't eat a bite of it and they tried to charge me for it until we talked to the manager! His excuse was they were training them. Yeah whatever. Never coming back here again. Waste of money and time.
title: El Azteca Mexican Restaurant

text: Jalisco enchiladas were so good ! The staff was pleasant and the place was clean. Service was fast! I would certainly eat this dish again ! My friend had the steak tacos and really enjoyed them as well
title: El Azteca Mexican Restaurant

text: Great service and even greater food. The shrimp cocktails are the best I've had in Wichita area.
title: El Azteca Mexican Restaurant

text:
Gross canned corn.

Confused service took forever when we were the only 2 in the place. Order a drink? 5 minutes to visibly roll silverware in the back before the drink hits the table.

Management creates this problem.
title: El Azteca Mexican Restaurant

text: Delicious food and friendly service
title: El Azteca Mexican Restaurant

text:
Reliable hangout. Great daily drink
Specials. Quiet enough for a conversation alone, or with multiple guests.
title: El Azteca Mexican Restaurant

text:
This place is AMAZING!!! Great food, great atmosphere, and the staff was super friendly! We will be back!!

Update: We love coming here! The food is always good when we come and we love Brenda!!
title: El Azteca Mexican Restaurant

text: Get off your phones.
title: El Azteca Mexican Restaurant

text: Alex at El Azteca hooked us up with a secret desert that may soon come to the menu!!! This is a cheesecake desert that‚Äôs nothing shy of AMAZING!! If you love Mexican food and deserts this is definitely a place to stop by. Very polite staff and gets food out quickly!!! With a reasonable pricing why not stop here!!!! Great place!!! A++++
title: El Azteca Mexican Restaurant

text: We like the tilapia dishes and the muscle maker. We get the tilapia with a guacamole salad for the side instead of rice to be keto friendly. Fish tacos on lettuce wrap is also good.
title: El Azteca Mexican Restaurant

text: First visit. Great food. Awesome cheese dip. Shrimp, beef cheese meal with tortillas was very good
title: El Azteca Mexican Restaurant

text: Great service, delicious food!
title: El Azteca Mexican Restaurant

text: Excellent service and food but small space and dirty bathrooms. They were crowded with the Friday night rush so we cut them slack in our review. Food came in large portions and wait staff was ever present when our drinks got low or we needed anything. Definitely will be back!
title: El Azteca Mexican Restaurant

text: The Food ,and the staff are exceptional!!!
title: El Azteca Mexican Restaurant

text:
I grew up on the West Coast, eating Mexican food was a staple.
I've been waiting for a place like this for a long time since moving to Noblesville in 2006. This place is excellent, friendly staff and the place looked spotless. My torta was very tasty and look forward to trying the taco's next time I come.
Well done guys
title: Burritos & Beer Restaurant, LLC

text: Great food and very friendly! I come here all the time and the food never disappoints! My family and I come here probably 1 or 2 times a week (the food is that good! Very authentic and lots of choices of combinations of your choosing! Great Jalape√±o ranch and very affordable! The staff is great and love supporting family businesses like this one all the time!
title: Burritos & Beer Restaurant, LLC

text: Very nice and clean place, the food is delicious and service is great. They serve a lot of food so you get a lot for what you pay for.
title: Burritos & Beer Restaurant, LLC

text: Love this place. Great food and feel right when you walk in.
title: Burritos & Beer Restaurant, LLC

text: First time trying this place.  I got a taco salad with carne asada.  I will say, i was not disappointed. The place seemed very popular, because it was pretty packed. Looked like they even had taco de legua on the menu.  Will try it next time.
title: Burritos & Beer Restaurant, LLC

text: I love this place so much have to come here at least once a week
title: Burritos & Beer Restaurant, LLC

text: Always good. Fast friendly service too!!
title: Burritos & Beer Restaurant, LLC

text: So great every time! Delicious quesadillas, great for when you are on the go or want food quickly
title: Burritos & Beer Restaurant, LLC

text: Their burrito game is STRONG!! Putting chain restaurants to shame since opening their doors, this local gem serves up deliciously grande portions of authentic Mexican grub. I ordered the chorizo burrito which doubled as lunch and dinner due to its gigante status. It came with a side of chips and a tasty jalape√±o ranch dressing for dipping. It would have paired beautifully with a cerzeva or two, but I was there for carry out lunch so I laid off the booze until I could come in for a dinner here. Fast service. Clean counters with complimentary hand sanitizer offered at the register. Dine in, carry out, Grubhub delivery, and catering available.
title: Burritos & Beer Restaurant, LLC

text: The food was really good and authentic. The servers were helpful and the food came out quickly. It was also very affordable. I got a burrito and it was quite a lot of food for under ten dollars. üëç
title: Burritos & Beer Restaurant, LLC

text: Freakin' amazing! Had got three tacos and they were totally stuffed and totally delicious! Fast friendly staff and excellent prices! Definitely recommend!
title: Burritos & Beer Restaurant, LLC

text: Enjoyed being back at the Tropicana (I spent time there in the 90's) It was good to see that some of the former Ballys Casino staff, had migrated down beach. . . My room proximity to the Casino was great. Very pleased with the North Tower. Once I figured out, how to get to the 5üåüGilchrist for breakfast. It was during that walk, in the early mornings. I had the chance to observe the Cleaning Crews, and their attention to detail. Hand rails, escalators, elevators, corners of window sills, spotless. . . And the pool I passed at the Chelsea Tower looked so inviting and clean. . . I was Loving once again, my "New" Favorite AC Casino. . . Since merging with Caesars Rewards & Loyalty Program. . . *Update*. . . I want to Thank the Casino Staff for all they do. . . Fran the Floor Manager, is such a gentleman and professional. Big Ed V. Floor Supervisor also a gentlemen and professional, has the ability to make everyone feel welcome and appreciated. . . Sharp dresser and great sense of humor. . . It takes a special talent, to deal with some of these players, when they have been drinking all night. . . I want to recognize some of my favorite Table Games Dealers. Michael, who has been at the Tropicana since it was built. Paul also has been here almost as long. And George another long time employee who is fun, helpful, and hilarious. . . I'm looking forward to seeing them all, on my next trip. . .
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: I wish I could give 0 stars. I‚Äôm a Diamond plus staying in a room worse then a motel 6. They treat gold members better then diamond stay away from this place. I see your response if you truly care about your customers take me out this motel 6 room it‚Äôs Veterans Day weekend I‚Äôm a veteran and diamond plus member and staying in a motel
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
Made our annual trip to AC and had a good time at the Tropicana. Plenty to do inside the casino, centrally located to everything we wanted to do outside the casino. Attached parking garage.

Decent selection of restaurants, bars, lounges stores and eateries in the casino and mall. No complaints, good customer service.

Stayed in the West Tower, rooms were nice enough, but the elevators and bathroom could use an update. Honestly, how much time do you spend in a hotel room on vacation?
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
Our trip was booked several weeks prior to our arrival. The self check in booths were declining many booked hotel guests, stating our rooms weren‚Äôt ready and they‚Äôd emhoyelus when it was. It was alr 6pm, and the kiosks weren‚Äôt accurate! The lines after the mass confusion and frustration began and lasted beyond an hour and some for others, with less than minimal staff at the desk to accommodate the error. This is unacceptable.
Mind you, we are here with my step daughter for a cheer competition, so there are many parents and elementary aged and younger children filling this lobby waiting for resolution.
After we‚Äôre able to get checked in, we come up to our room in the west wing‚Ä¶ seriously the most ghetto room I‚Äôve ever stayed in. I would never have anticipated a casino hotel room to be in such dated/dirty/and sloppy conditions. Bathroom is filthy, tub/shower walls stained and smells like cigarette. Cigarette burn hole in bed linen, and the paint job looks like it was done by my grandchildren. The coffee maker is broken and filthy with thick calcium buildup. There isn‚Äôt a dresser to put our clothes away. Mold in the shower molding.
The pictures on your website do NOT portray an image of the trash hole we walked into last night! We‚Äôre beyond disappointed, and have never had an experience as poor as this at any casino we‚Äôve gone to before. I plan on calling the front desk this morning for some kind of resolution.
Addendum‚Ä¶ step daughter just showed us a used band aid in her bed üò£
Spoke with management yesterday, they returned our phone call after 9 hours, offered us a different room today, however, it‚Äôs after 2pm and the room just now is ready. The replacement coffee maker and clean linen by the folded lump sum came up after several phone calls after 10:30 pm last night.
Manager stated this casino sleeps whatever sum of people and it‚Äôs difficult to keep up and please everyone. Change of room without a guaranteed time and a $50 food and beverage voucher for one of their places within the casino doesn‚Äôt make this stay worth the money I‚Äôve spent at this casino!
I plan on calling management again tonight or tomorrow, I will update. Hopefully it‚Äôs better than the less than interested game they‚Äôve shown so far.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: It was okay. I was only there for a night as I attended the R.O.C. event. The safe in the room was closed shut, and I didn't feel like dealing with it, so...meh. The bathroom was clean, The shower itself made squeaky noises at times when using, again...meh.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
I have been visiting  the Tropicana Every year for the past 15 years As an actor martial arts professional I am invited each year to the action Martial arts magazine hall of honors which is always held at the beautiful Tropicana
So it is always an honor To attend this gala event and this year was even more specialized we promoted Alan Goldberg to Baron and Stephen Hayes was knighted
I had a chance to walk around the casino and also visit and eat at many the eatery However parking was a huge dismay This year for some reason It was a terrible ordeal for many of the celebrities as well as the regular guests The casino should make better arrangements for celebrities But I didn't enjoy my stay most of the time
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: We had such a fantastic time. The staff was so helpful, and security was spot on. Even stop me from eating at the slots, but I respect their wishes and covid protocols. Also, we appreciate security for their fast response to a 4 AM noise complaint. My mom and I stayed in the north tower and loved every minute of it. The shower was hot ü•µ in all the right ways. No dust was found, and the mirror and air ducts were spotless. The beds were extremely comfortable and spacious. You may need to call for a blanket if you enjoy your room below 65. The north tower was closest to the marketplace. My mom and I loved it, as it took us 1 minute to get to the breakfast and food section. The quarter isn‚Äôt too far, but we loved our stay and flight. We have already booked another trip. I wish we did have the north tower again, but I didn‚Äôt mind exploring the other tower's benefits. Please visit, and wear your walking shoes or chunky heels. This hotel is lovely, full of great people, and has too much fun for a short stay. In addition to that, visit the Hash House of Go-Go and get Yvette. She‚Äôs a genuinely unique waitress. I promise you won‚Äôt regret the meals or air drinks.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
Stayed at the north tower with my boyfriend back in September. There was a horrible storm those two days so couldn‚Äôt venture around AC much but we still had a lot of fun as there is plenty of things to do in the resort.

Room/cleanliness: I‚Äôm a smoker (horrible- I know) so I appreciated there being smoking rooms and smoking areas in the casino so I didn‚Äôt need to go out in the wind & rain just to have a smoke.
The room was in a convenient location. Right above the casino and near the elevators. Our window view was overlooking the casino which was pretty cool. The furniture was a little dated and the cleaning was ehh but that‚Äôs pretty much the case with all smoking rooms in any hotel/resort.

Casino: clean. I saw several employees doing detailed cleaning while playing the slots.

Parking: If staying in the North tower, I recommend using the valet. It was very convenient and the charge for it wasn‚Äôt much.

Staff: no complaints about the Tropicana staff. All very friendly and helpful.

Location: perfect location to the boardwalk and beach. I definitely recommend The Rain Forest Cafe located on the boardwalk.

My only 2 complaints (one was my fault).
1.  was our experience at Hooters there. From the moment we walked in the door, the waitress was very rude. Maybe she was having a bad day but it seemed like she took one look at us and assumed we wouldn‚Äôt tip well (we tip a standard 20-30% (depending on service which I think is very fair). We were nothing but kind to her but she was still extremely rude. The other waitress walking around seemed delightful, I wish she was our waitress instead.
Complaint 2: we went during the week days in the fall so the pools weren‚Äôt open. That‚Äôs my bad for not seeing that in their website. So if you want to use a pool, double check the pools are open.
I think all the bad reviews were from people expecting it to be a five star hotel. Most said there wasn‚Äôt much signage for locations but if you look up, there are signs with arrows pointing where to go.

Over all, we had a great time and definitely plan to be back soon! Thank you for helping making our vacay a good one!
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
We had an overall great experience! Food selections were fantastic. I'd give it a 4 star but we stayed in the West Tower and it is desperate need of a renovation. Wallpaper peeling, we found a cockroach on the wall and the bedding is very poor quality. Room was freezing with no way to change the temperature.
At the casino, drink service at the table games is SOOOO slow and a soda if you go get your own is $5. There should be drink rounds at least every hour, not 3 hours.
Valet service is super slow so give yourself time.
It's vacation though so all of these kind of things happen but some small changescould make this place better!!
Come on Ceasars, you can do it!!
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: We had a great time at Tropicana!  The casino was very clean.  I booked the Havana room in the Havana Tower.  Views from the room were incredible! Great price just after Christmas.   Check in was easy and fast.  Just make sure you have your driver's license ready for the check in kiosk.  We had drinks at the Saloon and the tequila bar downstairs.  The nachos at the tequila bar were incredible!  Get it with the chicken.  You won't be disappointed!  We went here for my birthday and ate at Carmines.  Ordered the meatballs, chicken wings and a slice of lasagna.  Delicious!
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Always a pleasure at the Tropicana. It's so big, it's the only casino I ever got lost in! Security is everywhere, and will point you in the right direction. I played roulette and won around $1,300 in 4 hours, went to Hooters downstairs and enjoyed a salad with chicken strips, met some beautiful waitresses, left a nice tip, then headed out with plans of returning soon. They have a convenience store right near the slots and one of the restrooms. The atmosphere was a happy one all night. I'm definitely going back next time I'm in Atlantic City.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
First time to Atlantic City, great experience!

Tropicana is a great location on the Boardwalk with lots of restaurant options inside, also a  short walk to Caesars, Hard Rock, Ballys...
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: I always enjoy Tropicana. Nice assortment of slots and table games, and between the court and the marketplace you'll never go hungry. Easy parking, easy check in and out, reasonable rates...
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
The check in process is a kiosk. They sent us to the oldest, farthest room in the place we felt like 3 rd class citizens. An old wing with old rooms far away from everything.. we called the front  desk  to change the room for a price  and no one answered the phone .  We called from the cell phone and there were no signal.  No Internet either. An emergency and no one could have help  No handicapped parking available
because the parking tower is  is closed.  Never again. Not even for  free.  I paid  a lot of money. This room looked like the shining. We were in communicated.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: How you have 2 people check in people that don‚Äôt have rewards on a Friday. The check in Kiosk machines don‚Äôt work at all. I was in the West Tower 41st floor there was no carpet on the floor, and hair that didn‚Äôt belong to me on the bathroom floor and in the shower. While I was trying to rest people above me must have been moving furniture then someone next to me kept knocking on the wall. They really need to get that hotel together as much as it valet park and stay there I would expect it to look and be way better. If your coming to see a concert here bring a jacket its cold in the showroom.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Everything was nice.   Hotel was nice and clean..  No need to venture out onto the Broadwalk because anything you desired was within the hotel.  Will be going back again
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
This was my first time at Tropicana Atlantic City. I stayed in the Havana Tower with 1  King size bed.
My first impression--the place is a sprawling monster of a Hotel and Casino resort. From the hotels lobby and check-in located on the lowest level (below the main casino floor accessible by escalators) to my room was a good 10 minute walk. If you have a lot of luggage it's going to be a workout for you. If you can't walk long distances or have any issues getting around, I suggest getting a room closer to the lobby and casino floor. The walk to my room involved many long inclined hallways, a pass through the shops and restaurants in the Quarter  and finally to the Havana Tower.
My room was big and looked very inviting and clean. But upon further inspection, it had it's share of problems. Smudges and  crud and on multiple door jams, and the bathroom vent and the room In-take A/C vent were disgustingly dirty. It looked unhealthy. (See pics)  Not sure if it is mold or just thick black dust but it should be cleaned REGULARLY. Besides that, I wanted to simply relax and take a shower but there was no body wash or hand soap for the sink. I called house keeping and was told they would be sending some up to the room immediately. I waited for over an hour and nothing showed up from housekeeping. Had to call again.  Someone showed up 30 minutes after that. (My stay was on a Wednesday and it took that long to get something that they forgot to put in the room. I can't imagine how long I request, like body wash or simply extra towels, would take on a weekend.
The hotel immenities are a pool and a very impressive  entertainment, shopping and restaurant area called the Quarter. It boasts over 24 restaurants, 25 shops of various goods and 22 bars and clubs and other entertainment like an Escape room.
Overall, despite the bad cleaning and service delays   from the housekeeping department,   I would recommend this hotel.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Some rooms are just ok...and some rooms and suites are very good. No room service but some of the restaurants in the building deliver. Hotel convenience store carries no booze but there's a decent liquor store 7 min walk in the Trop mall area. Staff is ok...but not great. Could use a few more gambling tables available. Only one for Let It Ride and its usually full. Recommend Boogie Nights nightclub for club fun. A few dance floors and some great older music with a great sound system.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Rooms are a decent size for an AC casino. They aren't very modern, but that wasn't an issue.  Bathroom was spacious with incredibly strong water pressure. Location isn't too bad,  not far away from most places in AC. I'd definitely stay here again, has a nice atmosphere. Very well themed.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
So far, not so good. Self check-in kiosk put us in a double when we reserved a king. Currently waiting in line in the South Tower Lobby, a long walk from the Havana Tower where we were, for assistance in rectifying the situation.  We have already had to change our dinner reservation at Ossu. I will update once we are settled. Not getting better: only 1 person working the counter. People behind us have been waiting for an email that their room is ready for an hour. Wow.
8:30 and Gary is now helping us. "The Kiosk wouldn't make a mistake. Whatever room you booked is the one you got."
Except it's not the one we booked and, oh look, we have the confirmation.
"Well, if a king bed is important to you,I can put you in the North Tower. "
Yes, since it is what we booked, we'd like the king.
So, we're in the king on the 17th of the North Tower. It's fine. Smells vaguely of cigarettes and marijuana, but it's  AC so... We may make our new reservation at 9.
I'll update tomorrow,  but at this point, my advice is avoid this property.

Good morning. Final update: The bed is pretty soft, but would be fine if there was any substance to the pillows, or if there were more pillows (4 small "feather" pillows on a king bed with no extras in the closet).
The temperature was impossible to regulate to any satisfaction. See the picture of the 70's technology thermostat.
The shower looked beautiful, however the design is awkward and it functions poorly.

We come to AC plenty and took a chance on the "New" Tropicana on this visit. This was a mistake.  Stay somewhere else. Hard Rock was fine, Ocean was lovely, Golden Nugget was really good, and Borgata and The Water Club are wonderful.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
The Tropicana resort is huge.  It took some time to get our bearings straight with the facility.

There was a good mix of table games with decent limits ($15 was common) and slots.

Great selection of restaurants and easy access to the boardwalk.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: I would love to give this place 5 stars except check out and getting out of the parking lot took almost 2 hours. It's ridiculous, they need to take a better look at ways to resolve these issues. The only way to catch an elevator to get you downstairs was to ride up to the top floor and come back down to get to the lobby. Long lines to get out and was very discouraging. The rooms were beautiful spacious and clean. However, if I state there will be 4 people checking in there should be a minimum of 4 towels in the room.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text:
Rooms were very basic. No carpet.  The bathroom had leaks in the sink faucet,  the bathtub and toilet.

My phone wrong 2 days in a row at 6:30 a.m. even though I didn't have a wake up call.
If it's windy the 41st floor has something banging all night outside the building.

Finding the self parking lot was a major challenge.

The signs for the lobby are not very good. I had to use a self check in kiosk.

The casino area was good.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: My boyfriend and I came to Tropicana Tuesday through Friday. We had a room in the Havana tower. The room was clean and spacious. At the Tropicana there are multiple towers there is so much to explore. There are restaurants and shops in the hotel. No need to leave the hotel. There are a few shops open 24/7. Tacos at 2am was perfect. We ate at PF Changs and it was absolutely delicious. The atmosphere was great too. We also ate at Casa taco, Hash house a go go, and many other places as there are so many to pick from. The boardwalk is right outside the marketplace (where most the food shops are). We walked all the way to the end which took about 40 minutes one way. There were many shops closed but also many open and ready for customers. Going on a week day is our preference as there are so many less people. By Thursday alot more  people started coming.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: I get that Covid slowed things down for businesses. But that should not be why the rooms aren‚Äôt clean and in many aspects unacceptable. I did not complain to hotel staff but I would never expect to walk into a room with spills on the walls and broken faucets. If this was not for a celebration weekend, I would have left. Staff was nice, location is fine. Elevators for the west tower are awful on weekends. 4 elevators to get all guests to their rooms for that tower - there was always a line and wait. At times we had to take the stairs after 15 minutes of not being able to get an elevator. I would not recommend to stay at this hotel - we paid approx $370/night and I was quite shocked at what this hotel thinks is acceptable. Photos are from the walls right inside the bathroom and the knob in the shower.
title: Tropicana Atlantic City

text: Great food. Fast service. Great location. I had the lunch Szechuan Beef.  Very yummy.
title: Dragon Express

text: Its close,authentic , and doggone it they like me.
title: Dragon Express

text: First time trying Dragon Express. I ordered 5 items, overall food was good, eggrolls were good cabbage was crisp and they were packed full.  Also got steamed dumplings which were ok the sauce they came with was very good. For the mains I order two different lunch specials.  For the price you get a lot of food. I tired the Boneless spare ribs, the flavor was good the char was not there, last I tired Chicken and Broccoli the sauce had decent flavor both came with plenty of rice. Overall what I got was decent service was quick and staff was friendly.
title: Dragon Express

text:
This place is great! Don‚Äôt let the ‚Äústrip mall‚Äùappearance deter you. They are currently
updating the store fronts also, so make sure you find this place! I‚Äôve been coming here for six years. I‚Äôm glad they survived the pandemic. It has always been carry-out only and the family is super nice. You don‚Äôt even have to leave your car! My General Tso‚Äôs combo  (white meat) was super chunky and fresh, with flavorful fried rice. The fried dumplings are delicious. The ‚ÄúChef‚Äôs Specialties‚Äù have never disappointed.
title: Dragon Express

text: Ok beach but sand is full of oil from all the offshore drilling
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: Second time here and as the first time we love it! So peaceful looking out at the water. Yes there is road noise from Hwy to 101 but the view and the staff make up for it. I would stay here again!
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: Cabin was nice and clean. Customer service very friendly and helpful.
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: A very clean and friendly spot directly on the waterfront. Very helpful staff, washrooms are awesome, nice flowers! Special of the day: A humpback whale just came by to say hello with a few jumps.
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: Loved it
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: Easy check in! Room was great! With a amazing view. Bed was comfy. Room was clean and had no odors. Overall great experience. Clean towels. My room had a blow dryer and a keurig coffee maker. Also had a nice little porch to sit outside. If the reception area is not open in the morning you can just drop off your key in the key box right outside. Casino is just a short drive away and they also have food there.
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text:
Room (not cabin) was clean, has modern amenities, a secluded patio area with table and chairs, and a great view.
Hwy 101 road noise, which is unavoidably determined by location.
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: Great little park.  Views are wonderful.
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text:
We finished off the decade with three nights in the RV portion of the Waterfront offering, and enjoyed it immensely.  We parked less than 10 yards from the water with a great view.  The water here is so clear you can see the bottom like looking through glass. Even when wind whipped up some small waves you could see through the waves to the rocky bottom.

The facilities have very nice and clean showers, and a commons room you can gather in for a game. The road is close and busy through the day, but traffic dies off through the evening and it is very peaceful.
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: Room was hotel quality but the view was fantastic and the room included access to Lake Cushman parking. Staff was very nice though not always in the office. You can ring them from the front and they will pull up in their vehicle. Check-out just requires that you drop your key in a receptacle and you're ready to go!
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: My husband's office view!
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: Wow what a beautiful day! Caught dinnerüòÅ hung out with some people's & got a lil sun
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: 5stars friendly , nice people with a gorgeous view. I will definitely be back here.
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: It was nice, eventhough we were with 14 others for New Years.  A little spendy for the sight, but worth it to be with friends and family.
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: The best view for camping ever!!! These are the photos of the view form our RV. Love this little camping place! Very well maintained and friendly people.
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: The RV park is small, well maintained, right on the water, and the site we had included full hookups. I absolutely agree with other reviews that the road noise is significant and that site #14 is only appropriate for a smaller RV.  We were able to back into #14 with a 20' trailer, I cannot imagine doing it with anything larger. It seemed that several of the concrete pads were not level, we noticed an RV with both of its front tires off the ground after being leveled. We enjoyed kayaking but found strong and irregular currents in front of the PUD building. We didn't notice any real beach, but maybe the tides were off while we were there. We were able to launch kayaks from the bottom of some rock steps. It's a great spot, really well kept and we will be back!
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: Flat paved sites. Some are a bit tricky to get into but well worth it. Views are amazing. The babbling creek at one end is almost enough to drown out the highway noise. Staff was friendly. Club house is well appropriated with puzzles, movies, a small kitchenette and a fake fireplace. Definitely worth the price.
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: Great location, recently remodeled, stayed in a two bedroom cabin. The cabins have all the basic cooking tools you will need, the dishes are set for 4 persons, so might want to bring extras (paper/plastic), else you will be running the dishwasher a lot. The view is great, staff very friendly and helpful. Note: the cabins are close to the highway, you may consider earplugs in the bedroom if highway sounds are an issue. Some of my RV friends said the same. There are fire pits and picnic tables. The cabins have a couple chairs and a small table. It fine to smoke on the deck. We'll be back next year
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: A recently renovated,  luxury and spacious cabin. The kitchen comes with a dishwasher and two sinks. Kitchen paper towel, hair dryer are provided. The cabin has a nice view of Hood Canal. The people in  the office was very friendly. The cabin is very close to Highway 101, it can be noisy at night.
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: We really enjoy coming out and seeing the seals, salmon and other habitat. Great place for SUP and not too far from restaurants in Potlatch and Hoodsport. Management is very friendly and attentive to guest's needs, even loaning my wife an iPhone charger when she forgot hers.
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: This is a great place staff is great and helpful friendly would tell friends
title: Waterfront At Potlatch

text: Very good, we had an amazing server, Dawn. She was very attentive, didn't rush us, and the food was amazing.
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: Best atmosphere-- cozy and quiet. Old fashioned vibe of a pub with a fireplace and delicious food. We enjoyed they're birthday dessert: brownie with peppermint ice cream, marshmallow meringue covered in hot fudge and sprinkled with powdered sugar!
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: Not for me but others really enjoy this restaurant. To me the food is only okay compared to the high price. My parents however come here for the nostalgia and environment. My mom had the pecan crusted chicken which she said was ‚Äúone of the best meals‚Äù she ever had. My father and I had the brisket sandwich which was good. The cheese is definitely the best part of this place however my one complaint is that it come out in plastic salad dressing containers. I‚Äôm a stickler for plating and with the price of this place it‚Äôd be nice if they could scoop it out and put it in a serving dish. The service was excellent.
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: Steaks were great, light char on the outside but perfect mid rare.  Went with the strip this time and loved it.  Service was a little slow but I think we just were forgotten about.  Still a great place.
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: Lovely historic restaurant and pub in what was once a hotel. The decor and ambiance is classic and refined. The service is prompt, friendly and professional. A bit pricey but the experience was worth the $90 (tip included) for two entrees and an appetizer. The crispy brussel sprouts were deliciously sweet with just the right amount of heat. The wife enjoyed the pecan-crusted chicken. I ordered the braised pot-roast which i literally cut with my fork.
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text:
Fantastic quality meals from high end Prime Rib, to 'Pub Style' options; you'll never miss hitting a top shelf experience no matter your choice. With great house wines, and sweet treats to end the night, this place has (and will continue to) received plenty of my patronage.
If I need a place to take my family which I can rely to provide a memorable and enjoyable experience: It's Schuler's.
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: We were greeting upon entering, quickly served, and enjoyed the grand historical environment. Our server, Holly, was very friendly, prompt, and attentive. My daughters enjoyed their ‚Äúbuild your own‚Äù sundae desserts‚Ä¶dad did too!  I am looking forward to stopping again during my next visit to Marshall!
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text:
My fianc√© and I came in for a couple Manhattan‚Äôs at this beautiful, spectacular, historic destination in Marshall Michigan.

We were terribly disappointed to receive in our Manhattan‚Äôs, a red, dyed, bleached, maraschino cherry, (just like our local VFW). We recommend management considers a tiny investment in providing Luxardo cherries for its bourbon aficionados. Other than that, we absolutely love this destination and are happy to drive 60 miles each way to enjoy all that Schulers has to offer.  Love this place!
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: We hosted our daughter's bridal shower in the Signature Room in August of 2020.  It had the perfect ambiance! The whole experience was nothing short of wonderful.  We worked with Elizabeth and she went above and beyond to accommodate our special requests and d√©cor' needs.   Our dedicated servers were excellent and the food was outstanding.  Would highly recommend for your next event!
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: Great place for a drink and a bite to eat!
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: What a magical little place in Marshall. The throwback interior sets the mood for the good food you receive. The wait staff was attentive and nice. So, why not five stars? The food was really good, but not 5 star. Also, they have a lot of areas they are serving. So the service was a little slower than usual. Not a huge wait, but wanted to note it. Overall, I will always visit this restaurant every time I visit in Marshall. You should, too.
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: Stopped for lunch on the way home from battle creek. Food and service were top notch. The atmosphere was great with all the history of the location.
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: Instant favorite. Every aspect from meal to mingle is covered in this classic take on american dinning. Great service and atmosphere. Thank you for a memorable experience.
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: I went here for my first time with my girlfriend from Germany. We were both impressed with the food and atmosphere! I‚Äôve always heard of Shuler‚Äôs and the legend it is. My great grandparents use to eat here all the time. I look forward to making it a traditional every year. The service was excellent! Our waitress, Roxie, was super awesome and explained the entire menu. The classic cheese ball, crab cakes, and lamb chops were all perfect!
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: My wife and I have, along with her family, been coming here for years.  It has some of the best Prime Rib around around (the picture says it all), as well as a comforting interior and great staff.  She and I were recently (on Nov 7th, 2020) married at Schuler's.  Elizabeth and staff were exceptionally accommodating throughout the entire process.  We were very blessed to have such a perfect day, both at Schuler's and in Marshall.  You really should try out Schuler's if you ever have the opportunity!
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: This little gem is in Marshall, Michigan and you have to make a stop if you're here. I had the tomato soup and grilled cheese and it was amazing. My husband had the fish n' chips and enjoyed it as well. Stop by, you won't be disappointed!
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: Great food super nice atmosphere not to mention starting restaurant traditions that you didn't even know about. This place is connected to Win Schulers pub cheese in a neat way
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: My husband and I came in for our anniversary. From the hostess to the waitress to everything in between, everything was wonderful. The pictures on the walls were beautiful. The stuffed mushrooms were great! Fresh cut fries were awesome. We decided on sandwiches and got the French dip and the brisket sandwich. Both were great. The staff really set the visit apart though. Our waitress was just so sweet. They even gave us a sweet gift for our anniversary. Now everytime we drink out of our glasses we will remember our trip.
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: Great service since...forever! Great food and atmosphere.
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: The husband and I have decided to set off and try a new place where we have never ate before every Friday for date night, with that being said we found ourselves here. My first impression wasn't bad at first. It was very beautiful when we walked in. A little confusing because you choose if you'd like to eat in the Diner or Pub and each menu was a tad different (as they did show us) but I was still confused so I just said Diner so we could get to eating. After about a 20 minute wait we was finally placed into a corner but at this point I didn't care, I was just ready to eat. We ordered our drinks and appetizers, those took about 15 minutes to receive. I immediately noticed that the glass was dirty, still at this point I'm trying to stay positive. I calmly wait as we wait for our waiter to come back so I can express my concerns to him unfortunately he took about 20 minutes before he came back in that 20 minutes we watched others get drinks numerous times and their food as we still set there waiting to just get one more drink, at this point I'm getting annoyed. Right about then a manager walk by and I expressed my concerns to her and she immediately address the issue. We finally receive our food from our original waiter and to be honest the burger was okay it didn't have much flavor at all but at this point I'm still trying to stay positive and look at the positive like at least the fries are good right? Just overall not a good experience I don't think I would ever go back there again the manager however did come up to us and offer us a free dessert to take home and we kindly took it home with us to enjoy later. Not the best experience for me the food was very pricey and definitely not worth the money.
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: Favorite place to stop on our way to South Haven. Sampler platter (shown) and dessert was a pecan ball.....amazing! (Not pictured) Absolutely LOVE this place.....service, food and the history of the building make it a perfect lunch or dinner experience.
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: My son and his fianc√©e had their bridal shower in a beautiful private room in the back section. There was a small lush enclosed patio garden which provided a lovely view. The food was fresh, homemade and delicious. Our servers were attentive and quick. Every area of the restaurant was clean.
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: Haven't been to Win Schuler's in over 25 years... Was so glad I decided to stop again! I ordered my favorite, "French Dip" sandwich. Great portion size and loved the sweet potato fries too! It won't be so long before I stop again. It was everything I remember, and even more! The baked goods I bought were also amazing!
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: Walk into a place that looks kinda like a Frankenmuth restaurant. Dark but absolutely beautiful inside. They have an amazing wine and spirits menu. Drinks were very good and hit the spot. I ordered a two napkin beef brisket sandwich. The brisket was juicy and very tasty. BBQ sauce with jalapeno spread and sweet pickles. (Not a super fan of sweet pickles, but on this sandwich is was very tasty with a sweet and spicy taste. French fries were beer battered and hot. Very tasty food and drinks. Service was pretty good she was very friendly and stayed on top keeping drinks toped off. Great first time experience here
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text:
You get what you pay for. Fine dining at its finest. Tim, our waiter, was absolutely outstanding. A Beautiful  calming atmosphere enhanced a pleasant dining experience. Food quality and presentation were exceptional.
We were just passing through on a Sunday, and hit a home run.
title: Schuler's Restaurant & Pub

text: Zoo was great. Went on a Monday after the rain, had the place practically to ourselves. Price was reasonable.
title: Dakota Zoo

text:
Animals were active, it was fun...the coyote had bitting flys eating his earsüòî
But the staff was attentive to animalsüòÅ
Bears were the coolsest of the day.
Only 20 bucks for 2 people.
title: Dakota Zoo

text:
The penguins were our favorite attraction this time. Little Ambrose liked my daughter's sparkly dress. We can't wait for the new otter habitat.
We do miss the mini doughnuts. That was always a tradition, to eat doughnuts while we ride the train. Also, hoping the gift shop gets some monkeys similar to what lives in the zoo. They are a must see and we would love to have a little plush as a memento.
Buy the annual pass, once is never enough when it comes to The Dakota Zoo!
title: Dakota Zoo

text: Enjoyable day once again for the the family!! Many neat animals, fun train ride around the zoo!
title: Dakota Zoo

text: I was surprised how big the zoo was considering it's only $12 to get in. The animals have bigger enclosures than most zoos I've been to which was nice to see.
title: Dakota Zoo

text: Large variety of animals! Some of the enclosures are a little small but overall great fun. They have two trains to take around the facility. Reasonable pricing.
title: Dakota Zoo

text: Nice little zoo. They have a good number of animals, things are clean, food was good, parking is good, and the have 2 trains that take you around the park. My only complaint is the train went a little fast.
title: Dakota Zoo

text: We loved Dakota Zoo ! It's a clean place, with so many animals  to see. It's obvious that safety is a #1 priority.  I plan to visit  again.
title: Dakota Zoo

text: For a city the size of Bismarck, the display of animals is actually quite impressive. I've been to larger zoos we other more varied animals, but I'd say this one is still worth your time. The crown jewel in their collection are the tigers, so don't miss that!
title: Dakota Zoo

text: Everyone was super nice and shared a lot of cool info about the animals. Got a nice tour along with getting the chance to pet snakes! Only issue I would say I had was almost tripping a few times on the uneven paths. The rest of the park was very nice and was bigger than I thought it was gonna be with lots of cool animals! Thank you for the awesome visit!
title: Dakota Zoo

text: Had a great time with my daughter and granddaughter at the zoo today.   Other guests were pleasant and the employees were really nice.   I got a year yearly pass for my family,  can come anytime.
title: Dakota Zoo

text: It was a cute zoo and had many surprisingly exotic animals. I liked that they had a train and you can rent out wheelchairs for seniors. It was much bigger than I initially anticipated and the animals looked well taken of.
title: Dakota Zoo

text: I've gotta give this one ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è for sure. Well-maintained, lots of exhibits, plenty of variety, many high-interest animals, all in a spacious, easy-to-navigate setting. Having visited once w/ our six young children/teens, we'd definitely have interest in going again. The African penguin exhibit is brand new and very nice. You need to check it out!
title: Dakota Zoo

text: This was lots of fun and they honored our Houston Zoo pass. Kids really enjoyed it because it had different animal than we have I  the South.
title: Dakota Zoo

text: My granddaughters loved it! The penguins are awesome!
title: Dakota Zoo

text:
Visited from out of town and spent family time at the Dakota Zoo.

I'm used to bigger zoos that are very crowded and the animals are 20 feet away.  I was expecting to see animals I see at my home zoo; I was wrong.  The variety and habitats of the animals is fun and interesting.

The zoo was not crowded.  My family could wander around at their own pace.  The zoo is very well covered by trees which provide shade in many places.  The paths are a bit run down, but fine for wheelchairs and strollers.  We did not have a map of the zoo which made it confusing to me.  My daughter knew her way around and there are info signs periodically to show the exhibit locations.

I did not see many food stands that I'm used to in bigger zoos.  I think everything is near the entrance.  There is a petting zoo at the entrance as well.
title: Dakota Zoo

text: It was such fun to see American animals.  I haven't been to to many Zoos that do that. (Of course that's not all they have). I recommend the train ride (make sure you grab your tickets!!!) for the wilderness area instead of walking it.
title: Dakota Zoo

text: Omgeee I loved it maybe because I don‚Äôt see animals like that in Florida but this zoo is amazing. We saw camels , bisons , donkeys , grizzly bears, wolfs and the list goes on . It was very spacious and no big crowds which was another plus. I love this zoo!!
title: Dakota Zoo

text: The zoo is okay.  It's small and the admission fee is very reasonable.  Good for some entertainment.  A lot of small enclosures which could do with some renovations.  Park is clean and well maintained.  Lots of shade. The tigers were the best part.
title: Dakota Zoo

text: For a small state this Zoo was awesome.  I absolutely loved how the animals were up close & were all out for everyone to see. This Zoo looks small from the outside but is really big. I love the feeling that they are all about the animals rather than profit. Make sure to take quarters cause you can buy pet food for the goats to eat which is so much fun for all ages.
title: Dakota Zoo

text: Fun but wished the reptile cages were not so empty and that more of the animals were rescued.  The buffalo were to far off to see at all. For the price it was good!
title: Dakota Zoo

text:
Reasonable price $12 for adults $8 for 2-18 years old, under two years are free.
My visit was in the beginning of may which a lot of animals are not there yet, recommended to come any time june to October to see all of the other animals.
title: Dakota Zoo

text: A must-visit when in North Dakota. Friendliest state every.
title: Dakota Zoo

text: Great family zoo. Has a fun train that you can ride and tour the whole zoo. It's a great way to see the whole area. They have a very wide range of animals. A kiddie park and really fun discovery area to go in and cool down on hot days. They also have fun family activities you can attend through out the year.
title: Dakota Zoo

text: This is the most amazing zoo I've ever been to. Only $9.50 for adults and they had tons of animals ( I must say, no elephants or african animals, but I did not miss them). We got to see all the predators up close, there is a really cool wooded loop for walking and all sorts of animals. Do not miss out on this great zoo.
title: Dakota Zoo

text: The hotel was nice, right in town. If you love nature you'll love Mt Shasta.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Friendly and efficient staff, reasonable rates, beautiful rooms, excellent architecture.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: This is a wonderful hotel. The staff are so friendly. The rooms are cozy, clean and the beds are comfortable. Great bar. The restaurant makes wonderful prime rib and the breakfast, blackberry French Toast, was perfect. The 25% off breakfast for hotel guests makes it really affordable. The indoor pool is huge and our son loved it. We couldn't have been happier with our experience.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Thanks for hosting the Tesla superchargers.  Clean bathrooms and nice lobby for guests as we wait for charging.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: It's an old hotel, and it reflects in every aspect of your stay here. We went to the front desk four times in the first 24 hours to get our room access restored. It still doesn't work for the back door. They have a good pool but a namesake gym.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: We stay here every year beatiful view of mt shasta
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Very clean and they have nice restaurants
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Super cute hotel! Clean and decorated wonderfully! The rooms were spacious. They have a double suite with two rooms and it was great! They do not offer free breakfast which was a bummer. It looks deceiving online. They have a lot of fun restaurants close by though.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Great place to stay. Clean, friendly and nice view.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Our favorite place to stay when driving through Shasta. 5 stars.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Loved it here! When we were evacuated from the Carr fire, this was one of the only places that would take our dog! Love this place! Thank you!
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: It was a decent place to stay. Room was clean. Food was good. The view of Mt.Shasta was decent depending on the angle due to some trees, etc. However they do charge extra for a pet, but they don't tell you till after you get there if you book online, and while explaining the pet policy to you and signing some paperwork they neglect to mention the designated area to walk your dog. Other than that it was a nice looking hotel and i would stay here again.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text:
Nice hotel. Ok food at restaurant. rooms in the 3rd floor are way too hot.
Nice indoor pool need to control chlorine levels eyes will start burning after a few minutes in the water.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Not a luxury 5 star hotel, however i am not aware of any accommodations in the area that are. If your looking for a mountain lodge feeling, this is the place! Conveniently located with only about a 20 minute drive to Mt Shasta Ski Park. They DO NOT have the traditional free breakfast, however they do have a restaurant onsite. Also have a bar and grill. Food is a little spend but good, as expected for hotel restaurants. They were short staffed but the waitresses did their best and were very polite and accommodating. We decided to stay an extra night on a holiday weekend and while booked, the manager Joe pulled through for us and got us an extension. All of the staff work hard and are very polite. Hopefully some hotel upgrades/remodels are planned for the near future. If you plan to stay, suggest you book early, this is the go to for skiers and hikers and it fills up fast!
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text:
Good morning from Mt Shasta.
This is my view from the hotel window. Stayed here last night. The room has 2 rooms with a kitchen with dishes etc.  Outdoor theme. Last night we had dinner in there restaurant it was awesome food. They also have a separate bar and inside heated pool and spa. I would highly recommend this if you get up here to vacation. Across the street there is Ray's market so you can stock your kitchen. We are moving on today but the kids love this place.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text:
For a view of Mount Shasta, this place was one of the best in town. It was centrally located, within walking distance to most of the restaurants in town. The rooms itself could use some freshening up, not really outdated, just looked a little tired. Couldn't tell if the refrigerator in the room was working, didn't seem to get particularly cold and there was no adjustment. The restaurant was good but do yourself a favor and DO NOT PURCHASE THE PRE PAID BREAKFAST PACKAGE. They charge you $20 per person for breakfast. You get your choice of one entree and one drink. My wife ordered the Granola and coffee and wanted a bagel. She was told that she would have to pay extra for the bagel even though the total with the bagel wasn't over $20. You're better off paying as you go because you don't get the difference if your total is under $20. Staff was friendly and helpful. Overall, our stay was ok, I'd stay here again if I were in town but I wouldn't pre pay for breakfast again.

Just got a response from Best Western. They state that their breakfast package are $10 for adults and $5 for children. Going through Bookings.com we were charged $20 per person. Our total for breakfast for the 5 days we were there was $200. I will say breakfast was good but not $200 good. And at no time were our meals over $20 but we didn't get the difference back
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Very good location. On highway I5. Friendly staff.  Clean.  Free parking.  Free  WiFi.  And many many restaurants are nearby. It has laundry,  you can wash all of your clothes for only $ 5.5 only. Unfortunately breakfast is not included.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Place was great. Got put of the storm and the party in the room next door seemed like a lot of fun!
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text:
The place is lovely. If you get a view room, you can see Mount Shasta, but you may also see roofs and stuff. See photos.
And, they no longer have the free breakfast buffet Best Westerns are known for. In fact, you can't even buy a breakfast buffet. We were very disappointed by their breakfast menu.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text:
Great place......!
On Bikes & this place has it all.
Good food a Bar & provide a Bike wash kit to clean up your ride....
100% Positive Stay....
Thank You....
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Simple place but clean, very welcoming staff, and has everything you need.  We were concerned it would be noisy due to location. Not at all. There is live music on Friday nights. Fun! Nothing special with the food and wine choices but great to have when you arrive from a long trip. Beautiful scenery. I was able to enjoy great espresso from their new machine.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: We were greeted warmly while checking in at midnight and the rooms were squeaky clean. Breakfast was amazing!
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: This place was great, view of the mountain from our room, indoor swimming pool, nice food. Had everything we wanted! Thanks for a nice stay.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text:
Service desk clerk is friendly and the rooms are clean they could use some updates and pet friendly easy access to gas stations and fast food
theres also a restaurant in hotel good food and service there's no longer a continental breakfast you have to go to the restaurant
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text:
Pros:
LOVE LOVE the Best Western Tree House! Will stay again!

Loved the cabin-esque feel with the high ceilings.

It was great that you could get to the lobby and restaurant all internally.

Great views of the snow capped mountains from our window.

Great prices at the restaurant but there weren't menus readily available. Nice diner to sit down to eat.

Close enough to popular attractions like Burney Falls and McCloud Falls.

Rooms with external door and kitchenette options available.

Felt safe here.

Ryan was great at check in.

Cons:
Pricey but better than all the other hotels around.

Heating/Cooling system didn't work very well.

Pool and hot tub closed due to Covid.

No free breakfast.
title: Best Western Plus Tree House

text: Awesome place
title: Las Palmas Reservations - Rocky Point Vacation Rentals

text: This was a great condo & beach facilities. We went on the jet ski, had pi√±a coladas, swam in the pool, cooked breakfast in the room and slept comfortably in the bed. There were four of us on a very roomy 2 bedroom with beautiful views on the 9th floor. We didn‚Äôt get to use other amenities as we were only there for 24 hours but we will venture back. Please keep in mind the border in that area closes at 8pm SHARP from the Arizona side so get there with plenty of time for a line up. Also ‚Äî watch out for sand storms in the area, we encountered one and it was a doozy that would have been very uncomfortable if we weren‚Äôt already in the taxi! The surrounding area is not very interesting, more of a resort oceanfront experience then a sightseeing adventure. Good for a contained group of friends or family. The ocean was gorgeous though, warm and salty!
title: Las Palmas Reservations - Rocky Point Vacation Rentals

text: Awesome resort ! Loved the pools and jacuzzis went in off season January it was very chilly but the condos were quiet and security is great. Very nice area and the front desk staff was awesome and helpful . Will come again.
title: Las Palmas Reservations - Rocky Point Vacation Rentals

text: Three days before arriving, we were informed that the condo we booked was sold. My wife called and spoke to Rodrigo. He accommodated us with a stay in 2 different locations 2 days each. The initial location was larger than our original reservation and had the smell of musk and mold. I didn't complain to the front desk because we were moving locations in two days. The second location was smaller than our original reservation. Here for an event that we didn't want to miss, so we made do. Special thanks to Rodrigo for helping us with our stay so we could attend the event we booked our stay for. Photos are of moon lit sea at sandy beach.
title: Las Palmas Reservations - Rocky Point Vacation Rentals

text: We came for 4th of July weekend and our friends booked our Airbnb here at Las Palmas I love the resort entirely! First time in Puero Penasco! So walking from the Condo to the beach was just a few mins so close by the beach. Our view was amazing & breathtaking! The resort pools we absolutely loved and enjoyed. They have the kid family pool area which is impressive cause they have really cool slides and shallow area for littles. Plus offer his eats and antojitos while swimming and lounging. The resort has zero tolerance for partying too late and loud obnoxious ppl will be addressed or kicked out so I like that too. Definitely booking this place again!

text:
Ummm I probably wouldn‚Äôt come here because of the security, they were super strict, couldn‚Äôt do much but then again it‚Äôs their job, but they made us feel uncomfortable. We booked on Expedia which then brought me to Virbo and I had to create an account and the owners name is Tom. It was a little confusing but figured it out.
The apartment was very spacious and clean,to bedrooms and a set of bunk beds, it had everything you need such as laundry soap, condiments, utensils, plates etc. So we were able to grocery shop for the week.
When you go to the pool, the kiddie pool is not warm and there is an adult pool for night. The beach is beautiful but there is always a low tide so you will have to walk a little to get to the water.
The town is not fully developed, so don‚Äôt expect a Cancun experience but you will find authentic Mexican food when you drive into the town.
In the tourist area of Puerto Penasco, they sell very expensive souvenirs, charging in American prices. Don‚Äôt forget to try the Oyster farm! 100 pesos for one dozen oysters

text:
This is arguably the best sushi in Easton (maybe even the shore)! I've tried all the others and I keep coming back. The staff is friendly and always asks about my family when I come in alone. The wait for food is never long, even if the place is full. You can dine in at lunch and get back to work quick. The menu items consistently taste amazing and are prepared the same way everytime... there are no surprises, if you order an Olympic roll it's going to be amazing Every Single Time, and that surely can not be said for the other places in town. Some of my favorites are "Amazing Tuna" "Jingle Bell" "Olympic" "Incredible" and "spicey crab" but all of them are good. If you go between 12 and 4 the special is "get 1 special roll and get a second at half off". Oh, and their unsweetened tea is the best in town, I know that's a small thing but it matters to me since I've given up soda.

If you're looking for a great place to have Sushi in Easton look no farther than usushi!
title: U Sushi

text: WOW! Sushi very tasty. Ordered Green Curry Shrimp. My meal came with Miso Soup, Salad and the most delicious, tender & tasty shrimp & veggies. Will definitely order again!!!!
