text: If you are looking to stay at a top-notch hotel. The Best Western Premier Bridgewood (Neenah) is an excellent choice. Our family of 4 stayed here recently while on our family vacation and stayed in a 2 bedroom suite which is a must for us with two teenagers. Each of the kids had their own bed in their own room, we had a separate room with a king bed and there was also a spacious family room. Three 65 inch tvs in each space kept everyone entertained during our downtime. The room was clean, nice and spacious. The hotel itself was very clean and nice in all areas. The pool is nicer than average hotel pools featuring a shallow wading pool for small children and main pool with basketball hoop and a larger slide for older kids. Two hot tubs one indoors and one outside were nice and relaxing. On site restaurant was very good and convenient to get to within the hotel. After our stay we received an emailed survey and personal response letter from the hotel manager thanking us. We would definitely stay here again.
title: Best Western Premier Bridgewood Resort Hotel

text:
Please note: NO WHEELCHAIR or STROLLER access on the day of our visit. There is one small elevator serving all of Quincy Market and if it‚Äôs inop - you cannot access the Dino Safari since it‚Äôs located up a huge flight of stairs. They suggested we carry the stroller upstairs. Not possible due to weight of stroller & 19-month old ‚Äî but also not safe for child. The folks at Dino Safari said they‚Äôve ‚Äúbeen asking‚Äù them to fix the elevator for some time.
Just keep accessibility in mind if you have a wheelchair, stroller, or if climbing multiple stairs is difficult.
The exhibit was nice, tho overpriced, imo. Our little dinosaur-loving grandson was done in under 20 mins, incl the 5 min movie at start.
title: Dino Safari Boston: A Walk-Thru Adventure

text:
Main takeaways: not worth the price, but the kids did have fun. The exhibit was small, very warm (no ac even in Summer), and the main thing is that the dinosaurs appear to be inflatable? And in very poor condition (missing teeth, hair and feathers missing in large patches, sections of the inflatable not working etc.) the lighting is also very low and odd. It seems designed to be scary and colorful maybe, instead of actually being able to see any detailing on the creatures. I paid $25 per person (including the kids) and you can see the exhibit in 15-20 minutes (reading all of the educational material). It just isn‚Äôt worth it.

The only reason this isn‚Äôt a 1 star or a complaint to the organization for a refund, is that the kids did have fun. The dinosaurs are touchable (probably why they are in such terrible condition). And there is an interactive coloring program at the end that is pretty good (but even that was glitchy.)
title: Dino Safari Boston: A Walk-Thru Adventure

text: We had such a great time - my 3.5 year old loved it ! He is obsessed with Dino‚Äôs - and isn‚Äôt sure if they were real or not - but he is convinced the spinosaurous outside was totally real.  have seen reviews say that they took 10 minutes to walk through‚Ä¶ I think that‚Äôs bad on those families , cause we were there for awhile and loved it ! Everything was high quality and the staff was so nice. I would recommend to anyone trying to find fun things to do during these cold weekends !

text:
NOT WORTH THE COST!!!
Save your money, and use the $25 for something that is more than 10 mins long. Also for $75 we could have   had hours worth of fun some where else in the city rather than 10 mins.

Is it a fun experience for children ages 3 to 12, yes! If money is NOT a worry for you then go and enjoy yourself. Our child had a great time for the 15 mins. However, $25 for adults and children is absolutely ridiculous. At BEST this is should cost $12 for adults $5 for children.

The only reason they can get away with charging such an absurd price is because it is in Faneuil Hall.

Our daughter had a great time. But for 10-15 mins of walking around for $25 is INSANE.
title: Dino Safari Boston: A Walk-Thru Adventure

I went there to get some water-turtle (Red Eared Slider) safe plants for my 30gal tank & they had a TON of diff plant species to pick through <^¬∑^> They have a big area outside with mostly red-eared slider turtles in it..which i would guess might be from people who aren't able to keep their turtles once they start getting bigger :S (sadly a common occurrence with the adorable baby sliders since they're SO easy to find in TX & not everybody getting them is well informed on their care or needs to keep them healthy. )

Endlicheri is a lower jaw bichir, unlike all my other bichir, which is why I wanted the delhezi it was labeled as.. an upper jaw bichir.

text: Getting a room by the river is so incredibly worth it. Nothing can mimic the sound of the salmon river while sleeping on a very comfortable bed. My husband and I have decided to make this one of our go-to vacation places!

text: This Inn has rooms with direct access to a deck that looks directly over the beautiful Salmon River.  We loved sitting on the deck drinking coffee, listening to the flow of the river and watching the wildlife. The rooms are clean and large with kitchenettes for those who want to make a quick meal before venturing out to snowshoe, snowmobiling or hiking. We also enjoyed the location as it was near the Mountain Village Resort  where they serve prime rib on Thursday and Friday nights. We were very happy with our stay and the supporting staff. Definitely deserves 5 Stars!

text:
This place was better than I expected. Very very comfy and cozy. I slept wonderfully listening to the rolling water of the salmon river every night! The river is literally right behind the back balcony or porch. We were upstairs and had an incredible view of the river, the mountains and even a couple of elk that came down to drink water from the river.
We reserved a room with two Queen beds and a room with a king. Both rooms were great, but the king room was extra special for my wife and I. We loved it. I would have even enjoyed sleeping on the balcony! Hahahahahaha!
When I first called to ask a few questions regarding making reservations there, the wonderful lady that helped me went above and beyond what I was expecting. I booked a room immediately. Later on that day, I booked a second room. The pricing was way better than I expected. The service was way better than I expected. The rooms were way better than I expected. And the view was beautiful! I promise that I will be back again! It was a beautiful winter and our first time in Stanley
title: Redfish Riverside Inn

Falling asleep to the sound of the river and waking up to this view made our stay that much better. Wish we could‚Äôve stayed longer but we will be back again soon!

Each room has a deck to enjoy the sound of the river or stargaze in on of the dark sky locations. A most picturesque and peaceful place to unwind and unplug.

text:
So,  we decided to wing it and drive to Stanley for an overnight adventure without making reservations at the more popular place to stay in Stanley.  We were pleasantly surprised with the price ,location, quality, friendliness, and scenic view  that we were able to obtain at the redfish riverside inn.  The office was closed when we arrived but called Dianna and she came over within five min.
The room came with two queen beds with what I believed to be 1000 thread count sheets.  Refrigerator, two stovetop burners, microwave and beautiful view of the Salmon river.  We saw a wolf, fox and herd of elk the next morning while having coffee on our deck.   This place was awesome and I can't say enough good thing about it. The pic shows elk upstream from the room.

We will definitely come back b

text:
Typically I am quite skeptical about these corporate run places or attractions like this. Especially when they're located in a mall or something of that fashion. In my opinion they tend to be more of a gimmick than an actual fun and educational experience.
That being said, you should also know that if you're expecting something like one of those very large public aquariums that everyone raves about, this very much isn't that in any way shape or form (and that's okay). It is however much larger than what you might be anticipating if you're basing things on how the outside of the building looks.

I say all of that, to say this. Even though this place isn't of the caliber of many major city aquariums, it does have to some great qualities for what it is. I wound up here because my Fianc√© and I decided it would be a good weekend adventure for the kids, and as it turned out, we were right.

One of the major perks right off the bat is the fact that they often are only taking guests that buy tickets in advance (at least this was the case while we were there), meaning it is much less busy than it would be if they were letting everyone walk up and buy tickets. I feel that this really made for a less congested and more personal experience with the kids.

I don't know exactly what I was expecting for the price of a ticket here, but I do feel like it was absolutely worth it, not only for the kids, but for the adults as well. There were certain periods throughout the experience that I think I was probably more excited to see a certain animal than my ten year old son was. The way this place is set up is basically you're in an undersea maze where you continue on, learning about and seeing all sorts of creatures, eventually ending up at the end (a.k.a the gift shop). There are also parts where you're able to interact and be hands on with certain sea creatures, and that was pretty entertaining as well.

There are not only quite a few creatures (both salt and freshwater) to take a gander at but also several activities for the kids to take part in during the whole experience. This place also makes it incredibly easy to be able to see everything no matter how big or small you are (you'll see what I mean when you walk through). You might even get the opportunity to see several of the creatures eat, which can be quite fascinating. Specifically the Stingrays, I mean have you ever seen a Stingray eat? Probably not, and you totally have the ability to here.

When all is said and done, should this act as a replacement for those gigantic public aquariums that many cities have? Absolutely not, but oftentimes not everyone has access to those places or those specific aquariums, and this would probably be the next best thing in my opinion.
The staff here is also friendly, professional, and seemingly quite knowledgeable about the sea creatures they keep, which was refreshing to see.
I truly believe that if you can separate the fact that you're not going to get the full "aquarium" experience that you might get at those other very well known gigantic aquariums, then you can truly have a great time here, especially if you bring the kids.

Buy your tickets ahead of time, and have a great time. Wander around the mall afterwards, what do you have to lose?
title: SEA LIFE Michigan Aquarium

text: Always a fun experience.  The kids love it and the aquariums are relaxing. The kids really love the pool with the fish they can touch.
title: SEA LIFE Michigan Aquarium

text: This aquarium was a lot of fun. We have three children ages 5, 6 & 6. They absolutely loved it. We got half priced tickets through an AZA Reciprocal Zoo membership. It took us about 1 hour and 45 minutes to work our way through the aquarium. It is located in a shopping center. I read many reviews saying it was too small but I found it to be perfectly sized for a family with small children.
title: SEA LIFE Michigan Aquarium

text: I was skeptical when we arrived at the mall, but what a pleasant surprise finding this aquarium. You must buy your tickets online, they were no line coming in. Love how all the rooms are educational and tell you on the iPad located on the wall about all the fish you see in the tanks. There was an opportunity for the kids to touch starfish and anemones. We were impressed with the see-through tunnel toward the end with sharks, turtles, colorful fishes, and stingrays.  The kids had a blast, we will be back!
title: SEA LIFE Michigan Aquarium

text:
Great outing for families. Fun to see all the different fish. Our newborn loves the flights colors and fishies!

Slightly small. Was very crowded so we were shuffling along.
Felt like you were fighting for each tank and couldn't read the signs to know what was in each tank (signs are small and interactive, often had to touch something to see what was in tank)

(Don't forget to use reciprocal discount)
title: SEA LIFE Michigan Aquarium

text: The place is great for anyone who loves the sea and wish to dive underwater to see all kinds of creatures. Kids will love this place but it is a little too pricy for its short tour.
title: SEA LIFE Michigan Aquarium

text: A bit crowded but had a pleasant experience. Lots of info on the types of creatures. Recommended to buy combo tickets for Sea Life, Peppa Pig and Legoland if planning to visit with kids.
title: SEA LIFE Michigan Aquarium

text:
Never knew this place existed until a few weeks ago, and decided to give it a try on a whim. The atmosphere was very nice, and the exhibits and tanks were well laid out for easy viewing at any pace. We never felt too rushed to get through them in the time we had.
It wasn't too crowded during our visit, though there were a few points where waiting was definitely required due to narrow hallways and small viewing spaces, though not nearly enough to cause an issue.
Definitely a very unique experience overall, and a must-see if you're visiting the mall for the first time.
title: SEA LIFE Michigan Aquarium

text: I really liked this place. I visited with my husband & he enjoyed it as well. The walk through tunnel was amazing! It was easy to walk through & they have a few hands on exhibits. I learned some things about sea life & We had a great time.

text: Great aquarium place. We really enjoyed it overall. So many stingray, fish, sharks, etc. The tickets were $25 each which is pretty expensive for an hour of entertainment. Still nice though.

text: Very cool place. Lots of fish and other underwater life to be seen.  Amazing display.  Kids love it.  Great stop to keep the munchkin smiling.  Not too expensive.

text: Took my eight year old son and he loved everything! We had a great time. Worth the money. You can either go through it quickly or take your time looking at everything ( I suggest slowly looking at everything) so much to see and interactive. We live about two hours away and so worth the drive.

text: Great place to bring the kids! Activities and lots of fish, turtles, sharks, sting rays, & even jelly fish! I had a great experience myself & im the adult. I will definitely come back! I had a great time.

text:
Great location to have an aquarium! The Great Lakes Crossing Outlets are still thriving, unlike so many other malls in the Midwest. Sealife Aquarium is right next to Rainforest Cafe, which is fitting.

The exhibits are nice, the ambient music is soothing, and the lighting really makes the exhibits and fish GLOW. This is a small aquarium, but they managed to put A LOT to see and enjoy into it.

There is a small gift shop, places to sit, interactive exhibits, and decent-sized and adequately cleaned bathrooms.

There isn‚Äôt a food area, but with Rainforest Cafe and the food court, it‚Äôs not necessary.

The price of admission was decent. Due to Covid, it‚Äôs necessary to schedule your time slot. I appreciated the ability to choose a time, as we went on a Thursday at 11:00am, so we could take our time and not be ‚Äúcrowded out‚Äù.

We‚Äôd definitely visit again. üòä
title: SEA LIFE Michigan Aquarium

text: Pretty cool displays and amazing areas to just watch the fish and aqua life! The only negatives are that it is kind of pricy for how fast we got through it, only took 30 mins from start to finish and stopping at everything. We loved the tunnel and the kids really liked all the little places to pop into the aquariums. I also wish there was more touch ponds or tanks, but all in all, pretty cool.

text:
I WAS ROBBED!  The fact that this place is so highly rated is further evidence that Columbus completely lax any decent Italian restaurant.

title: Nicola Restaurant & Bar

text: Excellent service, friendly staff, huge wine list and tasty food. We had a great bottle of Chianti. Then we split the calamari and caprese. The calamari was perfectly cooked, not chewy at all. I saw the guy in the kitchen breading it. The caprese was honestly one of the best I've had. Being winter, the tomato wasn't the best but the mozzarella was perfect. It was topped with a delicious pesto. And the plate was drizzled with the thickest balsamic glaze I've ever had. It was almost like caramel. The balsamic glaze was extremely flavorful. For our main courses, we had the Tuscan Nido and the wild mushroom Tagliatelle. The Tuscan Nido was basically a giant ravioli. The filling had great flavor. I loved the pops of whole peppercorn and the fried sage leaves. The pasta was clearly homemade and perfect. The wild mushroom Tagliatelle was even better. The mushroom flavor was amazing and the smell was just divine. Normally, I would have liked to see the addition of truffle to a dish like this but honestly, I think it was near perfect without. The mushrooms just had such good flavor. To top off our meal, the lady who seated us came around to see how our meal was. Based on our conversation, I assume she was the owner. She was incredibly sweet. We will be back.
title: Nicola Restaurant & Bar

text: I was in Columbus for 4 weeks for work and of course I find this restaurant on my last night in town!  If I would‚Äôve known about this place my first week I would‚Äôve eaten here once a week. Service was good. I got the chicken Marsala and substituted Alfredo sauce with pasta instead of the spaghetti and sauce. It was so good along with the bread and oil!  I want to go back here if I ever get back to Columbus!
title: Nicola Restaurant & Bar

text: Great service, atmosphere, cocktails, wine list. I have only visited once and have only tried their rissotto, which was better than any I've had here in Columbus although no where near as good as what I've had back in Tuscany. Overall, recommend.
title: Nicola Restaurant & Bar

text:
Came here originally on my birthday last year . The food is just amazing. The chef / owner is from Italy and knows how to cook. The homemade pastas were amazing , the staff knew what kind of wine my wife needed , as their wine menu was very overwhelming. Huge wine menu lol .

My wife wanted come back on Valentine‚Äôs Day weekend on a Saturday , and it was such a lovey experience ..... we started with the fried calamari. It was crunchy and tender. Got a nice $30 of Cabernet and it was smooth. I don‚Äôt really drink wine but I was able to drink a whole bottle with wifey . Next we got a shrimp / crab dish and 4 cheese ravioli. Outstanding entrees. Didn‚Äôt look like much but we were very stuffed . Last was our lime something cake ....

We did come at 8pm so the crowd died down so our service was pretty spot on .

Love love love this place !

***updates*** 12/21/2020

Just came here on a Monday for my bday and it was perfect ! When we got there at 6pm there was only us and another table. We practically had the restaurant for a good 30 minutes to ourselves . Usually this place is packed but probably due to covid it has slowed down. They closed their larger dining area. We had a bottle of wine , few appetizers , and two main courses ! Our food was awesome ! And service was great ! Wish it was busier so the restaurant stays in business.

text:

text: One of the best Italian restaurants I‚Äôve ever been too! The atmosphere was so cozy and nice. Our server, Igor, was very attentive and did an excellent job of explaining everything that was on the menu. I got the Tuscan Nido, and it was the best pasta dish I have ever had. text: Excellent food and service highlight this wonderful restaurant on the north side of Columbus!  I was recently visiting family and we decided to go to Nicola for a nice quiet dinner.  It was later on a Saturday night and after we had placed our orders we were pleasantly surprised when our server not only brought some bread, but a nice bruschetta appetizer, as well, and he explained it was on the house since they were low on bread.  I went with the lasagna, as I also do, on my first visit to an Italian restaurant and it did not disappoint.  We had also ordered a beef carpaccio appetizer for the table that was quite excellent.  We capped off the meal with an exquisite rendition of tiramisu, that proved to be a delicious finale to our dining experience.  I highly recommend this restaurant and am definitely looking forward to my next visit!
title: Nicola Restaurant & Bar

text:
Cute restaurant! We got our own little corner behind curtain, it was quite perfect for a group of loud kids and adults.

Meatballs and the sauces were very good!!! The other entrees portions are all too big. Seafood risotto was not bad, I would prefer the seafood not cooked so much that they were a bit chewy.

We all laughed over the one giant piece of ravioli, that was not expected. It smelled really good and was told that it tasted very good too.

They have a large menu of wine by glass and by bottle. Cocktail menu was pretty standard.

I would prefer here than any other chain restaurant, but there are also much better Italian out there.
title: Nicola Restaurant & Bar

text: Honestly, this restaurant is incredible.  The food is amazing, the staff pleasantly is at your beck and call. What else can I say other than book a reservation at Nicola as soon as possible.
title: Nicola Restaurant & Bar

text: Meatballs were why I came in for dinner but the lasagna will bring me back time after time.  Lasagna is fabulous.  Great wine list with wide selection.   Staff is courteous and professional
title: Nicola Restaurant & Bar

text:
Today my family and I arrived at Golden Corral in Sterling Heights Michigan and were extremely disgusted with what we saw.

After paying (over $60) we finally found a table that was clean. When we went to the bar, we saw nothing but food thrown all over the floor, the bar was disgustingly dirty, and completely empty. Servers and the manager were just walking through the food all over the floor, never cleaning anything at all. It was so bad, I decided to take photos as well for you.

After sitting down, it took us 15 minutes to get silverware, and over 25 min to get drinks. Our server never cleared the plates from our table when needed either.

As for at the bar; the woman doing the steaks was more interested in flirting and trying to get a date with a customer than actually helping customers, cleaning anything, or even putting steaks on the grill. The salad bar was basically full of rotting fruit and slimy lettuce.

At the desert bar, there was chicken on the floor, food everywhere. My biggest concern was the fact that there were peanuts all over the bar, mixed into other toppings, on the cookies, on the brownies, etc. As someone with an extreme nut allergy, this type of cross contamination is deadly, let alone disgusting.

For $60 my family and I ate one plate of food that was cold by the time we got our silverware because the bar was empty and never refilled. I understand that places may be short staffed but that is not an excuse for any of this. If the health department would have walked in, the place would have been closed immediately‚Ä¶.and honestly should have. When the manager, the staff, the servers, and guests are having to walk through food on the floor and nothing is being cleaned or refilled, that‚Äôs awful. We have been here several times and this is the most disgusting restaurant I have ever seen.

The photos shown below are just some of the photos I took. The entire restaurant was like this.
title: Golden Corral Buffet & Grill

text: Decent food for the price. I mean, where else can you go for tamales, steak cooked to order, a fondue fountain, and cotton candy in one restaurant? Go on a weeknight and avoid the weekend at all costs. Even a snowstorm couldn't keep this place from getting PACKED! When it gets like that, there's just not enough staff to compensate. Outside of the weekends it's a good place to go.
title: Golden Corral Buffet & Grill

text: This is our to go buffet place most weekends, price is so affordable, more selections and they have a decent service. I like their foods though.

text: This used to be a good place, Warden Whitmer ruins another place in Michigan. This place is amazing! 18 holes of glow in the dark golf to beat the heat in phoenix. Staff is super awesome. The 18 hole golf course is fairly big and everything is easy to knock out in about 30-45 minutes. Bathrooms and party rooms available. I wish we lived closer because we would definitely have had some birthday parties here.

The balls glow in the dark and can be ‚Äúreactivated‚Äù every 3 golf courses. The Black lights brighten everything up and I would recommend wearing clothes with colors that will glow.

Glow putt did get busy towards the end of our time there but we never felt in the way of that we were holding anyone up.

I‚Äôd recommend for all ages (1-99+) and for all types of activities (dates, birthdays)

10/10 would recommend taking a selfies or group photos on the 17th hole tunnel.

title: 3 Rivers Resort & Guide Service

text:
Would highly recommend this great little Campground. The property was clean, very well kept, and had everything you could need. Play Set for kids, cozy tent & RV sites, coin operated showers, laundry, dishwashing station and even a place for fishermen to clean their catch. Convenient store with the basics as well as some handmade goods and local foods. The quaint little grill in the back makes a mean burger and has tons of food options. I enjoyed the seafood basket which was plentiful (shrimp, clam, scallops & fries).
Everyone we came into contact with was friendly and helpful. The only downside I might mention is that there is only of toilet and one shower for the whole park. We came in the off season, so this was no big deal. Not sure what it would be like in the busy season.
Overall a great place and we loved our stay! Will be returning for sure! Location is key and this place is perfectly situated between, Rialto Beach, La Push, Forks, & the Hoh. Didn‚Äôt hurt that they fully embrace the Twilight mania that has over taken this area either. I was here for the National Park, but am also a Twilight fan, so I really enjoyed all the little Twilight touches they had. ‚ò∫Ô∏è
title: 3 Rivers Resort & Guide Service

text: We stayed here when we went to the hoh rainforest. It's a bit of a drive to/ from there but there really isn't many places to stay in that area that aren't. I would 100% stay again! The cabins were small but comfortable

text: Wonderful place.  Bathroom might be an issue when campground is full.  We had no issues.   Great for tent trailer.  Great wifi!

text:
This place was a recommendation and man are we glad we listened! It's a little hole in wall joint. Has a pretty good size menu. You order at the front and can take a seat and wait. They have a Twilight themed menu for those visiting for fun(; I had the Bella Bananas Split and it was amazing. I'm a vegetarian and had a few options which was nice. I had a salad and my husband and kids had burgers. There was hardly any crumbs left. The onion rings were AMAZING. Beer battered and fried to perfection. There is four of us and we each got a meal with sides and everyone got a dessert for $50 bucks the prices were very fair. The workers were all so nice and friendly. We will be coming back for sure!!!!!!

If visiting for Twilight they also have a Treaty Line sign across the street and a few different tourist items to check out!!!! Stop on your way to La Push and grab some burgers to eat at the beach!
title: 3 Rivers Resort & Guide Service

text: This review is really mostly about the showers. Haha. Stopped in the store here today during an epic journey through the Olympic peninsula. I was searching for places to shower and came across a trip advisor review from 8 years ago that said there were showers available for 75 cents.  After hiking around in the sea breeze and camping out, I really wanted a shower, so we decided to stop in and ask if they were available and luckily were pointed in the right direction. There is a single stall shower in a small room, it is self serve, you just need quarters. 4 minute showers available for $2.00, 5 for $2.50 6 for 3.00 and 7 for $3.50. The water got hot, the pressure was average. The ladies in the office/store were friendly, shower was good, the camp itself looked clean, however, we had camped elsewhere.

text:

Anyway, the ambience is a bit dark and outdated and the water cups were dirty inside. I'm sorry but this leads to one star degradation.
title: 3 Rivers Resort & Guide Service

text: This is a good place to rent a cabin or camp with an RV but is terrible for tent camping. The showers they advertise are pay showers, it uses quarters with no place to set your clean clothes except the floor nor anywhere to sit to dress. The tent sites are very close to a busy road which you can hear road noise all night long. If you bring a pet they charge you $5 extra per night even if tent camping. There is also no water spigot for tent campers, only RV. The place is beautiful but that's all it has going for it.
title: 3 Rivers Resort & Guide Service

text: Stopped here for dinner. Although they closed at 7pm they accommodated us shortly after that. Outdoor seating, incredible burgers, fries, and shakes. Should be on your list to stop when visiting the nearby beaches!

text: Booked cabin via airbnb. $20 fee for one pup and supplied a goodie bag with biscuits and poo bags. cabin was clean. bed comfy. has some Twilight stuff so that's cool. restaurant and convenience store open til 7pm. ordered bogie burger, tator tots, and corn dog. order was correct. staff in store and restaurant are friendly. order was ready quickly and tasty. would definitely stay here again!

text:
Gorgeous spot close to Rialto Beach. There's camping and cabins and tiny houses - we stayed in a cabin. It was quite comfortable, very clean and quiet. The shower was small but had plenty of hot water and good pressure. It came stocked with pots and pans and other things you'd likely need, including a gas stove.

The owners operate a convenience store and restaurant. They're lovely people, friendly, and the food was good (not fancy, if that's your thing, but it was tasty).

Very conveniently located and they even had a gas station. Certainly worth staying here if you want to see Rialto Beach and soak up some nature.
title: 3 Rivers Resort & Guide Service

text: Nice view but the restaurant was way over priced and resembled nursing home food.  Terrible overpriced food.

text:
I had a great time at 3 Rivers! We stayed in the Pacific cabin and it was perfect. It would be a great basecamp for adventures on the Olympic Peninsula. We will be back.

The Pacific is like a fully appointed house! You have laundry, a dishwasher, a huge fridge, oven and stove...the works. It doesn't seem small! When we came in everything was spotless. Very, very clean.

The Resort is super welcoming, they have everything you'd need on site. Staff was friendly. We loved the Salmon Candy. Definitely 5 stars.

text: MOLD AND TERRIBLE HOUSEKEEPING!!! Front desk has great customer service. Kayla was very attentive and has great customer service. I stayed ten nights and housekeeping would show up every other day. I had to do my own bed, and take out my trash on the days that no one would show up. On the days that they showed up it was around 4 PM and in a bad mood. I talked to a manager by the name of Kyle three times and he did nothing about it. My shower was never cleaned even though I mentioned to the housekeeping lady that I had mold in the shower. I stay at Hampton Inn‚Äôs all the time and this is definitely the worst house keeping in the country. They should win a Golden Globe Broom for the worst housekeeping service.
title: Hampton Inn & Suites Aberdeen

text: It's my first time traveling to the Dakotas and I'm glad I decided to stay here for a few nights before leaving,  I got to relax in a luxurious/business room , kept up with my workout routine and even enjoyed the pool and whirlpool for a lil bit , everything you need is in walking distance if need be. Jordan from the desk was kind and informative. I recommend this place for all my friends.
title: Hampton Inn & Suites Aberdeen

text: This is a newer hotel.  We have stayed several times.  With the youth baseball activities in the area, it will get a lot of use, and really was needed to help with housing the families that come to the area for baseball events.  The location is great.  The parking is ample.  There are several food options in the immediate area.  The hotel is right off of Rt 95, with easy access.
title: Hampton Inn & Suites Aberdeen

text: You will miss your bed at home real quick! The only thing keeping me from giving a two star or worse rating was the fantastic customer service: front desk, housekeeping, and the breakfast attendant. Otherwise this Hilton-brand Hampton Inn and Suites is not worth the higher price point than many of the other options in Aberdeen and is way overdue for a refresh (maybe we can blame Covid-19). The colors and finishes in the lobby, halls and rooms are dinged, scuffed and just plain ugly. The king-sized bed in our non-suite room was caving in and needing replacement. When booking, be aware not all the rooms are like the pictures on the site, some are very plain with no kitchenette, just an awkward mini fridge and microwave by the desk in the room. No real dresser if you like to unpack just a small hutch with sticking drawers that the TV sits on. Pull out style love seat sofa seemed like a great option for the kids, but the window was very drafty and our son about froze the first night. The blankets were very thin waffle weave style. We asked for a second for the next night and he put on extra clothes and was okay. Not comfortable enough for an adult, he slept on it backwards, because even he could feel the metal. The bathroom was a good size which was nice for a family traveling with younger kids, but the bathroom fixtures were loose and the shower almost didn't work. The toilet took several flushes. The pillows in our room weren't the usual mixture of firm and soft (feather and polyfill as it turned out for here), but housekeeping brought us new ones when we inquired at the front desk during breakfast. The breakfast was quite good. Many choices, including an oatmeal area with fixings, plus other hot options, waffles, fresh fruit, yogurt, biscuits and gravy one morning and the next eggs and sausage patties. Coffee options were hot. Pool and hot tub area was small, but we had fun anyways. Pool towels were restocked regularly. Elevator floor became sticky one evening, but as we were in and out, right away they had it mopped I noticed. Again, great customer service that way. We also did laundry which was weirdly on the second floor off in the corner, kinda creepy, but washing and each dry cycle was just a dollar in quarters. Front desk had change.
title: Hampton Inn & Suites Aberdeen

title: Landmark Suites

text:
Of all the hotels that I've stayed in my entire life, I can safely say, this is the most complete one yet. The rooms are so well planned. The separation of bedroom(1 tv here) and kitchen-and tv room(another tv here). The quality of the mattresses. The quality of the linen and the cleanliness. The stocked kitchen with cooking utensils and pots & pans. The safe in the closet. The quietness and the food offerings at the counter. And the value for the money can't be beat.
I could not stay at another hotel  in the vicinity, after staying here. My hat's off to the management and owners for such a well designed and planned offer. I highly recommend your stay at this great hotel. You won't regret it!
title: Landmark Suites

text: Kids love it..absolute best spot..small but nice and clean..the staff are super helpful and friendly..

text: My granddaughters and I love this place! This is the second time we‚Äôve gone and it has expanded so much! Lore is awesome. My teenage granddaughters and I have dressed up both times we‚Äôve gone and I have to extremely encourage everyone else to also. You‚Äôll have more fun.

text: We had such a fun time at evermore park! I‚Äôm not super into fantasy stuff, but you really can choose what you engage with and how much. The shops are fun and the characters are amazing. It really warmed my heart to see characters interacting with all different types of people in such a fun and positive way. Only negative - the food is overpriced and subpar. There weren‚Äôt many options and I honestly would eat after next time.

text:
Let me begin by saying that Evermore has such great potential!
The young ladies who greeted us at the front entrance were incredibly helpful! Rebecca and Lee - 5
The young ladies at the archery -5
The haunted house- 3 very creative
Park set up: 4
Park amenities: 1
It is not disability friendly at all!
I asked to rent a electric scooter
I have ms and it‚Äôs difficult to walk.
Someone stole the one scooter they had? üòÜ lol thats a first
Food- 1
What a joke. They have a very nice restaurant set up
But it only serves 2 desserts that could pass for McDonald‚Äôs $1 desserts
They have smaller getups
They open at 6 food (can beef stew and Mac n cheese or chicken nuggets and fries sold out by 8
We had to wait literally 30 min and another 30 min for chicken nuggets
The food definitely not amusement park quality.
Park Combo- 1
The train ride was down
I asked for a bottle water to go towards my drink
I was handed a warm bottle of water straight from the case of water plastic bag!
The guy was literally opening the can of beef stew while we waited lol
They also had a microwave
$1 dessert
A large bread bowl with a small scoop of canned beef stew
The other individual had a large bread bowl with a scoop of prepackaged Mac n cheese.
Do not get the combo
Not worth it
title: Evermore Park

text: We purchased the tickets that included the meal, drink, dessert, train and haunt. We thought this was a great value for the money. We had a lot of fun and really enjoyed the entire experience.  We encourage anyone to try this very fun and original theme park!
title: Evermore Park

text:
I visited evermore on a Friday evening with my husband at the start of Mythos season. We ate at Vander‚Äôs keep to start our evening. I recommend the butter toffee beer! It has a horchata-esque creamy cinnamon taste to it. Yum! I wish there were free refills. We tried the poutine, patty melt and deer meat. It was all delicious except the vinicent was kinda nasty, a crazy flavor if you aren‚Äôt expecting it! The prices were also more steep than I was expecting.
Then we ventured into the park itself. We wandered up the eastern side and noticed lots of unfinished buildings and construction, so our first impression wasn‚Äôt the greatest. But then we stumbled upon the renaissance fair activity area with archery, knife throwing, and dueling and that was a blast! We loved exploring the mausoleum and talking with the evermorians. It was fun to chat with the barmaid while taking shelter from the cold air. I liked how compact the park was so that you could run around completing quests and not get too worn out.
The hand crafted shops were fun, some prices more reasonable than others.
Overall a fun experience that is very unique! I only wish they would give you a guide/notebook with the activities listed, times, and conversation starters so that wasn‚Äôt so confusing. With some more work this place could be amazing. I can‚Äôt wait to see how it develops in the future.

Pros:
-Delicious Restaurant Food
-Evermorians are entertaining to interact with
-Fun buildings
-Feels like you are in a different world
-Max the Macaw!
-Ticket price is great

Cons:
-Sometimes unsure on how to interact with the park/evermorians/buildings
-Expensive restaurant
-Unfinished construction
-Seemed under-decorated this season compared to the Halloween photos
-A couple more activities would be great
title: Evermore Park

text:
If you are into Cosplay, LARPing, Renaissance Fairs, medieval lore, magic, fantasy, Middle Earth, etc. then this is the place for you.  We did general admission, and dressed in normal clothes, and were treated wonderfully.  Full costumes were celebrated of course.

Bring a little extra money for cool stuff you can buy all over the park.  Be ready for a lot of standing and walking.

The potential of this place is unbelievable.  You would never know it is hidden in a traditional city like Pleasant Grove!  They are continually adding new venues and experiences.
title: Evermore Park

text: I'm between a 3 and a 4 star experience here. The actors are fully committed and extremely fun to interact with. Most of the site is fairly polished but there are some areas in need of tlc ( boarded up buildings etc) The concept of this place is so fun and I love the welcoming feel for all types. Very fun to see all the different guests dressing up. Some major pain pains were the confusing "quests" and the difficulty in finding an adult beverage on the property. Our group had no idea how to go about "joining a guild" or in "completing a quest" that was mentioned at the entrance. Some people in our party wanted to grab a drink while there and the only place was the onsite restaurant. When we asked at the front they told us we could sit at the bar and grab a drink as long as we purchased food ( standard utah law) but when we went inside they said we needed a reservation and we couldn't sit at the bar until after 9:45pm ( not a utah law requirement fyi) pretty annoying. We ended up making a reservation and wow, the food was super over priced and extremely underwhelming. We ended up sending back the chocolate cake (super stale) The drinks were watered down and not worth the price, the time it took to get to the table and the hassle. The restaurant wasn't even half full and was still soooo slow. Cool one time experience but until they work out the annoyances it's really not worth the $19  per person fee. Don't come hungry or thirsty because it's disney prices for a 7 peaks level.
title: Evermore Park

text: If I could, I'd go here all the time. The vendors were so cool, there's quests to do from the characters in the park. So many people dressed up and there's ax throwing and archery. I went for the Lore event and I loved it! We also did the haunt and it was definitely worth it! I wish there were more food options though. Can't wait to go back!
title: Evermore Park

text: I have followed Evermore since the early concept days, with a booth at Salt Lake Fan-X. I can tell you the park lives up to and exceeds my expectations. One of the best experiences anywhere. My favorite season is the Lore season, because of the haunt. The whole park is very family friendly, and great for all ages!
title: Evermore Park

text: Our company party was held here and it was a great night.  It was a great experience and fun atmosphere.  The Christmas lights were still up and it made for an excellent evening. I enjoyed the train ride and got a great view of the grounds. I really like that there were fire pits throughout and we were able to stop and warm up for a minute.  I will definitely visit again.
title: Evermore Park

text: What an amazing place!!! I had no idea that this place existed until today. We ate at Vanders keep and the. Decide to visit the park. I was not ready for the wonder inside. Make sure you interact with the characters in the park to go on the special quests.
title: Evermore Park

text: Went at 6 pm on Friday. Interacting with the cast of characters was a lot of fun. Some of our group really enjoyed the fright walk (think haunted house) and the vendors had a lot of really cool stuff. Overall everyone was friendly and made the experience well worth it. Bring a light jacket or hoodie as it gets colder as the night goes on. Kids already talking about when we go back.
title: Evermore Park

text:
So this last Saturday the 4th of June was me and family's first time at Evermore. Holy heck did we have a blast. And we didn't even really do everything. There truly is so much to do and enjoy for everyone.  My daughters ran on quests to join the rogue elves guild, my 4 yr old joined the fairy guild and won the kiddo costume contest and my son who has no idea about fantasy dove right in when in the arena lol. Not knowing how to really interact made it a challenge but the Evermorians there made it really easy to do when they engaged with us. So even if your shy and nervous and dont know what to do someone will send a smile and interact with you, but its up to you to interact back just play with it and have fun.
Diego the orc was an absolute blast and my family chatted with him every chance they got.  All the fairys knew my daughter by name and would say Hi every time they saw us walking around. Sir Darlan as well took it upon himself to show her how to use a foam sword when she nervously asked him if she could touch the swords by the dueling area. Basically I just wanted to be able to say a true thank you to all involved for making this trip a truly memorable experience and one that will be repeated in years to come. And for any unsure about the experience don't over think it and just dive in and wander around there's so much to enjoy for everyone. I can't express it enough and just wanted to share it, thank you, thank you,  thank you from the Boyer clan.
title: Evermore Park

text: So much fun! I went here with my husband, brother in law, and nephews! This is an awesome experience that you can't really get anywhere else! However, we came here in December and it was freezing!! They had many fires so you could heat up for a bit, but we could not finish the quest as we were all too cold to carry on!
title: Evermore Park

text: The reptile and bird show was engaging and led by an excellent host. It also had air conditioning which was a plus during the heat of the day. A guy named Jonathan gave our kids a second sample of cotton candy after challenging our kids to compliment someone they didn‚Äôt know which was a very pleasant experience and learning opportunity for them. There were very few food options but the activities were great!
title: Evermore Park

text: This place is so fun I love going with my kids and having little adventures. If they would complete the park and have more thing to interact with like little cottages that are dedicated to potions or herbs maybe some more characters running around THIS place really has the potential to be absolutely amazing and a definite tourist attraction they just need to put a little bit more TLC into it.
title: Evermore Park

text:
Here‚Äôs some helpful info if you‚Äôre going during Aurora/Christmas time. We were able to get into the park pretty quickly; there were two lines - one for buying tickets and one for scanning them if you purchased them online (which we did). So we only had to stand in one line. We decided to get the meal included in our combo passes right away and ended up waiting 30+ minutes in a crowded line at Kettle Cafe to order and get our food. We were incredibly lucky because we found a 4 person table that cleared inside with 3 seats so our kids were able to sit there and my husband and I stood shoulder to shoulder to eat our food. Most people probably had to eat outside in the freezing cold. They told us they were out of desserts, so we didn‚Äôt get to order them. But lo and behold, the dessert window was full of fresh new desserts just a couple minutes after we got our food. This was frustrating because we knew we‚Äôd have to wait in yet another line to get the desserts included in our combo passes.
The wait for the train ended up being 55 minutes, plus a couple more sitting on the train waiting for it to go. This was pretty excruciating because it got down to 15 degrees the night we were there and there was no heating in the line which is covered by a roof but fully outdoors. We had really bundled up but it was still super cold. Our kids were troopers and hung in there because they really wanted to ride the train, which of course ended up not being worth a 10 minute wait let alone nearly an hour long wait in sub freezing temps.
So after we got that out of the way, we waited in the confectioner shop for cookies since we weren‚Äôt able to get the desserts we‚Äôd waited for earlier in the evening. Another 10+ minute wait but at least it was indoors which was actually pretty nice because we couldn‚Äôt feel our fingers or toes by then (we were all wearing thick socks, snow boots, and gloves just for the record).
We spent a short while exploring outside but weren‚Äôt clear on where to go to do a quest. The map on the website isn‚Äôt very helpful because you can‚Äôt zoom in and actually read the words on it.
Going to Evermore is something different to try at Christmas time, but a lot of waiting in lines if you want food and especially if you want to ride the train. I‚Äôd consider going there once every few years but maybe only when the weather is nicer.
title: Evermore Park

text: Their website is a bit confusing thus we bought our tickets in person. We visited during an off season so there wasn't much to do. However we were able to walk around and enjoy the lights and participate in archery. Also there were a couple alpacas we could pet. This time of year the tickets cost about $19 per person.
title: Evermore Park

text: Excellent venue. It was cold but it was so worth it. There are pits set up all over the property so you can get warm at every stop. It was amazing and must be seen
title: Evermore Park

text:
we waited almost three years to finally come here.  we always had some set back that didnt allow us to go. we wish we had made it work earlier though.  but this trip was so worth it. we enjoyed both nights here in the park and feel like we didnt even scratch the surface of the stories we could uncover. every character interaction was interesting and made us want to know more.

one thing though.... i cant tell if there was actually a mission in the haunt or not.  maybe it was just to distract us and get more scares. but. aside from that unknown so good. please visit.
title: Evermore Park

text: What a beautiful winter adventure! Evermore is such a fun place with a choose-your-own-adventure vibe. My hubby and I spoke to Tundra Maximus the miner and explored the village and even a castle while we picked up side quests along the way. We warmed up with a little hot cider on our way to find Winter Weavers (elegant winter elves!). There were local vendors features handmade costume pieces, sculptures, etc. We wanted to free the ice giant but our dinner reservation came first, so we hustled to Vander's Keep. Oh my was the food delicious! Samantha Fox, our server, let us know the beef stew was inspired by a 19th century recipe and braised for hours. My husband loved his pork chops and I devoured my venison with chili-citrus ginger glaze, which was served a perfect medium rare. The classic cocktails were on point too. We wrapped up the night with a little archery and  headed home wanting to come back to enjoy more of everything.
title: Evermore Park

text: Really cute place. I love the architecture and design of the park. There's a lot of attention to details that makes you feel like you are in a magical world. I wasn't expecting the food to be so delicious! Cute little shops. Fun lighting. Just a cool place to go visit.
title: Evermore Park

text: Absolutely incredible. The actors are so kind and hilarious to work with and insanely good with kids. Very reasonable prices and so much fun to be had! Such an incredible vision and we look forward to coming back!‚Äô
title: Evermore Park

text:
We found this special place on our way back from Michigan to Texas. We were hungry and googled restaurants.
They welcomed us with open arms. We had a great time and found a new regular stop while we are in town.
The portions were perfect, the flavors were genuine and fresh. The food melted in your mouth.
The chef, Mr Magdy, was such a delightful host and was full of cheer and talent.
This will be something we talk about and remember for awhile. We truly can‚Äôt wait to stop by again.
title: Magdy's Restaurant

text: The food was amazing. The steak was the best steak I've had in a long time. I would recommend this place to anyone.
title: Magdy's Restaurant

text: Amazing food and excellent service!! Chicken Caprese was beyond fantastic !
title: Magdy's Restaurant

text: Excellent chicken caprese & french onion soup was amazing. Loved the bread too.
title: Magdy's Restaurant

text: Do NOT judge from the outside, although I can see why you might. We took a chance and we were blown away. It was a very quaint and nicely decorated restaurant.  It had white linen tablecloths and napkins, nice music and everything was very clean. They had a nice wine list and we ordered some chardonnay as an appetizer....and then an actual appetizer. For the main fare we ordered beef wellington and chicken caprese. The food was absolutely delicious! Chef Magdy came out and spoke with us. He was absolutely charming!! He comped us free desserts, which were also delicious, and made us feel like we were eating with an old friend. We dressed for the occasion, but it is not necessary at all. It's a very comfortable, fine dining experience. Give it a try.
title: Magdy's Restaurant

text:
We had an amazing time and we enjoyed the food and appreciated the whole experience.
Our dinner started with complementary bread and butter. After that, we had a salad with a delicious dressing.
Our main course was a dish of quail in special wild mushrooms sauce, a dish of a rack of lamb which I highly recommended, a dish of snapper with homemade cajun spice, and the venison on the cherry port sauce.
For dessert, we had this delicious tiramisu.
Magdy the owner is a very skilled chef and a friendly welcoming person.
This place is one of the best places for me.
Highly recommended and it‚Äôs better to call before you go.
title: Magdy's Restaurant

text: One of the classiest places I‚Äôve been had the rack of lamb and it was amazing
title: Magdy's Restaurant

text: The best steak I've had in Terre Haute. Excellent food, great service and very fair prices! We will be back!
title: Magdy's Restaurant

text: This place is a hidden gem. The food was excellent and the staff was extremely friendly. The chef comes out and talks with the diners and checks up on you. We had the beef wellington and it was so flavorful. We will be back again for sure!!

text: Chicken a-la Magdy was great, just the right amount of garlic. Tiramisu was like it‚Äôs supposed to be and not that quick stuff. Service was good and accommodating, enjoyed my dinner.

text: Love coming to this paintball field. There are always great people and an awesome paintball feild.

text:
NiteHawk is the best place around to play scenario paintball / woodsball / Req. Which is saying something because what few choices we do have in the area are all great! NiteHawk management is excellent and always willing to help as are the field regulars.
They offer decent rental equipment so you can bring your buddy, or for yourself if you're not convinced to make the investment in your own gear.
They offer food, and drinks at the field at fair prices and the field paint is reasonably priced also. NiteHawk is a passion project for the owner and regulars that come here and this is one of the things that make it special IMO. There is a sense of community at NiteHawk, and it's just an absolute blast  to go out and play paintball here.
title: NiteHawk Paintball

text: One of the best paintball experiences I've ever had. Will be going back many more times üòÅü§ò

text: Beautiful place - pristine. Lots of caves to visit for free or small charge. We did Cascade Cave interesting especially where the connecting part of the cave has fallen a d the waterfall worth the small admission price. While there we did the 3/4 mile Box Canyon hike such a cool huge rock formation and squeeze bridge to enjoy. Also did the 1/2 mile natural bridge- that was spectacular!!  Great way to spend a day. Much much more to do there if you have more time
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: A great place if you love the outdoors. 30 miles of hiking, rock climbing and repelling, biking, kayaking, awesome cave tours, horseback riding and nature lovers. Campground packed on weekends in summer but quiet midweek. Outer edge sites woodsy and most are a decent size.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Camped here for four days. beautiful park, great hiking.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: We had a great time here. There are miles and miles of hiking trails and Horse trails.  We took a cave tour that was a lot of fun. It took about an hour ND was more of a historical tour but they have several to choose from.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: This is obviously a much smaller cave system and park than mammoth caves.  However mammoth caves while impressive due to size doesn't really have quite as much cave feel to it because of that size... That being said these are not claustrophobic caves that make you crawl on your hands and knees it's just most areas are closer to a standard hallway with larger rooms scattered here and there.  I enjoyed this trip more than I thought.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: This has been a special place in my family for as long as I can remember!! Always so much to do, beautiful trails to walk and playground for the kids and those still kids at heart!! A Great place to take your family
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: My nephew and I just went for his very first camping trip. The camp grounds were quiet and peaceful, the trails were beautiful, and he declared that he had the best two days of his life (he's6). Ms. Haley gave us a private tour (because no one else signed up for the Tuesday 10am X-Cave trip) and she did a great job with him! He astounded me by telling his mom and dad just about every single thing she taught him on that tour! She definitely kept his attention expertly. Thank you!
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Beautiful cottage with a beautiful view. It was an amazing experience, and the cottage was extremely clean. The guest services folks were super friendly and helpful. We can't wait to come back!
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: One of the absolute best experiences I have ever had in a state park!  Their trails are true nature trails  Do not expect to walk on paved paths in most areas. They have self Explore caves which are amazing short experiences.  You do have to go get a permit to enter these areas but there is no charge and it is only for your safety.  Extremely dog friendly!!!! I will be coming here annually. This is definitely my new family vacation spot.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text:
Awesome park. The guided caves are cool, the unguided caves are cool, the trails are cool, the land bridges are cool, and just the overall place is just fun to be around. I stayed in the cottages, and they are nice for one big or two small families. Well kept. Definitely recommend.

If you come, make sure to check out Horn Hollow cave. There‚Äôs a short little crevice near the main entrance of the cave, and if you follow that, it narrows and narrows. Prepare to be crawling on your stomach in an underground creek. You‚Äôll need to be pretty narrow and pretty flexible (I‚Äôm 6‚Äô and 180 lbs. and I made it though with some difficulty). It goes back a good 200 feet, until it opens up on this huge underground waterfall fueling the creek. It‚Äôs almost as big as the one in Cascade. I‚Äôm not sure if this water fall is well-known, but it‚Äôs well worth the difficulty of reaching it. If you‚Äôre up for an adventure, I highly recommend it.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Awesome park!! Gotta see all the trails that lead to amazing caves‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è This lil fox paid us a visit~ he was so very friendly. He was looking for some snacks, but we didn‚Äôt give him anything üòâ
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Decided to explore Carter caves and found a beautiful park along a beautiful drive through green forest canopy. Park had many spots to go and see, and cave tours were reasonably priced ($8-10 for adults). We took the Cascade tour and enjoyed how our guide took her time explaining history, cave formation, and the flora and fauna of the caves. Time and money well spent, will definitely come back!
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: This was a great trip.  The lodge was well priced and we enjoyed the room.  It could use some updating but nothing that would deter our stay.  A lot of hikes to go on and cave tours.  We did two cave tours and they were both a lot of fun.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: This park is a great place to visit. The caves are just one part of the experience. They have a lake here for fishing or just paddling around. There are many nice hiking trails to explore. All are well kept and clean. The cave tours are very interesting and informative.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: I recommend staying here, the lodge is beautiful and the rooms have comfortable beds, coffee makers, every room has a deck overlooking the forest. The trails are all close by, some just feet away from the lodge. The visitor center has something for everyone.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: An amazing vacation!  The lodge was very nice and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The park is one of the most beautiful places I have ever seen. The cave tours were educational and awesome. Everyone in our group had a wonderful time, and we can't wait to go back. In fact, we started planning our return visit before we even left.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: The access road is narrow and winding with nonexistent shoulders in places. The campsites are good sized and most have shade. There are a lot of amenities including a riding stable, cave tours, and a putt putt golf course. The utilities are oddly set up with one power pole for two sites with one 50 amp and 2 30 amp outlets. The power poles are also somewhat randomly places so depending on the site you will need an extension cord.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: We camped here, went in three of the caves, and hiked a ton of the trails. I highly recommend it all. The caves were cool, but especially the Horn Hollow cave that we got a permit to explore. The trails, except the old golf course, were beautiful. Make sure you find and explore around all the arches on the map.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Nice, quiet place to visit. There's a campground, miniature golf, and in the summer, a swimming pool. And of course there's hiking trails, and don't forget the cave tours. We stay in the lodge, but there are nice cabins available.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text:
Went to Carter Caves to watch the magician Mike and dinner for Valentines.  I highly recommend.  The dinner was booked by tables, you went downstairs by tables then to the buffet so there was no mad rush or long lines.
The buffet was great and had three entree choices, chicken, prime rib and something else.  A good sale, mashed taters, Brussels sprouts, green beans and rolls were other choices.  The desert bar had chocolate candies, strawberries covered in chocolate, cupcakes, banana pudding and a chocolate cake so yummy.
Mike the magician made the event interactive and the made the night fun.  I laughed until my jaws hurt.  We had a good time.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: We really enjoyed the X-cave and Cascade cave tours. My 10 and 9 year old sons preferred the X cave as their favorite   due to it being narrower and trickier to navigate through. Made them feel like real explorers, and they got to get closer to the rock formations. We also enjoyed the hike to Natural Bridge. A little secret we discovered... if you walk down to the creek behind the welcome center and follow it about a quarter mile downstream, you'll find where the creek passes into a cave through the mountain side. Bring a flashlight because there are no tour guides waiting to take you through this one.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text:
This place was exceptional. Everyone was extremely friendly. The food from the resturant was delicious. I missed breakfast but dinner was great.

And all the activities at the Resort. The trails are well marked. It is all dog friendly. They do cave tours. I went in the off season  and was told about all the stuff they offer in the busy season.

I 100% recommend and I will definitely be visiting again.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Absolutely beautiful. Room was clean, comfy and had a huge private balcony with chairs. Staff at Lodge, restaurant and visitors center were beyond fantastic, so helpful, above and beyond friendly and knowledgeable. By far one of the best places we've stayed at for a very long time. We will be returning.
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: This place was way more than we expected. We loved it so much we added an extra day! Very pet friendly. The trails were gorgeous. We stayed in the lodge, but next time we are going to try the cottages. The only negative...housekeeping knocked on our door early both mornings. This set off our coonhound. We were already up. So it wasn't too bad, but if we were sleeping in it would have been irritating. That being said....we can't wait to go back!!!!!
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: What a great Park! After living in KY for 6+ years and realizing we had never been to this state park, we decided it was past time to check it out... and I'm so glad we did! The lodge rooms are a bit dated, but clean with private porches overlooking the trees. The hiking trails and cave tours are AWESOME, though. No pictures can do these justice. We checked out both X-Cave and Cascade Cave, as well as a couple different trails. It was a bit rainy / cloudy when we visited, so we'll definitely be back to do more hiking when the weather is better!
title: Carter Caves State Resort Park

text: Cozy and charming. We will certainly be back.
title: Eagle Harbor Inn

text: The perfect winter DC getaway.  I wasn't expecting it to be a split level but it was absolutely lovely!  The whirlpool tub comfortably fit two people.  Definitely recommending to friends.  My partner loved the fireplace to sit in front of & drink his coffee in the mornings.  Plus they offer afternoon snacks. There was a small kitchenette as well.

text: Wonderful hotel! Is clean, comfortable and the staff is wonderful. We enjoyed their breakfast and look forward to returning!

text: We really appreciate all the recommendations to our Cave Point Kayak Tour you gave us this past summer.  Thank you for the support.

text: The perfect place to stay in the perfect town for a Door county vacation. Ephraim has wonderful views of the harbor. Everything is within walking distance from the Eagle Harbor Inn. We'll definitely be coming back :)

text: Lovely place to stay. Cozy and clean!
title: Eagle Harbor Inn

text: So charming..very romantic
title: Eagle Harbor Inn

text: Cute, cozy, and a great location!

text: This place was awesome. Kids loved the spiral staircase up to the loft. Very clean and staff was very friendly. Excellent location right in the middle of everything. Only negative thing was that it was very hard to get ice. We will definitely be back.

text: Great place for a couple. The rooms are large and well maintained. The grounds are nice with lots of things to do. The charcuterie and champaign was a nice option as were the truffles.

text: The cute rooms at Eagle Harbor Inn were the perfect size for us to stay at on our honeymoon. text:
Why Eagle Harbor is the place you want to stay when in Door County?
Eagle Harbor is located right accross the bay and walking distance to Penninsula State Park. When we entered the property it was beautifully places homes giving you a royal feel of a town. The homes B&Bs are well kept and looks eye pleasing. Upon checking in the host was very friendly and informative about door county. They made us feel home. He check us in and off we went to our room Tilla. Tilla was the 1st room up the stairs on your left. Room was rather small but well designed and very cozy. The antique looks gave it a very stylish english look. The washroom was large enough and had a sky light to it. B&B main building was well decorated (pics attached) and well kept. This beautiful B&B was one of the best we have visited so far. Their breakfast was really good with some freshly baked chocolate Croissant, Cherry Yogurt, Juices Cereals and much more. Their toiletery items were good as well. Very good smelling and nice in quality. This was the best experince for us we felt right at home. Coziest B&B ever. Don't wait make your bookings right now.

text: Beautiful area and cute furnished rooms. My wife and I were very pleased with the amenities and cleanliness of our room. We stayed in the whirlpool suite. It was a very relaxing perfect getaway weekend. We loved the fireplace, tub and the close proximity to other places we wanted to visit on the peninsula. They had contactless check in and check out.

text: My wife and I stayed here for our 20th anniversary the staff was very friendly everything was perfect. text: Had my son's birthday party here decently priced great time for the kids

A few of the inflatables could definitely be replaced. They aren‚Äôt fully flown up (I‚Äôm sure there‚Äôs a leak or something) and have lots of wear and tear. text: My grandkids had a blast! It's a wild and crazy place. But it's indoors and great for kids to release their energy during the cold months. It's also nice in the summer when it's too hot outside.

text: Fun place üòÅ this is a good place for the kids to get tire.

text: So much fun! We took our 1 year old and he absolutely loved it!! text: Honestly I was not impressed, the kids loved it (8, 5, 2yrs) but it felt VERY make-shift. Soda and water machines were broken, only had pricey bottled drinks and no outside drinks allowed (really...?) Pizza wasn't too bad though my pepperoni tasted like it was cooked alongside some pineapples. The arcade games are ridiculously expensive and considering they only have like 8 games their ticket/toys costs we're outrageous. 5 tickets for a Tootsie roll that I just paid 3 dollars to get for my son to play 2 games (and now have 2 tokens/credits I can't use because the lowest cost is 4 credits most are 5) is ridiculously! 3 bucks for a small tootsies roll? wow... How about 1 ticket for 1 Tootsie roll, c'mon. They are LITERALLY pinching every penny possible, and it just feels very trashy. A few small adjustments could change a lot, and the cost would be minor.

text: This place needs help.  Broken chairs need removed.  Tattered floor.  Needs some money invested. But my 2 year old didn't notice lol,  she had fun.

text: Took my 2 1/2 year old here and she loved it! We went on a Wednesday night and it wasn‚Äôt too crowded so my little one got to do everything she wanted. They even have a fun target shooting game that my daughter loves to collect the balls and shoot the target.

text:
Gaia House Cafe was very nice. The decor is slightly bohemian and very cozy with mismatched chairs and tables.We went on a Tuesday at lunch and got the Gaia Tempeh Ruben and the Banh Mi sandwiches.The coffee was excellent. The staff was very pleasant and the food arrived in good time. The price seemed a little steep for sandwiches but when you get homemade pickles and kraut it makes up for it. I couldn't tell where a good place to park would be, so we parked in the Irish pub reserved area with a risk of towing.

Some things to consider: add a bit more spread on the Banh Mi as it was a little dry; add a few completely vegan options to the menu as many of the entrees are so close but then have cheese; swap out those potato chips for a cup of soup. We'll be back! Keep those homemade fermentations coming!
title: Gaia House Cafe

text: Cute cafe, with excellent food and coffee.
title: Gaia House Cafe

text: Gaia is one of my favorite local restaurants. The food is so good, and it is the same every time I order it! Pictured is the veggie stash with potato‚Äôs and rice. The spice combination is just the right combo of flavors. If you need a place with comforting food, that won‚Äôt leave you feeling heavy, this is the spot. The team working there has always been great as well!
title: Gaia House Cafe

text:
Unfortunately I don‚Äôt have anything good to say about Gaia house . When we were sat down there was paint bubbling near us, probably due to moisture trapped behind the paint. And then a leak above. It‚Äôs not really an appetizing sight.

We were told that we wouldn‚Äôt be able to have espresso or lattes because the espresso machine was down. That‚Äôs fine. What I did take issue with was the self serve coffee station. For one, the way the glasses were stored was gross. The shelves were not clean. The cups were freshly washed. I could tell because they were wet, placed rim down. So that the dust and debris on the shelving was collected on the wet rims of the cups. And whenever you picked up a cup you could see the wet rim marked it left. These cups should be dry if you‚Äôre going to store them rim down. Drying them rim down traps the moisture inside (causing an unpleasant odor and taste), and damages the shelves, and is altogether unsanitary if the shelves aren‚Äôt even clean. Storing them rim side up would be a better option in this case . They are used often enough for collecting dust to be an argument for storing them rim side down. Sanitary conditions aside, for a vegan/vegetarian place for the only milk option to be whole milk was disappointing. Consider offering milk alternatives.

The food was even more disappointing . My guest ate his omelet , but I good not stomach my food. The cornbread French toast was incredibly dry, even soaking it in the butter and syrup didn‚Äôt revive it. The potatoes tasted fine but they were stale. Since it was the only semi edible thing available to me I picked at that instead of what I ordered. I only managed to eat half of one slice of French toast and didn‚Äôt want to take it home. We came out of our way to go here after seeing it on Instagram. So it was that much more disappointing.
title: Gaia House Cafe

text: This cafe‚Äô is mind blowing! I eat meat regularly and it can take a seat for once. The Coffee is self-serve and the food is served with a smile. Add it to one of GR‚Äôs hidden gems. So glad it‚Äôs back!!!!
title: Gaia House Cafe

text: Nice spot for breakfast. Nice variety on the menu. Breakfast burrito was a little heavy on the beans, but otherwise tasty.  Cute lounge area towards the back serving drinks only. Did not see any of the  cleanliness concerns mentioned in another review.
title: Gaia House Cafe

text:
Enjoyed a nice breakfast today at Gaia. Our waitress was friendly and helpful. Our party of six was seated immediate on a Saturday morning.

Unpretentious, casual, warm interior. Small menu, but nice to have so many vegetarian and vegan options. Good to have the opportunity to try something different, outside the normal brunch fare.

I stuck with what I normally like - eggs & potatoes plus tried a fruit cup. It was a filling portion and cooked well. The potatoes were well seasoned and crispy. I also enjoyed the sourdough bread that came with my meal. The fruit was fresh and seasonal. Coffee was self-service and offered three options, with creamer available at request. I tried the Swiss chocolate brew and liked it a lot. My friend‚Äôs specialty French toasted looked amazing. It has tender sweet saut√©ed apples, cherry sauce, and almonds. Everyone had to try an apple slice - they were really good!

Worth your time and taste buds! Thanks for a good experience!
title: Gaia House Cafe

text: The tempeh Reuben and the fresh juices ü§§ so so so good.
title: Gaia House Cafe

text: First time ordering Gaia ever! Lived up to the local hype! I got 4 different things just to try a little of all. The cornbread French toast and the Miso Caesar salad were PHENOMENAL. But everything was great! I ordered online and my order was ready and waiting for me but my hot items were still warm and my cold items they had kept in the fridge for me! So nice!
title: Gaia House Cafe

text: Cute place and yummy food! Also pretty healthy!
title: Gaia House Cafe

text: I loved this re-discovery recently! I vowed that if I ever noticed that Gaia Cafe was back  in any way I would maintain patronage as I used to frequent the Cafe when I was a student at Aquinas with friends and family as I maintained a vegetarian diet the majority of my time in attendance there. Thank you for coming back, I love the changes and the maintenance of staple favorites like B.Y.O.B. and Mean Green Burrito. I personally chose the Veggie Stash as recommended by my wonderful hostess (I selected the vegan options for cream cheese and cheese toppings as in recent years I have had to cut dairy out of my diet more fully). I had a lovely experience with the self service water and coffee, enjoying the flow of the community coming in and out of the Cafe as I spent a few hours there working on a few personal and professional goals and trying a new, but also nostalgic, meal. Thank you for being back in the Grand Rapids area!!! üôè
title: Gaia House Cafe

text: My mean green burrito was delicious! Just like old times! And Gaia cares about the planet (see pic). Thank you!!
title: Gaia House Cafe

text: Incredible. Amazing. Delicious. And all those other positive words. Seriously the food knocked my socks off. Service was stellar. Can't wait to be back tomorrow!
title: Gaia House Cafe

text: Gaia's open for in house dining and if you use to frequent the old Gaia in East Town you will be familiar with the menu. No meat is served but don't let that stop you.  We had the Paul Collins Cuban and the Jim White.  I also had a freshly, not frozen or sweetened, fruit cup. For some reason I have not been able to get a good fresh fruit cup anywhere I have been for breakfast lately.   All three, excellent, fresh and delicious. Staff was friendly and happy to serve you.  Although the interior doesn't have the same vibe as the old Gaia it has it's own charm and coolness.  Just like any diverse hip cafe people talk to each other, exchange ideas and genuinely are happy to do so while eating exceptionally good food, and for me drinking good coffee.  We had this experience on our first time there. It will be our go to breakfast place.
title: Gaia House Cafe

text:
1st time trying today.
vegan burrito and vegan breakfast plate. very reasonably priced with large portions. self-serve water and coffee station. there was a jar for vegan cookies at main counter, but was empty. love the vegan options for breakfast/brunch/lunch. cute calm dining.

text: Walking in, first impression of Gaia House was: so cute! Welcoming seating for intimate convos, color scheme,  draping plants and modern lighting made it a sweet environment.
