I had the Pesto Omelet which was full of flavor and made with cashews and yummy cheese. The side of salsa made for a great balance of flavors, I enjoyed every bite! text:
I am so happy to discover that Gaia House Cafe has re-opened!! Stopped by to check the place out and brought a couple of friends! Whitney was our amazing server! The coffee was hot and delicious! The food! The food! The cookies! I so remembered the cookies! I had the Veggie Stash and my husband had the Green Burrito!ü•¨üå±
We ate in the dining area but there‚Äôs also a lounge area to have coffee and other beverages!
title: Gaia House Cafe

text: First timer- after waiting so long to try- and I loved so much! I wanted to try the stuffed tortilla but weirdly the price on the online menu is $4 cheaper than when you go to actually order it online- a lot of menu items were the same way and I wonder if it's on purpose or if the online menu just needs to be updated? Instead, I got the mean green burrito and I loved how fresh it was- I love love love greens and veggies in a burrito and the tomatillo on top was superb. Howeverrr I really really wished the rice and beans had some more flavor! The whole concept of this burrito is amazing but I was left wanting more when the bulk of the burrito was kind of bland. title: Gaia House Cafe

text:
Cute aquarium. I‚Äôll lay out the pros and cons to help anyone visiting Boston for a few days decide whether coming here is worth it or not.

Cons:
I wasn‚Äôt a fan of layout of the building itself and the flow between exhibits was kind of awkward. Also, the touch tanks (ie where the sharks and rays are) are right at the entrance and easy to pass by when you enter. If you go into the gift shop before seeing that area you won‚Äôt be able to come back in without showing your ticket again which is kind of annoying.

The ticket price was also kind of expensive for the size of the aquarium ($34) considering there isn‚Äôt that much to see and you‚Äôll probably spend 1.5-2h there at most. The gift shop has only a few items with the cute logo on it and the rest have tacky clip art on them that you wouldn‚Äôt even be able to tell came from this specific aquarium. They should at least put Boston on there or something.

Pros:
Some of the habitats are so creatively curated, from the shape of the glass to the way they planted the vegetation, it‚Äôs all very pleasing to the eye. If you go in the morning you can see the animals being fed which is extra entertaining. They all seem happy especially the turtles who you can see love to be handled by the marine biologists. All staff is friendly and open to answering questions. If you have small kids and came with a stroller they have elevators and a ramp that goes all the way around the building so you can walk around easily without missing anything.
title: New England Aquarium

text: It was very easy to get tickets online, no waiting at the entrance, although it was quite crowded inside. Penguins were adorable, as well as seals and the big aquarium in the center is quite nice too. I really liked the information boards and possibility to watch feeding of the rays.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Cute for kids or just a date. It‚Äôs the perfect size for them and easy to navigate since it‚Äôs just a big circle. It seems that they really care for their animals which is so important. Cleaning and feedings constantly. The fish and penguins and everything is incredible. A little pricey for the space but if it goes to the animals I‚Äôll take it. That center tank is the main attraction of course absolutely beautiful.
title: New England Aquarium

text: My husband & I chose to visit the aquarium this morning to stay out of the rainy weather. Although the aquarium was crowded, we enjoyed our time there. The aquarium has a very unique layout. There are lots of animals to see & learn about. The penguins were most definitely my favorite! The ticket prices seemed reasonable for the experience. We parked in the parking garage near the aquarium & it is definitely over priced. Overall, we had a great time!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Had a great time. Took us about 1.5 hours leisurely strolling to get through the whole thing. Lots if great information with the displays. Not too crowded. Love how you can see the penguins from lots of different angles and viewpoints.
title: New England Aquarium

text: It's overpriced but still a good option to visit with kids. Easy access from the subway but it can get pretty crowded. The collection is extensive and the main tank with the reef ecosystem in the middle provides some great views. The penguins and seals habitats were great but likely the best part of the visit was to "pet" the many rays in their shallow tank. I would come back here for sure despite the high price.
title: New England Aquarium

text: This place is fantastic, my niece and nephew loved it. They loved seeing the penguins and how they interact with each other. The sea lions were very cool to look at. The central tank is amazing with many different types of fish and large turtles, it is like a mini reef. I also liked seeing the bioluminescent jellyfish and fish.  The fish and other animals were very easy to spot within the exhibit. The information next to the exhibit was good to read. I hope this place continues to flourish for many years to come.
title: New England Aquarium

text: A fantastic aquarium and easily walkable from our hotel.  We came here in the afternoon after doing a Duck Tour in the morning.  We have been several times and my husband and I agree that the penguin exhibit at the entrance is the most memorable aquarium entrance we both remember.  It is worth walking the four floors up and then following the huge tank down the ramp in the middle of the museum.  We also enjoyed the sea lion area outdoors.
title: New England Aquarium

text: I enjoyed my time here but just didn‚Äôt think this aquarium was worth the money. I was hoping there would be more exhibits and diversity of wildlife. Maybe it‚Äôs different in the summer but I would‚Äôve loved to see a dolphin, sea lion or otter show. We went on a super busy day which also made the experience less enjoyable, it was difficult to even get a good view of some of the exhibits. I think they cap off the amount of people in at a time but I still think there was way too many especially since everyone moves in the same path up the atrium. It was alright for a cloudy afternoon but I‚Äôve definitely been to much nicer aquariums.
title: New England Aquarium

text: One of the best aquariums I've ever been too. So much too look at. The giant coral reef with the spiral walkway all the way around it was so cool . Has so many things to look at one every floor. Giant turtle was the best!
title: New England Aquarium

text: There are sea dragons and beautiful jellyfish. The center tank is amazing. The seals are cute. The penguins are friendly and you can pet the stingrays. This place won't hurt your feet, it's not huge like SeaWorld. It's stroller friendly and senior friendly. Great for a date or to take your family.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Wonderful aquarium! The animals are treated well and are all healthy and safe. Staff are knowledgeable, kind, and helpful. Reasonably priced, a cute gift shop and a cafe with a view over the harbor. Great place for families and tourists. Say hi to the penguins for me!
title: New England Aquarium

text: Very fun aquarium, I really enjoyed watching the penguins without a glass. The giant tank in the middle is quite impressive, they managed to make good use of the space. The sea lion exhibit was interesting, but I kind of wished we could see them being fed, as they are very cheeky and fun when they are. The ray and shark touch tank was a lot of fun! Overall a really nice if a little small aquarium.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Loved the layout and our son enjoyed the aquarium.  Wish they had a full live shark exhibit like other aquariums we've visited.

I would recommend eating before going.  The cafe left a lot to be desired.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Took the kids on a day they had off school expecting it to be VERY crowded, but it wasn't. This was most likely due to COVID capacity restrictions, but it was a pleasant surprise nonetheless. We were able to stroll through easily and there was almost no wait to look at all the things we wanted. More places to sit down on the upper floors would be helpful; little feet get tired quickly. The gift shop and food court were reasonable.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Wish it was bigger. No sharks or any larger animals. Just a big circular tank in the middle with penguins at the base and other smaller tanks around the outside. While it was nice and the fish were awesome we found it lack luster. Finished the whole aquarium in like an hour. Was expecting more.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Not as good as some of the other big cities. Still fun, but missing some of the more regular main attractions you would be used to seeing at a bigger city Aquarium (sharks, eels, dolphins, whales, larger sea life). The biggest thing they have is a large sea turtle. Beautiful, but just not a huge band for your very expensive buck. Biggest draw is the four floor tall aquarium tank in the center.
title: New England Aquarium

text: Really enjoyed this aquarium! I've been to many different aquariums; New England stood out because they created many different environments that were truly natural to the species they were trying to preserve. The penguins were extremely entertaining; there were 3 different species that each had their own environment which allowed them to behave naturally. Would highly recommend a visit!
title: New England Aquarium

text: We enjoyed it a lot. I wouldn't say this is the best aquarium. However, if you have not visited any aquarium in any other places like Atlanta, Virginia Beach, Cleveland, Niagara falls etc., this is a best visiting place for the people in and around Boston. If you have been to Atlanta Aquarium this is just one place. Little penguins and center tower three stories water tanks are the best attractions. It's fun for kids for sure.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
The New England Aquarium was amazing! From how clean it was, to how orderly it was organized! The staff was fun, inactive and knowledgeable! The bathrooms were spotless. Gift shop prices were reasonable with some proceeds going back into conservation and rehabilitation of sea life! 10/10 would recommend to anyone, especially with kids. Plenty of room to move around with a stroller, elevator access to all floors.
Seriously considering becoming a member here!
title: New England Aquarium

text: It's a bit pricey and it's difficult to find parking in the heart of the city. That being said, they have a very cool cylindrical tank going up all the way to the ceiling. It was cool to see all the different animal feeding times and at one point you could see two workers in scuba gear in the large tank. The sting ray touch tank was a big highlight.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
4/5 stars because I wasn't super impressed with the overall offerings of live species.
I do love the design of the aquarium and the overall feel when you walk in to the penguin exhibit.

I've been to some great aquariums and I missed the sharks and the sea otters and in Oregon they even had an orca-which happened to be in the movie, Free Willy. Although that was years ago they still have a fantastic exhibit with many more species.

I don't want to be too harsh of a critic, but I was a bit underwhelmed.

I did enjoy the penguin exhibit, the seals and the big sea turtles.

The feel tank had stingrays alone. It was fine, but many feel tanks usually have starfish and other sea urchins. As well as someone commentating.

It was pretty busy and hard to get good pictures, since everybody else is trying to do the same thing.

Aquarium only:

Adults $34
Children over 3. $25
Seniors $32
title: New England Aquarium

text: We had an amazing time at the New England Aquarium. As we slowly walked up the spiral staircase we enjoyed observing the fish in their natural habitat. When we reached another floor we also took the time to view the other displays that provided further insight to sea creatures and wildlife from around the world. A very fascinating experience. Later we went to the theater to see the various films about animal odysseys. That was fascinating as well.
title: New England Aquarium

text: A super cool aquarium! The layout of the building is very fun with the giant spiral center. I love the amount of penguins and sea lions and seals that you can see way up close! The touch tank is a little underwhelming, but it's a nice place to chill by. Also, the sea dragons there are the coolest! I've never seen them anywhere else before.
title: New England Aquarium

text:
Awesome views and structural setup at this aquarium. Loved how we walked one direction and down a different scenery to leave.

My husband and I went on a Sunday shortly after they opened (after our Duck Tour), and it was pretty crowded. We then wondered if it would've been better to go on a weekday.

I loved Murtle the Turtle ü§© She's probably 90 years old and gave us a little swimming show.
title: New England Aquarium

text: We went as a youth conference group to East Canyon Reservoir for the first time in June. There were more than 30 of us and we decided to make the most of it. LUCKY for us, Island Aqua Park had their Grand Opening at East Canyon the same day! To say our group had FUN is an understatement!! The lifeguard on duty was SO professional and super helpful. There was SO much to do! The customer service was seamless and we would do it again in a heartbeat. The youth were totally exhausted by the end of the day but still are talking about the fun they had. Island Aqua Park is legit! Thank you!
title: Island Aqua Park

text: We had a group of 10 teenagers and ending up having a fantastic time for 3 hours on the Aqua park! Nayell did great a job running the show for the first few hours. My kids were asking if we could go back next week. We had a few from our group that were able to write their names on the shack.  We will definitely be returning again!
title: Island Aqua Park

text: We've gone to both the Deer Creek (many times) & now the Bear Lake location. My kids ask to go every year & now we got to play on the Bear Lake location for our family reunion this year too! The owners are also really cool. Worth it every time!!
title: Island Aqua Park

text: Such a fun time today at island aquatic park. It was a great way to beat the heat and we had a blast. Rowan the lifeguard was so sweet and helpful!! She was so nice to our family and made our experience so much better.
title: Island Aqua Park

text:
Mark and Tera,

Thank you so much for your hospitality and service on Saturday.  Our large youth group absolutely loved their time spent on the inflatables at Island Park.  Loved it so much, some of them were hard to get back off!  It really added to a great day and both of you were so great to work with along with your sweet daughter.  We will definitely put it on our list of "must do's" for the Highland Stake for future similar activities.  Also, we will be adding a positive review to both google and trip advisor.  Thank you!
title: Island Aqua Park

text:
Tina, Lauren, Katie, Mama, Noni! Need I say more? Nope! But, . . . It's been way too long since we've had the pleasure. Today was different! I had Pho Beef with ghost peppers! Ecstacy! (10+) Dave had the Temple Chicken, which was superb! (5) Jennifer, went with Beef Pho, which she loved! (2 = whimp!) Life is sooooo much better now! I think we can go on, at least for a little while. üòä

Update on 08/14/19

I had Tina's Gai Boun - Chicken, Curry and Coconut at a "10!" Dave had Tina's General Chicken at a "3!" For our "warm up," we had "3" beef egg rolls and a bowl of Tina's Egg Drop Soup at a "10!" Everything was ABSOLUTELY EXQUISITE!!!!! It was sooooooo good to see Tina and her crew! It's been waaaaay tooooo long! However, with the endorphins released tonight, I believe that I will be able to go on!!! Thank you, Tina!!!!! You came into my life when I needed you most! You do my heart good!!!!!!! Pasong's "atmosphere" is good for your heart and soul! I would recommend it to anyone looking for everything you need to just feel good!!!!!

text: Absolutely fresh and amazing! Went here today for my birthday and they were very accommodating! PHO and sweet and sour chicken was so delicious. Thanks again!
title: Pasong's Cafe

text: Whenever I have an appointment at the VA, I will stop in for lunch, or sometimes even for dinner, as often as I can.  The {deep fried} "Asian Pancake" √† la mode, is a great desert ending to any meal ! ! !
title: Pasong's Cafe

text: The food is very good.
title: Pasong's Cafe

text: My fiance & I got take-out tonight for the first time and it was amazing! The customer service was top notch! They have many great Gluten Free options on the menu also! Everything tasted fresh & was packed with flavor.
title: Pasong's Cafe

text: I ordered the shrimp pad thai mild to go. I was advised that it would be a 20-25 minute wait. I finally was handed my food after waiting 35 minutes. The price was a little high, and the portions little small. On top of that there wasn't much flavor outside of the heat from the curry. There was no sauce. The noodles and the shrimp were overcooked. This was not worth the $16 I spent and I won't be back.
title: Pasong's Cafe

text:
I went for lunch today (Friday) and it was almost packed. So it did take almost 45 mins for my food to come.  But it was so totally worth the wait. I ordered Pad Thai (13.50) and they were absolutely delicious. The waitresses were very polite and friendly. The presentation of food was also stunning. I would go there again.
Update: I have seen rude comments from people about the delay in getting food. Iam not surprised since was told they make it from scratch and it definitely tasted super fresh. I would recommend going somewhere else if you have only half an hour for your lunch. This place is more suited for casual/romantic occasions.
title: Pasong's Cafe

text: Top Asian cuisine in Saginaw; great atmosphere, staff, and vegan options. Be sure to try the spring rolls, they are the best!
title: Pasong's Cafe

text: Best spring rolls and hot n sour soup EVER. Staff is just lovely.
title: Pasong's Cafe

text: The absolute best Thai food in the area hands down. The Pad Thai and the Ph√¥ Beef were excellent. Also were the Crab Rangoon.
title: Pasong's Cafe

text: Sooooo. Yummy. Real food in Saginaw.  Yes
title: Pasong's Cafe

text: The flavor of the pad thai wasn‚Äôt bad. I enjoyed eating it but it wasn‚Äôt what I was looking for and the portion was very small, especially for the high price. Also, there was large white onions in it that I had to pick out because the menu didn‚Äôt say there were onions in it. Maybe I was spoiled in Texas with all the good authentic thai food. If anyone knows of a place in the area with authentic Thai food please let me know. By the way, the girl that works there was very friendly.
title: Pasong's Cafe

text: Really good Asian Cuisine. I tried the tofu here and it was really good. I don't typically like tofu, so I was pleasantly surprised.
title: Pasong's Cafe

text: Amazing food and atmosphere.
title: Pasong's Cafe

text: All tables were taken when I got there at about 12:30. I was told they get very busy for lunch, so I wasn't surprised. The staff was very friendly and took my order while I was waiting, so that when I got a table the food would be coming soon. I ordered the pad thai. It was excellent. I thought it was a little pricey, considering it was lunchtime. The pad thai cost $13.50. That's a little more than I am used to paying for lunch. Having said that it was very good!
title: Pasong's Cafe

text: My new go-to! Their Pad Thai is absolutely amazing! And they have vegan and vegetarian options, which I absolutely love! They normally have lots of takeout orders so I recommend ordering 30-60 min ahead. 10/10 on taste, 10/10 on service!
title: Pasong's Cafe

text: Great service and incredible food! My husband and I both had the Thai iced tea (perfectly sweetened), he had the beef curry and I had the orange chicken. It's surprising how many places can't do a proper orange chicken but these guys are easily a 10/10!! We'll be going back hopefully soon!
title: Pasong's Cafe

text: Worst owner in shelton and he makes injuries for guests a big joke as I fell and broke my foot he laughed and was Cracking jokes about I felt that was just about the worst thing to do as a hotel owner and someone who is responsible for keeping up with repairs and safety guidelines!!
title: Super 8 by Wyndham Shelton

title: Super 8 by Wyndham Shelton

text:
We were driving from Portland home to Canada and it was getting quite late so we found the little town of Shelton and it seemed like a convenient place to stop, being only an hour and a half from the Port Angeles Ferry. We googled a place to stay in Shelton and there was a very limited selection so we pulled into a couple and looked for reviews. Let‚Äôs just say they sounded like rat motels from what we read from other travellers. Once we saw there was a Super 8 in Shelton it seemed like the natural place to say as they are typically a decent place to stay being a franchise and all.

We checked in around 8pm and the front desk person was friendly although seemingly bored with his job. The lobby was clean and nice. We had a truck full of purchases that we didn‚Äôt want to leave outside overnight so it was nice that there was an emergency door close to where we parked for bringing all our stuff in. The front desk person did state that the hotel was located in a decent part of town and our stuff would probably be fine.

We paid $70 for the night which was high considering it was a fairly old hotel. It appeared to have been renovated at one point but the work was amateur at best. There were simple things like repairs to the towel bar which were just never painted over. Little touches like that go unnoticed when done but become BIG eyesores when left not finished. The temperature in the room was hard to keep consistent. I had to keep turning on and off the heat because the room likely is not well insulated. The bath towels were small and the caulking around the tub was gross. There was a mini fridge and coffee area, which was a nice touch. We could hear the voices from the other rooms and the aroma of the Mary J was thick in the hallways. We did not stay for the breakfast unfortunately as we were up and out to head for the ferry.

We didn‚Äôt use any of the amenities, we literally just used this hotel to sleep as a crash pad and it did its job. We felt it was pretty clean and mostly quiet and if we had to stay in Shelton again this would definitely be our first stop.

3 solid stars from Doug and Shannon - It wasn't horrible but it was likely the best option in Shelton.
title: Super 8 by Wyndham Shelton

text:
Relaxing ,Warm, and Dry when it counted.
Glad that it was available for when I was flooded out of the Valley.
title: Super 8 by Wyndham Shelton

text:
The hotel was ok, and the room appeared clean.  The TV worked and the AC worked too.

The lady at the front desk was very nice and apologetic about our not being ready at 2:15.

The bed was worst bed I have slept on in years, but the wort part was the bug my wife found in our bed in the morning.
title: Super 8 by Wyndham Shelton

text:
**** !! Warning !! ****

If you book (I did) this hotel from a third party, your charge will be duplicated.

The hotel is OK as the price. Nice location. Starbucks is just next to the hotel, however, the hotel system is so shady‚Ä¶ am still dealing with the charge they messed up.

Update: The third party refunded on 8/1/21. You have to claim it.
title: Super 8 by Wyndham Shelton

text: I booked two nights due to an emergency relocation of living quarters and break up. I feel safe due to the front door being the only entrance, the staff have been kind and friendly. The room was bigger then i anticipated and clean. Not too hot when you walked in and didn't hear any noise from other guest. Plenty of hot water and pressure in the shower! Breakfast, such as it has been since covid protocols, was ready and visually pleasing. James, the night guy, had the coffee hot and ready before dawn! I'd recommend a stay here if your in town looking for a rest spot!
title: Super 8 by Wyndham Shelton

text: It was a bed for the right. It wasn't overly noisy. The breakfast wasn't anything special. It had a TV, with many channels. The shower had hot water. It was what you could expect from a hotel.
title: Super 8 by Wyndham Shelton

text: The beds were bad. Kinda like sleeping in a lumpy hotdog bun. The hotel clerk was helpful and funny.
title: Super 8 by Wyndham Shelton

text: The best Super 8 experience I have ever had. Thank you Space for making it possible. They are lucky to have an employee like you. The rooms are clean and  the staff care about their guest. Great place to spend a night.
title: Super 8 by Wyndham Shelton

text: Overpriced and small. I don‚Äôt find it worth it and they also have less trampolines.

text: Visited a few times now,  manager is always there and always helpful!! Place is clean!! Well staffed and all staff are friendly and responsive to anything! I couldn't imagine working with kids in this environment they make it look easy! Thank you too the staff !

text: Definitely a fun place! I even bounced with my boys. Awesome big red slide, so many things to do and clean. Service was awesome as well. My boys new favorite place.

text: This place offers a lot of fun for kids of different ages. It's absolutely huge on the inside with plenty of areas. They also have pool tables and video games for people who prefer that. I was surprised at how cheap it was for everything they have to offer! Will be returning with the kiddos in the future!

text: The location is very nice and have a lot of space. Which is great for kids in raining day and snowy days.They seemed not to care too much about cleaning. Some of the area are a little old. text: Feel like a kid again. So many things to do n private parties enclosed. Pizza was delicious n filling.
title: Funz Trampoline Park Hamden

text:
Came in for the weekend from New York it was raining here in Connecticut so I found this spot to take them to pass the time. Large place, rooms for parties.
They have cubicles for your shoes and belongings.
Massage seats in the trampoline areas that take your credit card from $2 to $20(1hr).
The night I went they had a couple of parties so there was a lot of teenagers.
I came for the Glow which is just after 6:00 p.m. nothing special. Along the wall there is the arcade area that has Halo FireTeam Raven,.  Guitar Hero, Fast and Furious, Supercars 3,  2 Bolton Celtics NBA Hoops,  Grab n Win with teddy bears, Prize Time with Basketballs for prizes, PacMan Battle Royale for four players, 2  pool tables, AirHockey,  hurricane simulator Boxer tournament. They all take coins and dollars and there's also a change machine to provide changing of bills,  and a small cooler area that has different types of soft drinks for$2.50. Candies are at the front desk and about $1.25 for Starburst M&M's and Kit Kat. Cafeteria style seating to eat. Overall it was fun- the tickets were about $20 per  person and I have to pay for socks since you have to use their üß¶ socks

text: One of best places to take kids without breaking the bank. Half the price of a lot of other attractions, great staff. Always welcoming and accommodating. Will continue here as a regular customer. Manager is great guy to do business with.

text:
Perfect for the family.
Was a blast.

text:
If you are looking for a great mini-golf experience then this should be your choice.

It is a fun course, kind of classic (apparently around 35 years old) and aging quite well.

My son is a bit of a mini-golf fanatic and he loves that you can see the ball travel through the "trough"; the classic touch I suppose... : )
title: Sonoma Family Fun Center

text: Family loved the zoo experience here! Arrived at opening and easily used our scanner online tickets. Amazing enclosures with up close looks at some of the animals! Great "cool zones" for these 100¬∞+ days. Easy to step inside for a cool off and all restrooms were clean. The "beastro" is way over priced even for a place like this. The snack stations are a bit high too but when it was 105¬∞ today we gladly paid $5.99 for a small Powerade! The 4D movie is a great deal! $24 for 4 and was worth every penny! Stop in for a great show and a good way to beat the heat!  Bring quarts of you want to feed the fish or similar animals since there are pellet vending machines near the water ways. Most of the little vending machines take cards which was convenient for us. The staff were so friendly and didn't hesitate to answer questions!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Honestly the best zoo I have ever visited. The enclosures are designed to make for easy viewing of the animals and many are very close. Be sure to do the encounters. They are absolutely worth it.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Great zoo to visit! Large variety of animals, birds, and fish to see. Lots of places to sit and or eat if you get tired. Lots of restrooms as well. Wear comfortable shoes as the zoo is large. If your toddler gets tired and they will, you can rent strollers if you don't have your own. Giant carousel!  Lots of souvenir shops. Courteous and helpful staff. Open Sundays too!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Great local zoo.  Not huge in size, but lots of personality and they work the exhibits into the landscape.  Animals are well taken care of.  Pro tip, come right when the zoo opens - got here at open and had over an hour with almost no one else in the park!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
Hands down a one of a kind zoo! I was trying to make it early in order to beat the heat but it was still scorching down on us but it‚Äôs understandable it‚Äôs late August.
There is SO much to see and there are some animals that you won‚Äôt see very often - at least not in Dallas or Houston Zoos- they have hippos, a hyena, the cutest bush dogs, and stunning crowned cranes.
There is room for improvement for sure- some exhibits have overgrown weeds and the restrooms could use some TLC but all in all I would definitely recommend families to come check this out!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Very good zoo.  I wouldn't put in the same class as the San Diego Zoo, but,  well worth the visit!   The Rhino and Giraffe are the highlights.  They have a wonderful variety of birds and reptiles.   All the staff were outstanding üëè and friendly.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Fantastic zoo! I think they have every animal here. It was so many from all over the world, some I never heard of. There are also interactive experiences such as feeding the giraffes and petting kangaroos. You will have to pay for these things, which turned me off a bit since I think the zoo makes money from so many other things. There is also a kiddie amusement park right next to the zoos if parents want to find other ways to amuse their kids. I highly suggest you buy a Groupon or find some other site that would allow you to get a discount. I didn‚Äôt and paid the full price of $31.00 and I wasn‚Äôt pleased. With that said I still would recommend going here if you are in San Antonio.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Loved our visit! (3) 11-12yr old girls in tow, and they enjoyed seeing and learning about the animals here. Good variety of birds, fish, & reptiles, too. We'll definitely make the 1.5+ hour trip back to San Antonio when we want to get out of Austin,  but not so far. Nice set up for littles too.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Good exhibits, animals are easy to see, kid friendly (as exhibits are all close together so you are constantly engaged in looking at things). Went on a hot weekend and it was busy but not as bad as I expected. Free carousel rides with membership. Free parking. Enough air conditioned areas spread throughout the park that we had enough chances to cool down! (Check out where the hippos are, the beastro restaurant has lots of extra seats inside, and the aquarium.) There was much more action (the kids zone had music and dancers) and shops and food open now in July than when we visited in February.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
This zoo was awesome!
1st great experience, there's a Starbucks on the corner of the parking lot! All the animals were awesome! The only part I didn't understand was the multiple flamingo exhibits throughout the park. Otherwise, everything was perfect!
Definitely got Starbucks walking back to the car!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Such a clean place! The employees have great hospitality with the customers. The food/drinks were way over priced. Some of the popular animals weren't out for some odd reason. The ticket prices are decent. Overall. I rate the zoo experience 8.5 out of 10.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Our kids enjoyed themselves so much. So many animals to see. The weather was perfect. We went on the weekend and there was no wait to go in. Fun music everywhere!  We enjoyed riding the carousel!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Good zoo. I really enjoyed how it's set up. We went during a cold day so there was some things we didn't get to see but it was nice having the dinosaur's out around the zoo. Good variety of animals. Also my kids got to ride on a camel which was pretty fun for them. A bit pricey but they enjoyed it so I'm a happy parent.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: It is a very good place to take your kids and have a good time. The zoo is not that big but it does have many animals. I would only suggest for them to be more careful about the maintenance of the place. But overall I really liked it and we had a good time.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The zoo is great, employees are friendly and helpful. The property is very clean and the food at the bistro was great! Looking forward to when they bring back elephants and butterflies!! Reptile building was fascinating. Loved seeing the Bald Eagles too!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We had a great time! We went on a beautiful day, at around noon, so it was incredibly crowded and the parking was busy, even in January. The entry line was very long, but the zoo was worth it! There were some great exhibits, and we enjoyed the train, as well!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: I Love the Zoo and the Staff are Very Friendly. Animals enclosures are kinda small but they working hard to renovate and expand many of the habitats and you can tell that the Staff cares for the animals. Prices on things are a little high but it is for a good cause so no complaints as it does cost a lot to care for animals. I am excited for the new gorilla exhibit.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We had a great day here! I was really impressed with all the enrichment the animals were provided that kept them active and in view of visitors. My kids were more than happy all day and loved everything.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: The zoo train does NOT take you through the zoo so be aware of that prior to ticket purchase. Also the train seating is very cramped. Otherwise a fun place. The zoo parking garage is a significant walk from the entrance. Highly recommend parking across the street in the train depot area. There is a Starbucks and bathrooms in the depot area. They have scooters available for rental but get there early!
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: We had such a great day today at the zoo. The animals were mostly visible. It is a pretty big zoo with lots to see. The food is expensive as you would expect but I have to say it was well worth the cost. It was delicious!! We will definitely be going back.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: First time in this zoo and it is awesome!! We had a blast. Animals are healthy and look well,people were nice and friendly. The price per entrance is also good and fair. Highly recommend the zoo for the whole family. Be prepared to walk alot though, stay hydrated peeps.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text:
The San Antonio zoo has come so far in the ten years I've been here! I especially appreciate the upgrades to the rhino exhibit. Most of the exhibits are middle of the road as far as quality and some are better than others.

The staff is very friendly and will chat with the kids if they have questions. The prices are good and there are a lot of experiences here you can pay just a little extra for that are worth doing, in my opinion.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: My family had the best day ever. Even with quite a bit of people the day went well. The only exhibit that was full was the hippos. We got to see all the animals they were all out. It was just like when my kids were little. My kids are older but it was still a great place to spend the day with the family and still enjoy it.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: I love the zoo and hadn't been in quite a while. Tonight we enjoyed Zoo Lights. Most of the animal exhibits were closed but the park is beautifully lit and we're planning a daytime visit so we can see the new enclosures and animals.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: I really enjoyed visiting this zoo. There are so many uniquely different animals. The  animal exhibits were well taken care. The animals were very active. There were many different activities for children.  Patrons could feed various animals for a fee.  The parking lot is smaller and finding a parking spot can be difficult.  Overall, I would highly suggest taking your family.
title: San Antonio Zoo

text: Great local business, excellent prices, makes it easier to come here often and hit some balls.
title: The Practice Golf Center

text: Went to Westchester for lunch today.  I had the best french dip sandwich of my life.  The beef was a brisket that was absolutely stunning in terms of flavor and tenderness.
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text: I‚Äôll get right to it, order a bottle of wine when you go to Westchester, most wines by the glass starts at 20.00. My husband had the Wagyu steak and I ordered the salmon my whole dish was too salty, the wagyu was tough, 79.00 tough. Vegetable overcooked. Just because you slap high prices on a menu does not make it affluent or good. The server checked on us 11 times, she was such a sweet and pretty young lady, however,  needs to learn the art of being a server. #dissapointed Oh! The ice cream from Clementines was a delight! For those prices you should offer a Sommelier and better wine selection. The whole production of fine dining is to educate the diner and their experience should make them feel welcomed at your establishment. The hostess was not friendly at all. The decor dark and dreary. Those days of dark and dreary restaurants are outdated.
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text: I normally don't leave reviews but one of the best dining experiences I've had in a good while and I felt compelled. All I can say is that the food was excellent and while the prices were up there, the quality food and preparation was exactly what you would expect for a premium dining experience and are on par with their prices. Here's a picture of the Sea Bass. Perfectly cooked with an amazing presentation. Skin was crispy with the fish itself, succulent and juicy. Kudos to the Chef. Please continue to do what you are doing, I will definitely be back.
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text:
The newest Chesterfield staple!! Great vibe from the moment you walk in. We sat at the bar, had some delicious craft drinks and lunch! Bartender couldn't have been sweeter and food was nothing short of delicious! Familiar with Chef Matt's work and he's really brought his best stuff to the menu here. 10/10

pictured: duck fat truffle fries (omg!!), french dip, + smash burger
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text: Great atmosphere, excellent customer service and amazing food‚Ä¶from the salads to the sandwiches, burgers & fries you can‚Äôt go wrong! Can‚Äôt sit to come back for dinner and drinks!
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text:
Everything from start to finish was fantastic! The onion soup was flavorful and did not need the Gruy√®re cheese, but the cheese made it better. Perfect for a cold winter night! The steak tartare was also flavored well with peppers and the perfect ratio to the sauce. The chips made it even better. The duck breast matched well with the parsnip pur√©e and was cooked to a perfect medium rare. The flavor profile had a gamier edge. The portion sizes were generous, and there were extra duck pieces mixed in with the vegetables. The cocktails were a delight: my old fashioned had a clear, custom cut ice cube that added to the aesthetic charm. The drink tasted better over time as the ice melted.

One of the owners, John, was so friendly; he came to check on our table to see how we were doing. I had a wonderful experience and will definitely come back!
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text: This place is super cute. Drinks were great and dessert was amazing. Marietta was the best bartender!! Awesome drinks and margaritas. We will be back!
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text: Great place. Food was amazing.  Atmosphere was great.  Staff and owners were very welcoming and made it a great night out.  Highly recommended.   We really needed a place like this in the valley.   We will be back.
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text: We had a wonderful experience at Westchester for lunch! The decor is beautiful and the ‚Äúvibe‚Äù inside is welcoming and cozy but also hip. I ordered the grilled chicken mezze salad and it was beautiful, but also delicious. The duck fat truffle fries were also phenomenal. We brought our kids (7 and 4) so Chef Matt made them a grilled cheese (he also added delicious crispy fries) and amazing buttered noodles. He even sent our server, Olivia, out to double check that multi grain bread was ok for the grilled cheese. Olivia was a wonderful server as well and knew everything about the menu, and the owner was there at the host stand greeting people as they came in. There was a big table of women having a fun lunch and the bar was full of groups of men hanging out as well. I am born and raised in Chesterfield and it‚Äôs totally unique and awesome for the area. I highly recommend it and we will be back very soon! Probably for dinner‚Ä¶without the kids üòÇ ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text: Five Star fine dining. Exceptional service. Expensive but worth the Date night ambience.
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text: Lobster and smoked shrimp appetizer! It made my palate so happy!! Amazing!! Drinks superb and service fantastic!
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text:
My husband and I ate here on a weekend for dinner. You definitely need to make a reservation. Even during the week they are busy. If you are lucky you can try to get a seat at the bar.

Their cocktail list is excellent! Their drinks are priced similarly to Ruth Chris's $15+. The use quality fresh ingredients. I enjoyed their French 75.

I ordered the Waygu burger cooked medium rare with truffle fries which are fantastic. They sell it during their happy hour as well. We will be returning! Loved it!
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text:
I am torn.. . The food and drinks were 5 star. Service was slow, not just for us but noticeably for everyone around us. Maybe it is because they recently opened but the service didn't seem to have a solid flow.

I want to say the bar needs an additional person but with so few tables two should suffice. It is a shame they dont knock the wall down and expand the kitchen and dining room.

A few labeling mistakes on the menu. Orin swift hasnt made saldo in over a decade but the 2020 orin swift saldo is on the menu.
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text: Great meal at busy place.  The halibut is outstanding and was the star.  Smoked shrimp, steak tartar, mussels, and duck fat fries were very good.  Expect a very loud dining experience with excellent service and food
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text: Delicious! Sit at the bar, you won't be disappointed.
title: Westchester Restaurant and Bar

text: We stopped at this establishment around 7 and the door was unlocked and we walked in. After we were all inside 2 voices yelled out we are closed. This is very unfortunate as this was the first time we was visiting this place and had to take our party of over 7 people to a different place.
title: Pizza Ranch

text: Came to Pizza Ranch with some other Real Estate agents and my experience was great. I was able to pay for the buffet with no wait time. The food was delicious and our server was always available to take our plates or offer us what ever we need. Thank you Pizza Ranch in Sergeant Bluff!!!
title: Pizza Ranch

text: It was early and we were the only ones in the dinning room for a good while before anyone else showed up. We had a pizza made which was sooo good. The salad bar is always delicious. We did run into some dried out chicken, which is usually juicey, but a little gravy helped bring it back. The server never prebussed and we had a stack of plates and trash sitting on oir table thru out our visit. Other then that, we LOVE Pizza Ranch and will continue stopping in when we see them!
title: Pizza Ranch

text: Such great staff. Good food. My favorite part was the little kiddie door though so adorable.
title: Pizza Ranch

text:
This is how $50 worth of pizza is delivered.

Update: after speaking with the manager, Paul, he was apologetic and applied a credit to our next order.
title: Pizza Ranch

text: Howdy Pardner! Looking for good food at an even better price? You must go to Pizza Ranch! Pizza Ranch is not a thing on the west coast so once it was discovered what they have to offer and the price we skedaddled on over for some fresh salad, variety of pizza, desert pizza and ice cream, chicken, mac and cheese, veggies and "pop". Take as many trips as you'd like, the only one to judge may be the side eyeing horse but horses just be like that sometimes.  Bonus Tip: The Italian dressing is available in a pouch at the end of the salad bar.
title: Pizza Ranch

text: Best chicken around. Hands down. A wide variety of pizzas specialized to your liking.(dessert pizzas too) Also and amazing salad bar. Dine in, buffet, pickup, and delivery all available for orders. Try the new specialties for fall!!! This includes pretzel crust pizza, pumpkin pie cactus bread, and an oriental salad. All the employees are helpful and kind. I hope you have a LEGENDARY experience at Pizza Ranch in Sergeant Bluff.
title: Pizza Ranch

text: Huge hotel, centrally located to everything we wanted to do on River Street. Near tons of things to see and do. Love the digital check in and out. Friendly and helpful staff. Bed was very uncomfortable. ADA rooms a bit far from elevator. Nice breakfast buffet. Parking (valet) expensive. Overall a great place to stay.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: So disappointed with my stay here and very disappointed with how our issues were handled. Came here with friends and booked 2 rooms next to each other. Both our rooms were filthy. Mine had a few dead roaches by the bed/tv, some random dirty boxers, and a giant layer of dirt all through the carpet. When we complained they did not take any action for a whole day. They offered us either a cleaning or two (much worse) rooms that weren't even together. The manager didn't even reach out to me until after we checked out. Given the price point, absolutely NOT worth the stay. 24 hr gym is nice though
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: What a beautiful lobby! The staff continued to showcase that Savannah charm and equally matched hospitality. The room was clean, spacious, and ready when we arrived. You can't ask for much more being in the heart of the historic district.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: The Bar and Valet get 5 star they were amazing.  The rooms are nice large and updated..  This cleanliness of rooms n bathrooms could use attention. For Example dust on furniture n cabinets n bathrooms..  Dirty grout n shower.. Bathrooms mirror weren't clean previously guests..  One of my comforter sheets had been bleach to death and stain was still there .. Throw it Away!!  This rooms aren't cheap l expected more!!  I only gave a 4 Star do the valet and the bar staff!!!
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Great location leads the list of reasons to stay here. The hotel is beautifully done inside with fantastic common areas. There are great views to be had from both city view rooms as well as river view.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: The hotel was in a great location on the river. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. Housekeeping could have been better, the curtains were stained, the carpet could have been vacuumed better and the bathroom was very dusty.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: We went to savannah for a weekend trip and we booked Hyatt regency for the trip. The check-in process was easy and loved the staff they have. They were friendly and ready to help the guests. The room we booked was the king room with a city view. The room was neat and clean and had all the essentials required for the trip. The hotel has a gym, pool, bar where different types of drinks are provided, they also have a small restaurant where one can get breakfast, lunch and dinner. The Hyatt regency is an amazing hotel and we loved our stay.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
Spent 3 nights here. It was a decent stay but due to the Covid restrictions we really couldn't take advantage of what the hotel offered. No room service which was disappointing.

Rooms were good sized, beds were comfortable although the pillows left a lot to be desired. Good water pressure in the shower but the bathroom products were a little boring. Good WiFi strength in the room.

The real value in this hotel is the location. It's right in the middle of all the action and walking distance to everything a person would need in Savannah.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: We stayed here for 4 full days (12/18/21-12/21/21 and everything was so clean and beautiful in our room 322! During the evening we had a very nice view of the river and lights! In the morning across the river is not beautiful but not bad either. I actually loved the mornings drinking my coffee and watching the cargo ships come and go and other various boats.  The pool was nice, my son loved it. There was a problem with our refrigerator as it wouldn't stay colder than 40 degrees so we had to throw out our sandwiches.  The hotel comped one breakfast for us each so that was very nice.  Later I figured out that if you put ice in the ice bag and tie it, then place it into a laundry bag and place that inside the refrigerator- plus keep the cabinet door open to let heat escape- it kept the refrigerator at 35. We would put our leftovers ontop of the ice and it worked. Maybe if they take the cabinet door off that should allow the refrigerator sensor to adequately adjust ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è. But other than the refrigerator everything else was excellent.  Service, very friendly! I will stay here again.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Bathroom was dirty, moldy -- even the shower curtain was stained.  Bed was comfortable and other furnishing appeared well maintained.  Only provided decaf coffee pods in room.  Room service unavailable during "lunch" hours. Elevators were slow.  On one trip, door would not close.Just not the standard hotel experience one would expect from Hyatt Regency. Offered an upgrade to City View for extra $15 a night.  View was overlooking hotel courtyard
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: The staff at the Hyatt Regency Savannah was exceptional and went above and beyond to accommodate us. Everyone from the bellman and valets to the ladies (Sierra & Tiffani) at the front desk to Housekeeping (Digna) to the staff at the Moss & Oak especially Tena, Tuana, the kitchen cooks (breakfast buffet is delicious) and bartenders were kind, courteous and dedicated to ensuring that we had an outstanding experience. We are looking forward to staying at this Hyatt again soon.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: We lived two nights here. The experience are extremely bad. We got the room at the third floor. Facing the lobby side. There are very noisy in the lobby until 12:00pm in the night. And I fell asleep around 12:30am. Wake up because of the fire alarm around 2:00am in these two nights. Don't live here if you want to have a good sleep.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: My son took me on a trip to Savannah for my birthday. I can't begin to even explain how impressed I was with Hyatt Regency Savannah. When you pull up...valet and busboy. Check-in was seamless. The Christmas decor was gorgeous! Not tacky...very tasteful. The gym is the best gym I've seen in a hotel. The indoor heated pool was huge, and very clean. We had it to ourselves for nearly two hours. The room was immaculate! I e worked in the hotel industry...the housekeepers there don't skip any steps. I appreciate that. Within walking distance (some right across the street) were souvenir shops, breweries, pubs, restaurants... everything you need! Our view was a gorgeous clock tower on city hall. Sounds odd...but it was really beautiful. When we go back, we will be staying at Hyatt again. Well worth the price!
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: The view and location are amazing. The bar and valet staff were great. The room was dirty, the elevators were broken or slow and the front desk staff was rude at checkout. I have never had to carry my luggage down 4 flights of stairs in my life. We enjoyed watching the container ships go by, though.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Clean rooms, pleasant staff, great views of the river, bridge and river front shops from the Hyatt.  This is our "go to" place any time we are in Savannah.  It is very convenient to walk from the Hyatt to many tourist attractions in the area.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: The hotel is definitely at a great location but the service really made us mad. We changed room twice at midnight due to the malfunctioning heater (we had engineers check it but they cannot fix it). The front desk was super cold, never said sorry, didn't want to talk to you. Really no professionalism. Not recommended.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
The view to the city is really nice. The hotel is really beautiful inside. I loved the decoration. The gym is really good equipped and the pool is old but still nice. My main issue is the cleaning I was trying to dry my hair with the hair dryer and it's the most disgusting thing that I had ever seen in my life. I'm adding a picture I'm marking in a circle the scratch to the dirt that I did with my nail just to see the amount of ( i don't want to know what is it ).
I'm on room 652 if someone from the hotel wants to take a look to it.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: We were in town for a leisure trip with the parents. We were given a corner room on the terrace floor that had views of the city on one side and the water on the other. Very spacious, clean and well appointed. Loved the walkability to everything in the river street and historic Square district. Great amenities. Parking was a bit pricey, but I preferred covered and secure valet as opposed to parking randomly on the street. Highly recommend the hotel.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Great hotel. Friendly staff. Very clean. The rooms were quiet, (except when the guy decided to play his trumpet on the riverwalk. You could hear it on the six floor,  but running the fan helped to drown him out.) We paid for a river view, and it was worth every penny! Moon River was inspired here! Would definitely recommend. (View from our hotel room.)
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Property is gorgeous! The lobby - Wow factor. On-site restaurant is good and has an outdoor patio with a stunning view of the river. We stayed on the 4th floor because the rooms have a private access to the "garden terrace" (also with a stunning view facing the other view of the river). We had an issue on the 1st night of our stay. There was damage to the room (spring break). Manager Chloe went above and beyond to take care of the issue. When in Savannah, we will stay here again for sure!
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
Great location right on the river.
We enjoyed the view from the public sitting room.
They offered us a free pack and play for our small travel companion and it came with some travel size goodies which I thought was a nice gesture (even though baby powder is a no go).
The room was modern, clean, and good overall.
The gym was great and the pool was good for a little swim (it‚Äôs on the smaller side).
Staff at check in was friendly.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Great view of the river walk.  Room and furniture were comfortable.  I don't understand why but the standard room service did not happen. Granted, the front desk did tell me about it at check in. But I don't feel like it should be necessary for me to call down for fresh towels
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
Thin Walls - We paid a decent price for our room on the top floor with Riverview. Not only did we hear the couple from next door enjoying themselves, but we felt the all the "rocking" in our bed as their movements transferred to us through the wall. The shared door probably didn't help the noise, but I've never felt bed movements through a wall before.

It was pretty disgusting. I called to request a transfer and was put on hold for ~10 minutes until the call dropped. I called again and was told that every room was taken. They offered for security to come and knock on their door but I declined. All things considered, our neighbors weren't being terribly loud or obnoxious. We just heard (and felt) all the "commotion". I don't necessarily blame our neighbors for cheap walls. Plus, a visit from security might encourage more noise/motion as retaliation.

I've stayed in several hotels and never made a google review. Wish I hadn't stayed in this one. I attached a photo to corroborate that I actually stayed on the top floor.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: The bed was firm and the bathroom was dirty. Not worth it. I‚Äôve stayed at motels that were cleaner. The hotel was so loud.  The stairwell doors slam shut and vibrate the floor. Stay at the quality inn or  anywhere else near by and you‚Äôll have a better experience for cheaper.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text: Great location on the river near lots of restaurants. Easy walk to many historical sites. Rooms are clean and modern/updated. I had a river view which was nice- I saw many cargo container ships go by which was cool.
title: Hyatt Regency Savannah

text:
Excellent hotel option in Lancaster. Indeed a resort. Two pools indoor and outdoor, restaurant, bars and many sports oriented areas.

Rooms are comfortable and big. Good size tv and bathroom has shower tub.

Right next to a gas station for convenience store that is open 24hrs and which I found very handy.

Plenty parking and overall very well kept with a great location in Eden.

Staff is cordial helpful and professional.  üëçüôå‚úî
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay! Staff was fantastic and dinner was delightful! The rooms are clean and comfortable, you won't want to leave! Will definitely be back for fun as this trip as for business.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: The Eden never disappoints. Rooms are always clean and offer the right amount of space. The staff is nice and very helpful. The service desk is very quick to respond and are very helpful. It is worth every penny. It is great for adult only time as well as lots of things to do with kids and family.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: I love this place! My kids love this place!  It's so family friendly. As a single mom who takes her kids on vacation every year, this place was the easiest location yet for me to actually relax on our vacation.  I can't wait to go back next year ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text:
We checked in today and so far this place has exceeded our expectations. Staff has been incredibly friendly and helpful. We checked into on of the suites snd recived a text from. The concierges to help us with anything we needed. We texted them a few times to get some information and they were very prompt, helpful and really nice. The room is wonderful, very clean  and modern. See pics. Were going to us the heated pool , hot tub and will try the on site restaurant, will update our review post.
Update, we did goto the indoor pool and it was enchanting. Indoor heated pool was great. You get cards for towel service when you check in and get a fresh towel when you arrive to the pool. The jacuzzi was corded off due to maintenance. While that was dissapointing for our evening I greatly appreciated thier concern for guests safety.
We also had dinner at the restaurant and that was incredible. They have this seafood dish with a tomato broth that was divine. Everyone in our party raved about thier food.
Breakfast, we would advise to skip the buffet, it was not up to the rest of the standards. Pastries were days old, the hot fares were mediocre.  The fruit was nice but that was not worth the price. So I would suggest breakfast offsite and there close places to choose from.
Breakfast aside this place us great and we'll worth the price, we loved our stay.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: Awesome place!! Rooms large and comfortable. Beds were nice.  Indoor pool area was great!! Restaurants were nice as well.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: Absolutely loved our experience! Our daughter had requested a night at a hotel with a swimming pool for her birthday. We had made mention of this to staff when booking and asked for a ballon in the room as something special. Staff went above and beyond by including some snacks for her as well as a card in addition to the ballon. Needless to say our 4 yr old freaked out when she saw it. Thank you so much to the staff that made our night special for our girl! We got a poolside room and so we were able to make the most of our time swimming. Our room was spacious and clean. We look forward to staying here again.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text:
Staff goes above and beyond.
Indoor pool is amazing.
Very kid friendly.
On site restaurant staff is friendly and accommodating.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: Exceptional!!  Great place for the whole family.. clean and friendly staff. Will definitely reccomend it when visiting Lancaster area
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: This was our first weekend away from our 5 children in over 2 years and the Eden Resort and Suites did not disappoint. From the welcoming atmosphere, cleanliness, and phenomenal staff we will definitely make this our first choice for another staycation. The staff was accommodating and courteous.  While walking down the hall to my brother and sister-in-law's room carrying her birthday gifts a staff member in front of us turned around and asked if we needed assistance carrying anything.  The room was spacious and comfortable and we loved the adults-only floor. We all actually decided to not go out and do an activity but stayed in the room and had beverages and played cards till after 2 AM. A big plus is where our room was and the "J" entrance we were a mere 100 steps to the Sheetz :) The only complaint we have is with the pool. We have no problem and understand the booking of time slots to ensure everyone's safety I wish it was open later for adults. Most places we have visited only allow adults after 10 PM.  It was kind of hard to enjoy the hot tub. Otherwise, I really have no complaints at all. We easily made reservations for Arther's Terrace and the food was delicious.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: Very nice place to stay. We stayed on s suite which was very nice. The entire place was clean and nicely decorated.  There are a couple of places to eat on site as well as on the area.  Close to Hershey , about 20 minutes away.  They also have parties and from what we could see they spend allot of time to make sure the party is great. All of the staff we encountered were friendly and very helpful.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: Came here for a conference years ago and visited recently for a 2 night getaway. Had a wonderful relaxing time. Great location to many places in the Lancaster & Lititz, PA area. Perfect to have a conference, family reunion, family vacation and or a getaway with your spouse.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text:
Had a group stay here. Very comfortable and clean rooms. Used the laundry facilities here and they were reasonably priced at $1.50 per washer & $1.50 for 45 minutes of dryer ( add 25 cents for 15 minutes extra time on dryer)

Bathroom was clean. This hotel gives extra supplies as well such as 2 qtips, a nail filer etc etc.

Room was spacious, clean and had its own printer for business folks

Bed was so comfortable and soft to the touch.

Overall, a great experience with this hotel
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: Great place to stay in Lancaster with your family.  This hotel has been around for a long time and yet it‚Äôs kept immaculate.  Very clean rooms and all common areas.  Kids and adults get to enjoy a fairly large indoor heated pool and jacuzzi.  The rooms are like everything in the hotel, pristine and orderly. Beds are very comfortable so much my wife and kids want to take the pillows home.  The hotel is just off the ramp when you come off the highway.   Great place to stay definitely recommend it.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text:
Fantastic rooms.
Fridge was broken, and was told they would send maintenance right up. Never came. Fridge was only slightly cool and was leaking on the floor.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text:
We stayed here over the Thanksgiving weekend to visit family.  We had a room right off the pool so our grandchildren could come visit and spend time swimming. It has a tropical atmosphere and a hot tub. The door to the pool is locked from the outside at night and there is an alarm that alerts you if someone opens the door from the room. This is great for safety for families with small children. The room we had was spacious with 2 queen beds. The room was clean.  I liked the vanity make up area outside the bathroom but the lighting should be more conducive to being able to see better. This hotel has a bar off the dining room and the dining room had certain hours of operation...which is ok as I like the option to eat in the dining room instead of going out.There was a convenience store which carried lots of goodies including great coffee from Lancaster County. I really like the classic charm throughout this whole resort and the  service of the staff was
superior throughout.  The only reason I did not give 5 stars is the comfort of the bed. We woke up each morning with backaches. Maybe mattresses should be upgraded ü§î. Otherwise a classic hotel which I enjoyed.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: Hosted our daughter‚Äôs wedding here and could not be happier! Our coordinator, Katie B, was amazing from start to finish. The Courtyard Ballroom provided a romantic atmosphere and every vendor recommended by Eden did a superb job! Food, bar service and banquet staff were top notch! Highly recommend

text:
Overall, we had a good stay. Came here with my sisters, mother, and nieces for a girls night out. The room was clean and comfortable but a bit dated. Staff were friendly and helpful during our stay.

The pool was heated, but it was still cold in my opinion. They ran out of towels when I had arrived to the pool so I had to wait until I was ready to leave and they had just restocked the towels. The playground was small, but nice. The basketball court was also nice. The table tennis could have been maintained better, the net was broken so was the 1 paddle that was at the table. While I was there the restaurant was closed for renovations. So were unable to get room service despite the front desk telling me the other restaurant was opened, but I was unable to get connected to that restaurant.

Other than the few minor hiccups, we enjoyed our stay, I do feel the resort was overpriced based on what was offered.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text: We came to Lancaster to enjoy the New Year. We stayed in the King Villas. The room itself was beautiful. The bathroom could have used some updating. Also the  kitchenware needed better cleaning, but nice nonetheless. The real issue with my stay and why I would never decide to visit again was the customer service and my personal property. I stayed overnight on New Year‚Äôs Eve. I woke up in the morning to find my white car parked in the lot COVERED with confetti. My car was the only one within that lot covered. I was understandably upset, and wanted to rectify the situation. I called the front desk and explained the issue. I understand it was not the hotel, but rather other guests and my personal property is not the responsibility of the resort. Where is the accountability for the guests they house? They offered minimal help or care. The most they could offer to assist was windex and paper towels or filing a police report. They had no usable hose on the property where I could have rinsed off my car. They offered no kind of compensation towards a car wash, even $5.00 would have gone a long way. The confetti had to later be POWER-WASHED from my car. Again, I understand it wasn‚Äôt the resort directly , but I would not trust my car on this property again, personally.
title: Eden Resort & Suites

text:
This place doesn‚Äôt look like much when you pull up, but once inside you can tell that they take pride in this hotel.
Everything in the lobby was very clean, neat and orderly. It looked like this place had been remodeled recently.
The breakfast and sitting area are located right off of the main entrance across from the lobby.
It too was very clean and neat.
I stopped here for one night on my return trip home from Florida.
I always choose a Best Western because the rooms are very clean, they give you complimentary toiletries, blow dryer, iron and ironing board, a coffee pot and free coffee in your room. You also get a refrigerator and microwave in your room and free WiFi.
I always try to get a king size bedroom. The beds are super comfortable, and I‚Äôm able to get a good nights sleep.
With my room came with a complimentary breakfast. This is standard with most Best Westerns.
This Smithville Best Western has an indoor pool which is permanently closed and a gym. I did not use them.
For breakfast they serve scrambled eggs, ham or bacon, grits, homemade waffles, that you make yourself. Cold cereal, oatmeal, fresh fruit, yogurt, biscuits and sausage gravy, bagels, toast, muffins, pastries, coffee, tea, juices, or milk. You can have as much as you want. The breakfast is constantly replenished by a sweet older lady.
Checkin was very easy. The front desk staff was extremely nice, and made some recommendations when we asked. They have a free parking lot.
This hotel is located off I-95, this low-key hotel is an 8-minute walk from shopping at Carolina Premium Outlets and 2 miles from the Ava Gardner Museum. The prices were reasonable for this hotel.
I would definitely stay here again.
title: Best Western Smithfield Inn

text: Another 5 star Best Western.  Clean,  helpful front desk. Nice breakfast

I stayed two nights, and found myself having to go to the restaurants in the casino for more to drink than the two complimentary mini bottles of water they give you, and one bottle of ginger ale was 5 dollars. I guess i should‚Äôve expected nothing less, but the food and restaurants all seemed the same. The food they offer at luckies you can find at orchid kitchen which is also the envivo restaurant in one. I expected since the restaurants are listed as separate entities that they would be separate but its not. I was looking forward to staying here but I am extremely disappointed. Imagine cutting into a beautiful extravagant looking cake just to find out its made out of rice krispie treats. That‚Äôs exactly what staying here was like, i‚Äôve stayed at cleaner hotels that were cheaper than this. Even the complimentary toiletries were dirty looking. text:
The appearance of this hotel is great but I hope you don‚Äôt have to call the front desk. You have to call for any towels, to have your room clean, etc‚Ä¶.. the wait times to call are greater than 5 minutes. The room with the lights and suites above was very good for the conference, thermostat just right, screens beside the stage large but speakers hang in front of them. Conference food was absolutely lacking any taste or creativity. Vegetarian option was pasta with a can of warmed tomato sauce dumped on top.
Hotel staff was very nice. The bathrooms were staffed with people for the conference area and were kept exceptionally clean‚Ä¶ I mean SPOTLESS! Overall, it‚Äôs an OK hotel but needed more staff. We were there for 6 days and wasn‚Äôt able to get a cart for the luggage when we arrived or left.
The location of the hotel seems good considering the proximity to BWI airport. You have to walk through the Casino to get to more food and the choices are slim. Vegetarian options were a negative. Some of the casino staff wouldn‚Äôt let you bring outside food back through the casino. You go up 3 floors, through the garage, and back down on the other side. When I tell you that this is dumb, it is an understatement!
title: Live! Casino & Hotel Maryland

text: This review is about the hotel itself. Big pluses it's location (less than 40 minutes drive from DC) and direct connection to the casino and just 3 minutes walk to the center of the shopping mall. The room decor is pretty nice, they are clean and have ample of amenities (supplemental coffee, towels and so on). The staff is attentive (some reviews mentioned that staff were rude - nothing like that here). Check in and check out was a breeze. So, why 4 stars? I get used to having minibar - here a fridge but no drinks. Also a little bit late check in time - past 3PM. Overall it was a darn good time. And finally couple technical details - hotel charges around $15 resort fee (worth it - the spa is nice) and it's $150 hold for accidental fee (some people counted it as "erroneous charge".

title: LA CREME

text:
You can consider LA CREME your go-to spot for small batch, organic artisan crepes. The Canela and Citron crepes are our favorites. Make sure to order them with strawberries.

The difference, as with most great restaurants, starts with using excellent ingredients. When we spoke to Kim, the owner of LA CREME, she explained that their toppings are either made in-house or sourced from high quality bakers and such is the whipped cream ‚Äî a delicious level of thickness with the right amount of sweet.

You can feel the attention to details in the decor. It‚Äôs down to earth with an elegant use of black and white with splashes of rose gold among the perfectly socially-distanced tables.

The staff is young, precise, and welcoming.

Overall a great experience that can rival those in Napa, where we‚Äôve been going for years.

One small change I would suggest is upgrading the coffee creamer. Pleased do away with the plastic containers. They just don‚Äôt fit within the ambiance LA CREME has created.
title: LA CREME

text:
This place is an absolute 10 out of 10. Amazing food and service.

The staff was friendly, the service was fantastic, and the food was *chefs kiss*. Saying it was amazing does not do the food justice. So flavorful and unique. I had lobster bisque soup, was incredible. Vanilla bean gelato: incredible. Then I got the crepe with spinach, cheeses, and chicken: so flavorful. And the prices were very reasonable for what amounts to a gourmet experience. I will absolutely visit next time in town. I might just make a special trip!

text:
I typically enjoy eating here. I ordered some takeout steak salads and I requested 2 modifications. One was to remove the fries from it, and the other was to add a hard boiled egg, I hadn‚Äôt realized that it would cost an extra $3 for the egg. I get inflation is a mess, but that seems a bit ridiculous for 1 egg, which I‚Äôm sure is bought in bulk from a restaurant supplier.

I‚Äôm just a tad annoyed with the restaurant and to top it off, they didn‚Äôt give me any dressing. So all around a disappointment for a nearly $30 salad.
title: Copperhead Grille

text:
My wife and I stopped here for lunch following a trip to Chriskindlemart.

We were quickly greeted by the hostess and or waitress Kim came over to us to take our order relatively quickly. She greeted us with a smile in a very friendly manner.

We both ordered the strawberry lemonade which is a great thirst quencher. For appetizers,  we shared the crab dip and brown butter buffalo wings which were delicious.

For meals, my wife had the crab cakes with brussel sprouts and the bacon twice baked potato. She said the crab cakes were very good but said the brussel sprouts,  although extremely tasty and flavorful,  were not fully cooked and were somewhat hard. She also said the twice baked potato filling was very good, but the skin of the potato was very hard and overcooked.

I had the butter garlic strip steak medium well with the broccoli, potato wedges and the stuffed potato.

The steak was served already sliced, and although not a huge problem, not something that I prefer. It was slightly over cooked. To me, medium well it's slightly pink in the center (serving temp around 160*) but it was cooked well done. Also, the menu says roasted garlic and herb butter. I didn't sense any butter on it and it came with quartered garlic on top. The wedges were very tasty and seasoned nicely as was the stuffed potato.

For dessert we had the funnel cake fried Oreo's which was delicious!

The presentation of all the food was exceptional. The cleanliness of the restaurant was superb. There wasn't a time when we didn't see someone cleaning.

Lastly, the food was not very expensive for the portions.

Service - 10
Cleanliness - 10
Speed - 9
Quality - 8
Value - 10

Overall dining experience - 9.4
title: Copperhead Grille

text:
Small casino compared to other ones I‚Äôve been to (Mohegan Sun and Foxwoods). We stayed for a night in the Center Suite as a mini getaway from home.

They allowed us to check-in early, which was nice, especially since my husband wanted to take my toddler to the pool. Toddler had fun in the pool, but besides that there wasn‚Äôt much to do for the little one.
Ate dinner at one of the restaurants on the casino floor and then spent rest of the evening in the room watching tv (not much option). Ordered room service for breakfast the next day before we went home. There was nothing special about it and coffee had a horrible cleaning supply taste to it. Pretty expensive especially since 18% gratuity was included in the room service bill

For those planning to visit with underaged kids, you will need to be escorted at all times in the casino area even if you are just heading to the restaurant inside.

I would probably come again once more just so my toddler could use the pool and I also heard good things about the spa
title: Mount Airy Casino Resort

We spent a whole week in the resort, and took full advantage of everything they have to offer. The gift shop isn't much, but it does have toiletries for purchase if you forget something back home.
