text: Casino, very clean relaxing kind of place. Wife and I went up for an evening of fun. People very helpful and friendly. If you choose to spend the night, pre arrange before you go.
title: Mount Airy Casino Resort

text: Absolutely recommend this resort! Beautiful decor and VERY friendly staff. Our room, a suite, was appropriately sized and fun to be in, also was able to check in 1.5 hours early so that was also very sweet to the price deal. The pool i recommend going early if enjoying adults only type of time, by 2-3pm lots of kiddos around. Bistecca was SUPER delicious and wait staff was very friendly and attentive. The live band playing last night 8/12 was jamming pretty well, i didnt stick around to give a full listen though. The cabanas were amazing to utilize, you also get to use the pool before/after checkout so thats a plus. Only gripes would be: unless you valet, theres no separate parking for the hotel, so you either walk thru the casino(which is probably designed on purpose) or walk around the outside, about a 5 min walk. Also, be prepared if going/leaving during peak times as your mixed in with regular casino goers so you may end up in the back of the lot. Secondly, theres not a lot of communication; in terms of staff to staff and promoting. Know before you go, the ONLY place to ACTUALLY get breakfast is Fieri's kitchen (other pption is a starbucks) unless you pay attention to the changing directory sign, you have no indication thats it for breakfast. Thirdly, the buffet opens an hour AFTER checkout, again, breakfast is the cheapest meal to execute so dropping the ball there too.
title: Mount Airy Casino Resort

text: Our family has been renting boats from Yankee for 15+ years and this year did not disappoint.  Their boats are always in great shape and their customer service is unmatched. text: We rented a boat last weekend from Yankee. The staff was very friendly, and the rates were good! Great boats, good location, and nice clean bathrooms! Will definitely be coming back.
title: Yankee Marina and Boat Rentals

text: I‚Äôve been renting from Yankee for more than a decade and I don‚Äôt know which is better - the quality of the boats or the service.  Simply put, the owners are great people and the crew they hire is the best. They are all personable, kind, and hard working. The boats they rent are perfect for all your basic needs on Lake George - tubing, water skiing, fishing, picnicking on an island in the Narrows,  or just moored up at Sandy Bay.  They are well maintained and clean.  I highly recommend choosing Yankee over any other marina.
title: Yankee Marina and Boat Rentals

text: good location and price
title: Yankee Marina and Boat Rentals

text:
After a few years of renting boats from a local competitor that always had issues (non existent bimini, broken gas gauge, engine that was leaking gas, dirty and old boats, etc), i decided to try a new rental place.

I rented the 18 foot 150hp Bowrider.  There were no massive issues like before.  The boat was clean, fast, and fun.  The stereo didn't work but we had a wireless water proof speaker for this anyways.  We rented for 3 days and came back once for a fuel up in between.

The only downside was that we hit an underwater log in the middle of the lake.  They showed me the damage to the skeg and as I had taken a pic of the prop/skeg before the rental, it was undeniable.  Got hit with a $350 charge for repair, but I can't blame Yankee as this is part of the risk of boating.

I will be renting from Yankee from now on.
title: Yankee Marina and Boat Rentals

text: Great family fun! From boating to tubing! Beautiful  lake  and scenery!
title: Yankee Marina and Boat Rentals

text: Perfect day on Lake George! Worry-free booking, check-in, and return process. Very professional and welcoming staff. Will definitely recommend and come back in the future.

text: Was there over Valentine's weekend. Snowed aprox 2ft. The snow was expected, the amount not so much. The staff were busy each day with a tractor, snow blower and shovel keeping it as clear as possible. Obviously it was impossible to take advantage of much of the amenities like the pool, playground etc. The gift shop was nice and had some items we purchased. Ate one meal from the bar/cafe as take out due to covid restrictions and outside seating was a bit cold, although they did have several heaters out. The cabin, 5B was clean, warm and romantic. On Valentine's Day a staff member brought a rose and a card to our room. Nice touch folks! I will recommend the Lone Fir to friends. Thank you for working so hard to make our experience a great one under such trying times, restrictions, and conditions all around.
title: Lone Fir Resort

text: Loved the huckbery icecrem and the cookies backed in the oven with icecrem on top was delicious
title: Lone Fir Resort

text: You're just not going to find better food and service. If you're ever up there, it's worth the stop. If ever you're wanting to go for a drive/ride, this is a great destination

text: We were exhausted and feeling cold coming from mount saint Helen when we found this place almost in middle of nowhere. We were amazed with the customer service and cozy atmosphere here. I ordered the mushroom burger for the first time I had better beef than Texas beef. We were greeted by the waitress, the owner, the manager and one more person. Customer service was beyond exceptional here. My next trip to Washington state I plan to book couple nights at their hotel.

text: This is a cozy little spot right at the base of the mountain. It has a restaurant/bar with good food and awesome staff! There's little fire pits and picnic tables at each cabin. They also have WiFi where there is zero service. Would highly recommend.

text: Enjoyed our stay. Nice large grassy RV sites. Washrooms ok - coin showers, light on timer.  Great wifi. Clubhouse (bring coins) has pool table, ping-pong, arcade games. Pool, but not heated. Restaurant on site. Tenting areas as well as cabins. Close to Mt St Helens parks. Walking distance to Cougar Park Rec site for swimming, boating.
title: Lone Fir Resort

text: We pulled off a wedding. Staff was awesome and the sites were accessible and big. Food was great and if all the amenities were open it would have been even better but no fault on them.

text:
Did not stay here as a guest, but came for a conference hosted here. Indoor/outdoor pool looked awesome (didn't get to swim), did have a few drinks at the poolside bar, and there's easy direct access to the beach!
Can't speak to the guest rooms or accommodations for guests, but I would certainly consider coming here if ever on vacation in the area!

text:

Thank You!

text:
At this resort for a work conference. Beautiful spot right on the beach. Indoor/outdoor pool, hot tubs, gym, restaurants on site. Rooms are clean & updated. Only 1 of the restaurants is open during lunch hours which was kind of a bummer but plenty of walkable options nearby. Direct access to the beach.
Highly recommend Brooke at the poolside bar & Melvin at Latitude restaurant! Fantastic service.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Absolutely beautiful resort! The rooms are absolutely beautiful, spacious and top notch! The shower is absolutely unbelievable! There is beach access and lounge chairs for you to use and enjoy! The pool is very nice and very pretty at night. Inside they have two jacuzzis and a portion of the pool indoors as well. There is an amazing gym for those that want that. The restaurants are all great too. Highly recommend!
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: Had a great stay here. The serenity of being on the beach is amazing. I loved waking up to hear the waves crashing in the ocean. The resort lived up to my expectations. Comfy room and great service. Beds and pillows where nice and soft. The rooms are pretty typical of what you would find in common hotels. Nothing to spectacular. The beach access from the resort was very convenient. The architecture of the pool is very aesthetically pleasing. All my worries went away while I was there.

text: I was here for the ACSW conference. The the resort is awesome. The rooms and onsite restaurants are great. I really do not need to leave the property for anything. I will definitely be returning.

text: Love this property and it has everything you need.  Great spot on the beach.  Close to all the best eating spots.  Don‚Äôt want to go off property for breakfast, lunch, or dinner? Some views are better than others but you can always see the beach.  The outside and inside pool are nice.  Plenty of lounge chairs.  Reserve your beach chair early and for your entire stay, that‚Äôs how you save money.  Rooms were cleaned daily, an all around excellent experience.

text: We went in December for a getaway before Christmas and it was perfection! The hotel is clean and modern, we asked for a corner room with beach view and it did not disappoint! The bed was very comfortable. The lobby area was all brand new and very nice. The bartenders were all great. Resort is located right on the beach, can‚Äôt beat that. text: OMG, all I say is wow. This is my 4 or 5th visit to this wonderful hotel, my first visit post pandemic and I thought I was in a different hotel. text: Great place to stay. Beautiful grounds right on the beach. Staff is attentive. Rooms are clean and updated with nice amenities. The pool is fantastic.  Food and drinks are excellent but pricey. text:
The hotel phone and online reservation staff, parking lot, and conference staff are disconnected and disjointed.

I WOULD NOT recommend this place for a conference just based on trying to reserve a room and set up for conferences.

The front desk folks are nice and polite.

I COULD NOT stay at the hotel because they would answer the phone and transferred me to a number that would just disconnect you and emails go unanswered or vague responses with no answers to your questions.

They seem to be focused on valet services and conference fees but making vendors at conferences jump through hoops. You must leave keys with the valet to unload and you can't use the side doors because it bypasses the valet.

They respond with the ability to ignore your issues with short useless comments.
title: Perdido Beach Resort

text: I have visited Perdido Resort for Nine Years! It is simple an Excellent and Exceptional Service! They will make sure you had a great visit! The entire staff provide exceedingly service! I would love to mentioned each individually employee, but it would take long time. I never want to leave‚Ä¶after September 16, 2020, Hurricane Sally moved onshore in Gulf Shores, unfortunately the resort experienced some damages, but the Resort has been remodel‚Ä¶it is beautiful! The rooms have beautiful floors and decor! The lobby looks so exquisite and elegant! It was good to see the same staff, especially Lauren and the crew members. You can laid back, relax, listen to some music, drink at the bar, swim at the pool or get in the hot tub or you can stay all day at the beach! Enjoying the beautiful Atlantic Ocean. The location directly on the beach and 5miles to beautiful State Park. The entire resort and room were clean and well kept. The on-site restaurants and bars are wonderful with lots of food selections and price ranges. Want a snack or drink by the pool-right there. text: This was by far the best hotel experience we‚Äôve ever had! The outside didn‚Äôt impress much but once you walk it it was like a dream. It was about 55-60 degrees but the outdoor pool still felt nice because it‚Äôs heated. Inside has 2 hot tubs! text: This place is amazing! If you book, try to get a room on the 8th floor. It's very restricted and you must use your room key card to even get on that floor. text: Solid food at extremely reasonable prices.
title: Fazoli's

text: Very economical. This sampler I got had 4 different things on it using a big plate. For $3 more, you get a salad and drink. All said and done, about $12 for everything, and it was a ton of food. Service was great. Food was prepared quickly, very friendly people, and attentive to check up on you. Bread sticks (when dining in) are unlimited, and they come hot and fresh, buttered and seasoned with garlic. They are super soft and fluffy. Honestly, I rate their breadsticks above Olive Gardens. They are wonderful. Reasons why I‚Äôm not going with 5 stars, is nothing that this location has control over. It‚Äôs not a complaint of the individual location itself. First issue is, I felt the Alfredo sauce was very bland. I‚Äôve had stuff out of a jar at home that beats it. Secondly, the amount of sauce (all 3 pastas had the same issue) they put on is very little compared to the noodles you get. My feeling is, I can buy a pound of uncooked noodles for $1 at the store. After they absorb the water, you‚Äôve got 2lbs of noodles for $1. Commercially, they buy them much cheaper than that even. Noodles are incredibly cheap. Yet, you‚Äôre not really given enough sauce for them. Since pasta is so cheap, you‚Äôd think they could afford another 50 cents of sauce. The picture makes it look ok because it‚Äôs all on the top. It certainly looks like a decent amount of sauce. But you can‚Äôt see the noodle to sauce ratio. Also, I assume they have a pre-specified ladle size they are told to use. However, mix things up (or eat the top portion), and you‚Äôll quickly find yourself eating plain noodles. Again, I‚Äôm sure this is a corporate thing, and not location specific, but you‚Äôre reading my review because you want an honest review, right? So, I‚Äôm going to tell my experience as it was. Over all, I‚Äôm giving it 4 stars still, as service is good, breadsticks are wonderful, and food was pretty good, aside from the lack of sauce. Go in there prepared with this info, and see what you think. And remember, those wonderful breadsticks... they are unlimited. They will keep bringing more if you want. And, you‚Äôll likely want them to.
title: Fazoli's

text: We go there for breakfast every now n then when heading to the Flea Market and the food is always very good however we noticed that the coffee mugs are not cleaned very well and are very dirty. Hopefully someone from the restaurant will see this review and clean them much better. I couldn‚Äôt finish my coffee because of that.
title: Chesapeake Country Kitchen

text: I've eaten there, and now I work there. So I get to see the food "behind the scenes". Most, if not all, is homemade in the sense that whoever the cook is, they will cook it their own way with their own ingredients like they would in their own home. So you get to try the same food about 4 to 5 different ways which I think is pretty awesome. The cooks take allergy warnings very seriously. The owners come in pretty much every day to make sure we dont stray off of the path that they made to build this restaurant and its food upon. We have SO many return customers that when they're off work they will hang out with us from open to close. We strive to be extra friendly and helpful! And our MANY return customers can verify.  We have 2 flat screens to watch your sports on or for your child to watch cartoons so you can eat with some peace (lol). Our food is great tasting. Certain waitresses will buy 4 to 5 bowls of homemade cream of crab soup to take home for the night. As an example. So if we trust the food enough to eat it AND buy it in bulk, I'm sure you will love your dinner! Since I started working 1 month ago, I have yet to hear not even one complaint. If I work somewhere that's not all that good, I'm not afraid to say so. So I promise I'm not on here because anyone told me to, or to try to gain more customers etc. I simply rated it because my phone noticed how often I come here and asked me to review it LOL. Dont be afraid to give it a try. The portions range from "good size for the money" to "Massive"! We are located inside the Laurel De Truck Stop/gas station with the Hardees hooked to it. Come say hello if you've seen this review and I happen to be worki g when you come in! My name is Alyssa & I cant wait to meet yall!
title: Chesapeake Country Kitchen

text: So here's the deal.  The first time I ate at this spot was last month I got the steak hoagie and my bf got the BBQ chicken hoagie.  Both were amazing. No onions, and I paid 13 bux for this burger. Next, you definitely have to work on a different way of delivering the fries.  They get soggie in plastic containers.  Some places use paper bags. title: BullDawg's Burgers

text:
If you have a healthy appetite you gotta check out BullDawg's Burgers....and ask for Mike....who happens to be the Owner.

Mike is very personable and friendly he greeted me as soon as I walked in the door.....in other words he made me feel welcomed immediately and things only got better from there!

The food...all I can say is....OH MY GOODNESS!!!!! I ordered a chocolate shake (no whipped cream  HUMONGOUS BURGER and loaded fries and I was in delicious food heaven!!!

If you are located in Pittsburgh or ever find yourself visiting Pittsburgh make a bee line to BullDawg's Burgers and ask for Mike.......tell him The Disabled Vet sent ya'!!!!!!!

100% guarantee you won't leave hungry!

title: BullDawg's Burgers

text:
Pretty decent little sandwich shop. They have hoagies, cheesesteaks, burgers, wings, and almost any other American type food. Tonight, I saw they had a great deal on Uber Eats offering buy 1 get one 1 free on select items. I decided to try the classic Philly cheesesteak, which also came with their hand cut fries (you also have the option of substituting chicken for steak).

The cheesesteak was about $12.50 each, which I think is an okay price. Portion size is decent too, not too big nor too small. I will say that there was quite a lot of bread in comparison to the meat, cheese, and vegetables. I believe the bun was too thick. The steak itself was pretty flavorful and had a good texture. They use an adequate amount of cheese. Good amount of mushrooms, and each mushroom is quite big, but they do have a slight canned flavor.

The fries were just okay. Quality probably declined due to them being in the car for delivery. Still, they were not bad, and definitely nice to get fries for free. As usual, I would have wanted a bit more salt or pepper, and they were a bit limp.

All in all, not a bad spot for a sandwich, wings, or other classic American fare. The cheesesteak was still enjoyable, just nothing special. I do appreciate the deal they had going on with Uber Eats, though.
title: BullDawg's Burgers

text: I ordered the Southern Burger and fries and the flavor is amazing and the bbq sauce is great! Love this place so far! From Toledo Ohio
title: BullDawg's Burgers

text: Grandkids had a blast. Didn't get to see a few of the animals bc of the cold weather. Staff was friendly. Would highly recommend. It's a fun getaway for a few hours.
title: Frank Buck Zoo

text:
This is a small zoo named after a famous explorer. You can walk around the whole zoo in about 45min. Even though it is a small zoo it feels bigger than it really is.
Priced inexpensive for family budgeting!
I like the fact you get a wrist band to wear all day because if you want to have picnic in park or eat nearby you can come back  same day. Although the lady in front didn't like us slipping in to look at 1 animal on end at 15min til closing. This zoo is short staffed and the trains dont run anymore.
It wasn't too crowded on a weekend  which made it is nice!
title: Frank Buck Zoo

text: This was such a cute little zoo. It was easy to navigate with the one way walking paths.  Perfect size for Littles to walk through comfortably without getting too tired. We had so much fun.
title: Frank Buck Zoo

text: There were several empty cages and no giraffes.  The cat exhibit stunk horribly, which I imagine is normal because....cats.   However, the rest of the animals that were there seemed happy and well cared for.  The walkways were well maintained as were all the bushes/plants... Except for the spot in the first picture.... Which gave  me a giggle (look at the sign).
title: Frank Buck Zoo

text: It's a nice inexpensive family outing. Pack the cooler and have a picnic at the park at the many picnic tables. Parking can get a little tight but a goodtime.
title: Frank Buck Zoo

text: Visited this place 4 years ago and again a couple days ago. Kid enjoyed the goat petting area. Has a nice deck at the entrance to enjoy your food watching the Flamingos. It's economical and well maintained.
title: Frank Buck Zoo

text: A great place to take kids where you're not walking all day. A lot of animals weren't out but thats expected when its 100 degrees out. They have little farm animals and machines with food where you can feed and pet them. My kiddos loved it here. They even have a train to ride around in but its $2 cash only. There is a water park next to them for an even more fun day for the kids.
title: Frank Buck Zoo

text: We took the grandbabies (ages 8 and 2) and arrived around 11:30am. Park opens at 10.  It‚Äôs a nice little zoo but most of the animals were not out. The kids were mostly upset cause they didn‚Äôt get to see the giraffes. Price is reasonable if we would of gotten to see the animals. But to just walk around not so good. Plus there was no feed in the feed machine for the goats so they didn‚Äôt get to feed them either. Was a disappointment.
title: Frank Buck Zoo

text:
My kids and I enjoyed during our trip in Frank Buck Zoo in Gainesville. We saw animals we never saw before like the Cayote, Camel, Red Fox and more.
The zoo is small but it is way better than the one in Nashville, TN. Lol. My kids loves animals. We went to Nashville Zoo Aug 27 a week before we move back here in Texas... nothing to see in that zoo! Lol only few animals.
Finally back in Texas and we Went to Frank Buck Zoo Sept. 24 and we get more excited üòÅ
Great experience üëç üëå
title: Frank Buck Zoo

text:
Frank Buck Zoo is a nice small zoo.  It took about two hours to walk the zoo. Our seven year old grandson had a great time.  They have nice restrooms just inside the entrance.
We went on a Sunday morning and it was not crowded.
title: Frank Buck Zoo

text: Very small zoo. Hardly any animals. It's still a nice place to venture out with your family. They also have a park located right out in front of it, which was really nice for the kids. Definitely could have been better, but this is coming from someone who regularly goes to Dallas and FW Zoos.
title: Frank Buck Zoo

text: We love this zoo. It's not BIG, but they have a nice variety of animals. We bought season passes and drive the 1 hour at least once a month. We have taken family a few times and they loved it too.
title: Frank Buck Zoo

text: this zoo was super cute. my family really enjoyed it!
title: Frank Buck Zoo

text: My husband and I had a great time at Frank Buck and really enjoyed seeing some animals we hadn't seen before in addition to familiar faces. The zoo is very clean and the animals have very spacious enclosures that allow visitors to see them up close. We will be back to bring our daughter here soon!
title: Frank Buck Zoo

text: My first time at this zoo for me and my nephew Ray..He enjoyed and I loved it..We picked a great day to come because it wasn't crowded.I noticed some animals we're missing but other than that;we had a great time..
title: Frank Buck Zoo

text: Great little zoo with well kept animals. The zoo is really well kept and they have a really good variety of animals. Their cages were clean and they all seemed happy and well-fed. The whole zoo isn't very big but definitely worth the price. The customer service is what needs a little work. Some of the employees were great and very friendly while others seemed to be bothered by questions. I also didn't like that there was only one very small restroom in the very beginning. But, overall a great ace to visit for a few hours. Also, as everyone has noted the free castle playground in the front is a major plus. The kids loved running around in it after the zoo visit.
title: Frank Buck Zoo

text: I have been going to this zoo since being a child. It is a fantastic zoo especially for kids. It is not very busy at all, is small yet good, and affordable. Highly recommend it. There is also a train ride out front that is only $2 per person and a fantastic large playground for The kids. One of our favorite places to drive an hour away for.
title: Frank Buck Zoo

text: I love this zoo.  It is the perfect size for small children.  Have taken my Preschool classes there many times and it has always been such fun and such a wonderful educational experience.
title: Frank Buck Zoo

text: Affordable entrance fee. We were on a road trip from Lawton OK to Dallas Tx and this came up with my search. We have 3 hrs to kill before checking in the airport.  Entrance fee is $7. Spent around 2 hrs. My 2 yo toddler enjoyed it. There is an animal encounter with feeding goats. Infront of the zoo is a playground and picnic area where we had a picnic lunch. Highly recommended.
title: Frank Buck Zoo

text: Awesome zoo for a fraction of the price of a bigger zoo. My 2 yo loved it and had a blast. Less than 8 dollars for adults, 5 to feed the giraffes. Big park but not too big
title: Frank Buck Zoo

text: What a wonderful place with such a friendly staff! Took our grandbaby, and it was so easy and convenient. It's not too big and not too tiring! We will certainly be going back. We loved the lady that was telling us about the blue-tounged skink! Super friendly and informative
title: Frank Buck Zoo

text: First time visitor. Loved the zoo! The animals looked happy and well taken care of. The macaw sang to me. I missed the otter, he was hiding.
title: Frank Buck Zoo

text: Frank Buck Zoo was awesome, it was the perfect size for our two year old. It took around 2 hours to make it around the Zoo. There is also a great park on front of the Zoo.
title: Frank Buck Zoo

text: Beautiful little zoo, fun for the whole family!  We stopped by here it was a pleasant surprise! The price is very inexpensive $7 for adults, $5 for kids . They had a large variety of animals ;animals looked well taken care of and feed. Lots of sanitizing station theough out the zoo . Not many people around and not crowed at all. There is no place to buy food only a small gift shop. Recommend bringing a drink or buying one before you start at the front gift shop! The giraffe/zebra area has a beautiful covered deck that's high above the ground. Highly recommend stopping there the view, breeze is very nice! Took us about an 1hr 1/2 to finish the zoo so it is very small but worth your time to check it out.
title: Frank Buck Zoo

text:
Frank Buck Zoo is a definite 5 out of 5 experience. The entrance was cute and inviting. The Black Bears and Cheetahs were amazing to watch and experience so closely. My family loved watching the Otters perform acrobatic backflips. The zoo was well maintained and has clean Restrooms.
Although we weren‚Äôt able to see the giraffes we are excited to come back when the weather improves.
title: Frank Buck Zoo
